original: de lang dang nga'i zhes bya ba mngon du byas nas lus la sems pa ni chags pas so //
analyzed: de lang dang nga'i zhes bya ba mngon du byas nas lus la sems pa ni chags pas so //
translated: The mind is attached to the body because of the notion of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù that is manifested.

original: tshor ba mi sdug pa dang / rab tu ldan pa'i sems zhum pa nyid ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba mi sdug pa dang / rab tu ldan pa'i sems zhum pa nyid ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Sadness is the contraction of the mind associated with unpleasant sensation.

original: de bzhin du bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag @48b pa dang / rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyan po chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag @48b pa dang / rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyan po chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the application of mindfulness to sensation is the antidote to the error of pleasure; the application of mindfulness to mind is the antidote to the error of permanence; and the application of mindfulness to the factors is the antidote to the error of purity.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing bsgom pa la sogs pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed kyang gnas te /üîΩbrtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing bsgom pa la sogs pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed kyang gnas te / brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One generates zeal, makes an effort, exerts vigor, controls the mind and makes it one-pointed in order to prevent the arising of evil, unwholesome factors which have not yet arisen, in order to cause the abandoning of evil, unwholesome factors which have already arisen, in order to produce wholesome factors which have not yet arisen, and in order to make wholesome factors which have already arisen remain, increase, develop and be fully completed.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: One generates zeal, makes an effort, exerts vigor, controls the mind and makes it one-pointed.üîΩOne generates zeal, makes an effort, exerts vigor, controls the mind and makes it one-pointed.

original: yang dag par 'jog cing tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / de mi spong ba dang / tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig gcig dang / gnyis dang / gnyis kyis gsungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog cing tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / de mi spong ba dang / tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig gcig dang / gnyis dang / gnyis kyis gsungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are the foundation of mindfulness of the body, the foundation of mindfulness of feeling, the foundation of mindfulness of thought, and the foundation of mindfulness of dharmas. üîΩThe four right efforts are the effort for the non-arising of evil and unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, the effort for the abandonment of evil and unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen, the effort for the arising of wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the effort for the abiding, non-disappearance, increase, and abundance of wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: The four bases of supernatural power are the base of supernatural power that is accompanied by the concentration of desire and the volitional formations of striving, the base of supernatural power that is accompanied by the concentration of energy and the volitional formations of striving, the base of supernatural power that is accompanied by the concentration of mind and the volitional formations of striving, and the base of supernatural power that is accompanied by the concentration of investigation and the volitional formations of striving.

original: de la mos pa ni byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa ni byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: Here, desire is the desire to act.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Concentration is one-pointedness of mind.

original: des nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pas na de ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pas na de ni 'du byed do //
translated: The volitional formations are the formative activity of the mind that is directed towards the abandonment of the defilements by means of that concentration.

original: de yod pas na de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pas na de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because of the existence of that, he is said to be 'endowed with it'.

original: gang des yon tan sna tshogs bsgrubs pas na rkang pa'o //
analyzed: gang des yon tan sna tshogs bsgrubs pas na rkang pa'o //
translated: The bases are the feet because of the accomplishment of various qualities by means of them.

original: de'i yan lag yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i yan lag yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the limbs of that.

original: sgom mo zhes bya ba'i sgom pa ni goms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgom mo zhes bya ba'i sgom pa ni goms par byed pa ste /
translated: Meditation is the repeated practice of that.

original: sbyor ba rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rgyas pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the practice.

original: de yang sbyor ba las su rung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba las su rung ba nyid dam /
translated: Moreover, it is the flexibility of the practice,

original: sbyor ba brtan par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba brtan par gyur pa'am /
translated: the stability of the practice,

original: mi dge ba'i tshogs dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i tshogs dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: and the practice that is not mixed with the accumulation of nonvirtue.

original: sgom pa yang chos mngon pa bdag rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
analyzed: sgom pa yang chos mngon pa bdag rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
translated: The Abhidharma masters assert that meditation has two types:

original: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnam pa gsum dang / bcos ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / mthong ba'i chos de nyid la bde bar gnas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnam pa gsum dang / bcos ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / mthong ba'i chos de nyid la bde bar gnas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the small, medium, and great, which are the three types; the result that is free from fabrication; the result that is the natural outcome; and the result of abiding in comfort in this very life.

original: gzhan dag ni bzhir 'dod de sgom pa rnam par bsgom pa ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bzhir 'dod de sgom pa rnam par bsgom pa ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Others assert that there are four types: the meditation of the body is the meditation of complete training.

original: yongs su sbyangs pa bsgom pa ni tshul khrims kyi'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs pa bsgom pa ni tshul khrims kyi'o //
translated: The meditation of ethics is the meditation of complete purification.

original: gnod pa med pa ni sems kyi'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ni sems kyi'o //
translated: The meditation of the mind is the meditation of nonviolence.

original: ma lus par brten pa bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ma lus par brten pa bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The meditation of wisdom is the meditation of complete reliance.

original: dben pa la gnas pa bsam gtan dang po dang ldan par gyur pas des 'dod pa la sogs pa las rnam par dben pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod @49a * //
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa bsam gtan dang po dang ldan par gyur pas des 'dod pa la sogs pa las rnam par dben pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'dod @49a * //
translated: He is endowed with the first meditation, which is a state of solitude, because it is a state of solitude from sense-desire, etc.

original: chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan par gyur pas des rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan par gyur pas des rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is endowed with the second meditation, which is a state of detachment, because it is a state of detachment from conceptualization, etc.

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan par gyur ba ste /
translated: He is endowed with the third meditation, which is a state of cessation,

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni de 'gag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni de 'gag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cessation of joy is a cessation.

original: rnam par spong ba yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ci rigs par ldan par shes pa sngon du 'gro bas dor bya bsal bas na rnam par spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par spong ba yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / gzugs med pa dang ci rigs par ldan par shes pa sngon du 'gro bas dor bya bsal bas na rnam par spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is endowed with the fourth meditation and the formless [absorptions], having previously known the accomplishment of the abandonment, which is called the accomplishment of the abandonment, because it is the abandonment of the object of abandonment.

original: yang bag la nyal ba yang dag par bcom pa ni dben pa'o //
analyzed: yang bag la nyal ba yang dag par bcom pa ni dben pa'o //
translated: Moreover, solitude is the complete destruction of the latent tendencies.

original: kun nas ldang ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The freedom from attachment is the freedom from attachment to the arising of the defilements.

original: kun tu sbyor ba yang dag par gcod pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba yang dag par gcod pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation is the cessation of the fetters.

original: nye bar len pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa ni rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa ni rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: The abandonment is the abandonment of all the appropriating aggregates.

original: yang chos mngon pa ba rnams ni dben pas na khams las dben pa'o //
analyzed: yang chos mngon pa ba rnams ni dben pas na khams las dben pa'o //
translated: The separation is the separation from the elements.

original: 'dod chags las bral bas na nyon mongs ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags las bral bas na nyon mongs ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The freedom from attachment is the freedom from the attachment of the defilements.

original: 'gog pas na las 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pas na las 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire is the desire for action.

original: rnam par spong bas na dngos po rnam par spong ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par spong bas na dngos po rnam par spong ba ste /
translated: The abandonment is the abandonment of things.

original: tshig thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ston pa yin no zhes chos mngon pa pa rnams 'chad do //
analyzed: tshig thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ston pa yin no zhes chos mngon pa pa rnams 'chad do //
translated: All these terms indicate nirvana, according to the Abhidharma masters.

original: dmigs pa la brten pa'i stobs kyis snga ma'i rten gtong ba ni rnam par spong ba zhes bya'o zhes gnas brtan sangs rgyas bshes gnyen gyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rab tu byed par bshad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa la brten pa'i stobs kyis snga ma'i rten gtong ba ni rnam par spong ba zhes bya'o zhes gnas brtan sangs rgyas bshes gnyen gyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rab tu byed par bshad do //
translated: The elder Buddhamitra explains in the ‚ÄúChapter on the Factors of Awakening‚Äù that ‚Äúthe power of the object‚Äù is the support for the previous, and ‚Äúabandonment‚Äù is the relinquishing of that support.

original: 'dir yang bdag gis ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhi ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang bdag gis ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhi ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: Here, the four kinds of antidotes to the four kinds of conceptual thought are the path of seeing.

original: de la rtog pa de rnams dang / dben pa la gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rtog pa de rnams dang / dben pa la gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The four kinds of conceptual thought and the four kinds of object are to be connected respectively with the four kinds of antidote, beginning with ‚Äúabiding in isolation.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the factors of awakening are subsumed by the path of seeing.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni dben pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni dben pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the first kind of conceptual thought, the conceptual thought that apprehends the object, is ‚Äúabiding in isolation.‚Äù

original: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spang bya rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spang bya rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the antidote that eliminates the object to be abandoned, which is the side of affliction that is the opposite of the side of purification.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: The antidote to the second conception of the apprehended is freedom from attachment.

original: des dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since aspiration for virtuous qualities is itself freedom from attachment.

original: 'dzin @49b pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin @49b pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po ni 'gog pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the first conception of the apprehender is cessation.

original: des bdag rang dbang can la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa ma lus par 'gog cing spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des bdag rang dbang can la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa ma lus par 'gog cing spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it completely stops and eliminates the conception of the self as autonomous and so on.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po ni rnam par spong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po ni rnam par spong ba ste /
translated: The antidote to the second conception of the apprehender is thorough abandonment.

original: des bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan ma sna tshogs dang / phung po la sogs pa ji lta ba nyid yongs su shes pas spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan ma sna tshogs dang / phung po la sogs pa ji lta ba nyid yongs su shes pas spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it abandons the various signs imputed as the self and it thoroughly understands the aggregates and so on.

original: de bzhin du dad pa la sogs pa lnga po dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pa la sogs pa lnga po dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po yin no //
translated: Similarly, the five such as faith are faculties since they control.

original: lnga po de dag nyid mi thub pa'i don gyis na stobs so //
analyzed: lnga po de dag nyid mi thub pa'i don gyis na stobs so //
translated: Those five are powers since they cannot be overcome.

original: dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The branches of the path of seeing are the seven branches of enlightenment: the branch of mindfulness, the branch of the investigation of phenomena, the branch of diligence, the branch of joy, the branch of pliancy, the branch of samadhi, and the branch of equanimity.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The eight branches of the noble path are right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samadhi.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin pa'i don gyis na lam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin pa'i don gyis na lam mo //
translated: The path is so called because it leads to the city of nirvana.

original: sgra ji bzhin shes pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa bcu gcig dang / mi shes pa kun shes pa la sogs pa'i dbang po dang / rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin shes pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa bcu gcig dang / mi shes pa kun shes pa la sogs pa'i dbang po dang / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: The eleven knowledges that are in accordance with the literal meaning, the faculties of knowing all that is not known and so on, and the conceptual and nonconceptual

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / skye ba dang / 'chi ba dang / lus su gyur pa'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dran pa rnams dang bcas pa dang / rjes su dran pa bcu po rnams dang /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / skye ba dang / 'chi ba dang / lus su gyur pa'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dran pa rnams dang bcas pa dang / rjes su dran pa bcu po rnams dang /
translated: the four analytical knowledges and so on, the meditative concentrations, the mindfulness of birth, death, and the food and drink that are the body, and the ten recollections.

original: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcu brgyad dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcu brgyad dang /
translated: the four analytical knowledges, the four meditative concentrations, the four formless states, the eight liberations, the eight sovereignties, the ten universal bases, the five higher faculties, the five governing powers, the seven limbs of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the four noble truths, the four means of collecting disciples, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the ten powers of the Tathagata, the four confidences, the four unhindered knowledges, the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang / gzhung gi tshogs brtsams pa dang ; bstan pa de dag ni lam gyi tshogs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang / gzhung gi tshogs brtsams pa dang ; bstan pa de dag ni lam gyi tshogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the aspects of non-apprehending all, and the compilation of the scriptures. These should be known as the accumulations of the path.

original: chos de dang de dag thams cad mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dang de dag thams cad mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all those dharmas are included in the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: sa'i tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa bcur 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa bcur 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The collection of grounds should be understood as tenfold, by way of the divisions of the bodhisattva grounds that are being purified.üîΩ

original: gang yang rab @50a * //
analyzed: gang yang rab @50a * //
translated: The accumulations are to be known as tenfold, according to the analysis of the purification of the stages of the bodhisattva.

original: 'byor khyod ji skad du /
analyzed: 'byor khyod ji skad du /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you have asked

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: how the bodhisattva, the great being, who has set out in the Great Vehicle,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar ba yin zhe na /
translated: practices the perfections and progresses from stage to stage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang ; 'ong ba bkag pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang ; 'ong ba bkag pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the coming and going of all phenomena is stopped.

original: yangs gang la chos du zhig yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩrnam pa bcus sa dang po yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
analyzed: yangs gang la chos du zhig yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur zhe na / rnam pa bcus sa dang po yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
translated: In what does one purify what?üîΩThe first stage is purified by ten purifications.

original: yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
translated: By ten purifications

original: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te //
translated: one attains the first stage.üîΩThe nature of thought and benefit,

original: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
analyzed: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
translated: the equality of thought toward beings,

original: gtong dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas bkur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
analyzed: gtong dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas bkur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
translated: teaching the Dharma, and the words of truth.

original: tshig ni bcu po yin par 'dod //
analyzed: tshig ni bcu po yin par 'dod //
translated: These are considered the ten.

original: 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas //üîΩyongs su sbyong bar shes par bya //
analyzed: 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas // yongs su sbyong bar shes par bya //
translated: Since their nature is not observed,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they should be known as thoroughly purified.

original: mdo las ji skad du lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyong ba mtshan ma mi dmigs pa nye bar gzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyong ba mtshan ma mi dmigs pa nye bar gzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As a sutra declares, ‚ÄúThe purification of superior intention is the yoga of nonobservation, and the purification of beneficial things is the apprehension of the nonobservation of signs.‚Äù

original: rnam pa brgyad kyis ni sa gnyis pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyis ni sa gnyis pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
translated: The second stage is purified by eight aspects.

original: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
analyzed: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
translated: Morality, gratitude, patience,

original: rab tu dga' dang snying rje che //
analyzed: rab tu dga' dang snying rje che //
translated: great joy, great compassion,

original: bkur sti gus par nyan pa dang // brgyad pa sbyin la sogs par brtson //
analyzed: bkur sti gus par nyan pa dang // brgyad pa sbyin la sogs par brtson //
translated: and striving at generosity and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la byas pa gzo ba ni chung du byas pa las lhag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la byas pa gzo ba ni chung du byas pa las lhag par byed pa ste /
translated: Among these, being grateful is to act in excess of what was done for you.

original: chud mi gson pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chud mi gson pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not wasted.

original: rnam pa lngas ni sa gsum pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni sa gsum pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
translated: In five ways, the third ground is purified.

original: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
analyzed: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
translated: Being insatiable in listening,üîΩgiving the teaching without material desire,üîΩpurifying the entire buddha field,üîΩnot being discouraged by samsara,

original: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba //üîΩrlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga //
analyzed: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba // rlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga //
translated: and having a sense of shame and decency.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These five are said to be without conceit.

original: rnam pa bcus sa bzhi pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus sa bzhi pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
translated: In ten ways, the fourth ground is purified.

original: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang // sbyangs pa yang dag sdom bsten dang / bslab pa yongs su mi gtong @50b dang ; /'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan las 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
analyzed: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang // sbyangs pa yang dag sdom bsten dang / bslab pa yongs su mi gtong @50b dang ; /'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan las 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
translated: condemning desire, renouncing all,

original: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
analyzed: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
translated: not shrinking from the profound, and not being attached to a view.

original: ji skad du mdo las //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las //
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: dgon pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHe delights in living in the forest and in having few desires.‚Äù

original: de la 'dod pa chung ba ni gang ma rnyed pa'i rnyed par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa chung ba ni gang ma rnyed pa'i rnyed par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: There, having few desires means not desiring to get what one has not yet obtained.

original: chog shes pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa las lhag par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chog shes pa ni ji ltar rnyed pa las lhag par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Being satisfied means not desiring more than what one has obtained.

original: rnam pa bcus ni sa lnga pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus ni sa lnga pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
translated: The fifth stage is purified by ten aspects.üîΩAttachment to friends and family,

original: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
analyzed: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
translated: dwelling in a place of distraction,

original: bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / yid gnyis dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
analyzed: bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / yid gnyis dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
translated: doubt, and the afflictions.

original: bcu po 'di ni rnam spangs nas //
analyzed: bcu po 'di ni rnam spangs nas //
translated: Having abandoned these ten,

original: sa ni lnga pa yang dag 'thob //üîΩces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa ni lnga pa yang dag 'thob // ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: one attains the fifth ground.

original: rlom pa nyid ni khengs pa ste /
analyzed: rlom pa nyid ni khengs pa ste /
translated: Conceit is arrogance,

original: mtho ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: the attitude of superiority, etc.

original: rnam pa drug gis ni sa drug pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa drug gis ni sa drug pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
translated: By six aspects, the sixth ground is purified.

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: Generosity, morality, patience,

original: bsam gtan shes rab rab rdzogs pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab rab rdzogs pa //
translated: effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba'i mdo ni ji skad du //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdo ni ji skad du //
translated: The sutra says:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩslob ma dang ni bse ru la //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // slob ma dang ni bse ru la //
translated: ‚ÄúThe six perfections should be completed.‚ÄùüîΩThe bodhisattva who is on the sixth ground,üîΩhaving abandoned the attitude of delight and fear

original: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs pa //
analyzed: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs pa //
translated: toward disciples and rhinoceroses,üîΩnot discouraged when asked,

original: slong na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
analyzed: slong na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
translated: gives away all possessions.

original: btang yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slob pa mi spong bas //
analyzed: btang yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slob pa mi spong bas //
translated: Even if he is poor, he does not abandon the training.

original: sa ni drug pa yang dag thob //üîΩcas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa ni drug pa yang dag thob // cas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus he attains the sixth stage.

original: ji skad du mdo las //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las //
translated: As a scripture declares,

original: nyan thos 'dod pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos 'dod pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe thought of the disciples must be abandoned.

original: rang sangs rgyas 'dod pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas 'dod pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: The thought of the solitary sages must be abandoned.

original: 'khor ba la skrag pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba la skrag pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The thought of fear of the lifecycle must be abandoned.‚Äù

original: dbye ba nyi shus sa bdun pa yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba nyi shus sa bdun pa yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: The seventh stage is purified by twenty kinds of discrimination.üîΩThe bodhisattva should discriminate the self and sentient beings,üîΩlife, person, annihilation and permanence,

original: bdag dang sems can 'dzin pa dang // srog dang gang zag chad rtags dang // mtshan ma rgyu dang phung po dang // khams dang skye mched dag dang ni //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can 'dzin pa dang // srog dang gang zag chad rtags dang // mtshan ma rgyu dang phung po dang // khams dang skye mched dag dang ni //
translated: signs, causes, aggregates,üîΩelements, and sense fields.

original: khams gsum pa la chags gnas dang // sems ni kun tu zhum pa dang // dkon mchog gsum dang tshul khrims dang // der lta ba la mngon zhen dang // stong pa nyid la rtsod pa dang // de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ni //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la chags gnas dang // sems ni kun tu zhum pa dang // dkon mchog gsum dang tshul khrims dang // der lta ba la mngon zhen dang // stong pa nyid la rtsod pa dang // de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ni //
translated: Attachment to the three realms,üîΩthe mind being completely deflated,üîΩclinging to the three jewels, ethics,üîΩand the view of them,üîΩarguing about emptiness,üîΩand the faults that contradict it,

original: nyi shu @51a * //üîΩgang la rnam chad pa //
analyzed: nyi shu @51a * // gang la rnam chad pa //
translated: 1. Attachment to the three realms, 2. Abiding in the three realms, 3. Depression of mind, 4. Discouragement, 5. Disrespect for the Three Jewels, 6. Clinging to morality and asceticism, 7. Clinging to one‚Äôs own view, 8. Clinging to one‚Äôs own conduct, 9. Clinging to the Sa·πÖgha, 10. Clinging to the scriptures, 11. Clinging to the meditative absorptions, 12. Clinging to the immeasurables, 13. Clinging to the formless meditative attainments, 14. Clinging to the superknowledges, 15. Clinging to the fruits of the spiritual life, 16. Clinging to the levels, 17. Clinging to the powers, 18. Clinging to the factors of enlightenment, 19. Clinging to the path, and 20. Clinging to the result.

original: de yis sa ni bdun pa thob //üîΩces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yis sa ni bdun pa thob // ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These are the twenty faults that are incompatible with the seventh ground.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is free from theseüîΩattains the seventh ground.

original: gang gis dri ma nyi shu rnam par spangs pas sa bdun pa gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis dri ma nyi shu rnam par spangs pas sa bdun pa gnon pa yin no //
translated: By abandoning these twenty faults, one ascends to the seventh ground.

original: yang de nyid la rnam pa nyi shus yin te /
analyzed: yang de nyid la rnam pa nyi shus yin te /
translated: Moreover, one ascends to the seventh ground by means of twenty aspects.

original: rnam thar sgo gsum shes pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag nyid dang // snying rjes rlom pa med pa dang // chos mnyam nyid dang tshul gcig shes //
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum shes pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag nyid dang // snying rjes rlom pa med pa dang // chos mnyam nyid dang tshul gcig shes //
translated: 1. Knowing the three doors of liberation, 2. Knowing the three spheres to be pure, 3. Not being conceited due to compassion, 4. Knowing the sameness and single method of phenomena,

original: mi skye ba la bzod ba dang // chos rnams rnam pa gcig ston pa //
analyzed: mi skye ba la bzod ba dang // chos rnams rnam pa gcig ston pa //
translated: 5. Patience with the nonarising of phenomena, 6. Teaching the single aspect of phenomena,

original: rtog pa kun tu 'joms pa dang // 'du shes lta dang nyon mongs spong //
analyzed: rtog pa kun tu 'joms pa dang // 'du shes lta dang nyon mongs spong //
translated: 7. Completely destroying conceptualization, 8. Abandoning the view of discriminations and afflictions,üîΩ9. Not abandoning sentient beings, 10. Not abandoning samsara,üîΩ11. Not being attached to nirvana, 12. Not being attached to cyclic existence,üîΩ13. Not being attached to the uncompounded, 14. Not being attached to the compounded,üîΩ15. Not being attached to the transcendent, 16. Not being attached to the mundane,üîΩ17. Not being attached to the supramundane, 18. Not being attached to the supramundane,üîΩ19. Not being attached to the conditioned, and 20.

original: zhi gnas nges bar sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa dang // sems dul ba dang thams cad la //
analyzed: zhi gnas nges bar sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa dang // sems dul ba dang thams cad la //
translated: The bodhisattva is skilled in the means of achieving mental stability,üîΩin the means of achieving insight,üîΩin the means of disciplining the mind, and in the means of achieving all the qualities of a buddha.

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang // chags pa'i sa min gar 'dod par //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang // chags pa'i sa min gar 'dod par //
translated: 1. He is intent on calm abiding, skilled in profound insight, his mind is disciplined, and he has unobstructed knowledge of everything.üîΩ2. He is not on the level of attachment, and he goes to other fields wherever he wishes.

original: zhing gzhan du ni mnyam 'gro dang // kun tu bdag gi ngo bo ni //
analyzed: zhing gzhan du ni mnyam 'gro dang // kun tu bdag gi ngo bo ni //
translated: 3. He manifests his own body everywhere, and he is the teacher himself.

original: ston pa nyid dang nyi shu'o //üîΩzhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa nyid dang nyi shu'o // zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: These are the twenty qualities.

original: ji skad du mdo las ;
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las ;
translated: As it is said in the sutra:üîΩThe divisions of emptiness, the realization of signlessness, the wisdom of wishlessness, and compassion,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du byas pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ye shes dang / brtse ba ni snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du byas pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ye shes dang / brtse ba ni snying rje ba'o //
translated: which is love.

original: de dag dang rlom pa med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang rlom pa med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He is without pride with regard to these and so forth.

original: de la snying rje ni skal ba dman pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la snying rje ni skal ba dman pa rnams la'o //
translated: Compassion is for those of lesser fortune.

original: phan gdags pa'i dus la rtog pa'i bsam pas snying rje bya ba dang ldan pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la phan gdags pas bsdu bar sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i dus la rtog pa'i bsam pas snying rje bya ba dang ldan pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la phan gdags pas bsdu bar sbyor ba yin no //
translated: He is engaged in the collection of those who are fortunate, who are endowed with the practice of compassion, which is the thought that considers the time for helping others.

original: dbye ba rnam pa bzhis sa brgyad pa yongs su spyod do //
analyzed: dbye ba rnam pa bzhis sa brgyad pa yongs su spyod do //
translated: He practices the eighth stage by means of four kinds of preeminence.

original: yang rnam pa bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are four kinds of preeminence:üîΩknowing the minds of all beings,üîΩplaying with the superknowledges,üîΩpurifying the buddhaverse,

original: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzangs bsgrub pa dang // sangs rgyas bsten dang dbang po shes //üîΩzhing gi sbyong ba sgyu ma yi //
analyzed: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzangs bsgrub pa dang // sangs rgyas bsten dang dbang po shes // zhing gi sbyong ba sgyu ma yi //
translated: and serving the buddhas.üîΩThe attainment of the illusionlike concentrationüîΩis the purification of the realm.üîΩTaking on lives as one wishes

original: ting nge 'dzin ni thob pa dang // bsams bzhin srid pa len pa dang // las ni rnam pa brgyad du 'dod //üîΩces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni thob pa dang // bsams bzhin srid pa len pa dang // las ni rnam pa brgyad du 'dod // ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: is considered to be the eighth activity.

original: zhing sbyong zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi ste /
analyzed: zhing sbyong zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi ste /
translated: The purification of the realm is the purification of the world of beings, the world of the container.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta bu'o //
translated: The world of beings is like the buddhaverse of the bodhisattva Manjushri.

original: chos rnam pa bcu gnyis bsgrubs pas sa dgu pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
analyzed: chos rnam pa bcu gnyis bsgrubs pas sa dgu pa yongs su sbyong ba yin te /
translated: The ninth ground is thoroughly purified by accomplishing twelve aspects of Dharma.üîΩEndless prayers,üîΩunderstanding the languages of gods and so on,üîΩconfidence like a river,

original: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa chu bo lta bu @51b dang ; / mngal du 'jug pa'i mchog dang ni //
analyzed: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa chu bo lta bu @51b dang ; / mngal du 'jug pa'i mchog dang ni //
translated: the supreme entry to the womb,üîΩlineage, clan, family,

original: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye gnas dag dang ni //
analyzed: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye gnas dag dang ni //
translated: retinue, birthplace,

original: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyis //
analyzed: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyis //
translated: renunciation, and the tree of enlightenment

original: yon tan phun tshogs rdzogs ba yin //
analyzed: yon tan phun tshogs rdzogs ba yin //
translated: are the perfection of excellent qualities.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: sa bcu ba nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa nye bar gnas pas de la de bzhin gshegs par brjod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs su chud pa las dgongs pa ma
analyzed: sa bcu ba nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa nye bar gnas pas de la de bzhin gshegs par brjod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs su chud pa las dgongs pa ma
translated: The tenth ground itself is called the tathagata stage because the deeds of a tathagata are present for sentient beings.

original: yin no // sa dang po la sogs pa de dag gi yang yongs su sbyong ba'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: yin no // sa dang po la sogs pa de dag gi yang yongs su sbyong ba'i chos bstan te /
translated: The qualities that purify the first and other grounds are taught.

original: de la bshad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bshad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the explanation?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It is the chapter on the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva‚Äôs purification of superior intention, up to

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: the chapter on the ten bodhisattva stages.

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid re re nas mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bstan to //
translated: Each of their characteristics is taught as non-apprehensible.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the ten bodhisattva stages?

original: sa dgu las shin tu 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: sa dgu las shin tu 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Having transcended the nine stages, one enters the stage of buddhahood.

original: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni //
analyzed: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni //
translated: The wisdom by which one transcends the nine stages

original: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //üîΩde ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa // de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
translated: and abides in the stage of buddhahood,üîΩthat is to be known as

original: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: the tenth bodhisattva stage.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de las dgu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las dgu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the nine are as follows:

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa ni dad pa dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa yin no //
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa ni dad pa dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa yin no //
translated: The stage of seeing white appearances is the stage of faith, following the Dharma, and engaging in devotion.

original: de la rigs kyi sa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi sa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The stage of lineage is the characteristic of the lineage of the disciples and so on.

original: de la yang brgyad pa'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang po yin no //
analyzed: de la yang brgyad pa'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang po yin no //
translated: The stage of the eighth is the first stage of the result of the stream-enterer.

original: de la yang mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa yin no //
translated: The stage of seeing is the stage of the stream-enterer.

original: de la yang bsrabs pa'i sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang bsrabs pa'i sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa yin no //
translated: The stage of thinning is the stage of the once-returner.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni de yang phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni de yang phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa yin no //
translated: The stage of separation from attachment is the stage of the non-returner.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa ni de yang dgra bcom pa'i sa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa ni de yang dgra bcom pa'i sa yin no //
translated: The stage of the realized is the stage of the arhat.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang rnam pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang rnam pa dgu yin no //
translated: The stage of the solitary realizers and the stage of the bodhisattvas are the ninth.

original: sa'i tshogs bstan nas gnyen po'i tshogs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sa'i tshogs bstan nas gnyen po'i tshogs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the collection of stages, now the collection of antidotes will be explained.

original: mthong dang goms pa'i sa dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang goms pa'i sa dag la //
translated: On the stages of seeing and cultivation,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i dbye ba rnams //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i dbye ba rnams //
translated: the divisions of apprehendeds and apprehenders

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: are for the sake of pacification.

original: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
translated: The antidotes are said to be eightfold.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: de la yang rnam par rtog pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de la yang rnam par rtog pa brgyad do //
translated: And there are eight kinds of discrimination.

original: @52a * // 'di dag ni re zhig mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: @52a * // 'di dag ni re zhig mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four kinds of discrimination that are adverse to the path of vision.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the discrimination of the apprehended is twofold:

original: dngos po'i rten can dang / gnyen po'i rten can no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rten can dang / gnyen po'i rten can no //
translated: based on the object and based on the counteragent.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The discrimination of the apprehender is also twofold:

original: gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can dang / skyes bu btags bar yod pa'i rten can no //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can dang / skyes bu btags bar yod pa'i rten can no //
translated: based on the substantial person and based on the nominal person.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang bzhi po kho na yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang bzhi po kho na yin no //
translated: The adverse elements of the path of cultivation are also fourfold.üîΩThe discrimination of the apprehended is twofold:

original: dngos po'i rnam pa tsam gyi rten can dang / gnyen po'i rnam pa'i rten can te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa tsam gyi rten can dang / gnyen po'i rnam pa'i rten can te /
translated: based on the mere aspect of the object and based on the aspect of the counteragent.

original: rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The discrimination of the apprehender is also twofold:

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad btags pa'i rten can dang / btags pa de'i mtshan ma'i rten can te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad btags pa'i rten can dang / btags pa de'i mtshan ma'i rten can te /
translated: based on the nominal person of all noble persons and based on the sign of that nominal person.

original: rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Two kinds.

original: rnam par rtog ba de dag ni khams gsum ka'i yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog ba de dag ni khams gsum ka'i yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that these conceptualizations are of the three realms.

original: rab 'byor khyod kyis gang 'di skad du de gang las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni khams gsum las nges bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod kyis gang 'di skad du de gang las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni khams gsum las nges bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subh≈´ti, as for what you said, ‚ÄúWhere will it come forth from?‚Äù it will come forth from the three realms.

original: gang gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: gang gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of nonduality is where it will abide in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ji ltar gnas par 'gyur ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gnyis mthong ba dang / sgom pa gnyis kyi mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par mi rtog pa la sbyor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas par 'gyur ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gnyis mthong ba dang / sgom pa gnyis kyi mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par mi rtog pa la sbyor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúIt will be connected to nonconceptuality by the yoga of nonapprehending the two, the seeing and the cultivation that are the discordant classes of that abiding‚Äù is that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyi ga yang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyi ga yang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Those two dharmas, the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects, are neither conjoined nor disjoined, and so on.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is neither endowed nor not endowed.

original: gzugs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de la mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de la mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang po'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúthe formless,‚Äù etc., the first conceptual thought of the path of vision is refuted. The realm of phenomena, suchness, the perfect limit, the inconceivable realm,

original: nam mkha' dang / spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings rnams dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa dang / phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings rnams dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa dang / phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: space, abandonment, the realm of freedom from desire, non-arising, cessation, the aggregates, the sense bases, the elements, etc., are not tenable as the escape. Therefore, phenomena that are without characteristics are asserted to be the escape.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba @52b mi 'thad pas mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba @52b mi 'thad pas mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, since it is not tenable that the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on definitely emerge, the assertion that signless phenomena emerge is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates such as form and so on are empty of form and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa bkag pas rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pa bkag pas rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang /
translated: Since the assertion that the emptiness of those, the definite emergence from the three realms, and the state of omniscience are refuted, the assertion that dreams, mirages, illusions, echoes, optical illusions,

original: gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: reflections, and emanations definitely emerge is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba bkag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba bkag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their nature is blocked from definite emergence from the three realms, and because their nature is blocked from abiding in omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin de dag stong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin de dag stong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because their nature is emptiness.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams nges par 'byung bar gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams nges par 'byung bar gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: In order to counteract the second misconception about the object of the path of seeing, it is said that the perfections are not tenable as definite emergence, and so the abiding in the definite emergence of the dharmas without defining characteristics is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bkag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bkag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because their nature, definite emergence from the three realms, and omniscience are refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of those is emptiness.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams nges bar 'byung bar mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams nges par 'byung ba la gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams nges bar 'byung bar mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams nges par 'byung ba la gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: From the perspective of the apprehension of the path of seeing, the non-establishment of the arhats, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfect buddhas as the definite emergence is the refutation of the definite emergence of the phenomena without defining characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams de dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams de dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are empty of those.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: The definite emergence from the three realms and the definite emergence in the knowledge of all aspects are refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are empty of their own intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i @53a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i @53a * //
translated: In the same way, the nature of the fruit of stream-enterer,

original: 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: and of individual enlightenment, and of the knowledge of all modes, is empty.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas ming dang / mtshan ma dang / brda dang ; tha snyad dang / gdags pa rnams nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams nges par 'byung ba la gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas ming dang / mtshan ma dang / brda dang ; tha snyad dang / gdags pa rnams nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams nges par 'byung ba la gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: With the aim of countering the second kind of discrimination of the path of vision, he refutes the establishment of the non-discriminative dharmas as the going forth of names, signs, symbols, conventions, and designations, because the going forth of these is not tenable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni de rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are empty of them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / khams gsum las nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: He refutes the establishment of the emptiness of these as the going forth of the three realms and of the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their own natures are empty.

original: de la ming du btags pa ni 'du shes dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming du btags pa ni 'du shes dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Name is such things as ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù and ‚Äúperception.‚Äù

original: mtshan mar btags pa ni dngos po 'di ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar btags pa ni dngos po 'di ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sign is such things as ‚Äúform has the characteristic of being suitable as form.‚Äù

original: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Convention is such things as ‚Äúfeeling is the experience of an object.‚Äù

original: brdar btags pa ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas las skyes pa'i dbye bas sems can rnams rang gi skad dang brdar ji ltar grags pa'o //
analyzed: brdar btags pa ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas las skyes pa'i dbye bas sems can rnams rang gi skad dang brdar ji ltar grags pa'o //
translated: Convention is such things as ‚Äúsentient beings are born from the elements, migrations, and birth processes,‚Äù as is known in their own languages and conventions.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyi dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyi dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: All of these are also classified in three ways:

original: tha snyad dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad ji lta ji lta ba'i rjes su 'jug pa tsam nyid yin gyi don dam pa stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad ji lta ji lta ba'i rjes su 'jug pa tsam nyid yin gyi don dam pa stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: they are mere conventions, imputations, and conformations to conventions, but they are ultimately empty.

original: de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang ; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang ; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, it is taught that non-production, non-cessation, affliction, purification, and non-compoundedness are emptiness by nature.üîΩWith the aim of being an antidote to the conceptualization of apprehended objects on the path of cultivation, it is said:

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor khyod kyis gang 'di skad du de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes smras pa ni theg pa de gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de /üîΩrab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor khyod kyis gang 'di skad du de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes smras pa ni theg pa de gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de / rab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄúWhere will that vehicle stay?‚Äù That vehicle will not stay anywhere.üîΩSubh≈´ti, it is because all phenomena do not stay.

original: yang rab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad mi gnas par gnas pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad mi gnas par gnas pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, Subh≈´ti, it is because all phenomena do not stay, they stay in the yoga of non-abiding.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / skye ba @53b med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid theg pa chen po la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / skye ba @53b med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid theg pa chen po la gnas pa dang /
translated: the expanse of reality, nonarising, noncessation, nondefilement, nonpurity and the absence of any deliberate action are the Great Vehicle.üîΩ

original: mi gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: The expanse of reality, non-production, non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification, and the absence of activity are refuted as being the Great Vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams de dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams de dag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are empty of them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa la bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa la bkag pa yin no //
translated: Abiding and non-abiding are refuted as being emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo de dag stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because their own entities are empty of them.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa des gang zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni theg pa des gang yang nges par 'byung ba med
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa des gang zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni theg pa des gang yang nges par 'byung ba med
translated: From the perspective of the antidote to the second type of conceptualization that is an object of observation on the path of meditation, the sutra says, Subh≈´ti, you said, 'By that vehicle, someone will go forth.' By that vehicle, no one will go forth.

original: do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa de gang yin pa dang / gang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs na chos rnams las chos gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa de gang yin pa dang / gang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs na chos rnams las chos gang gis nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because in that way, that vehicle and those phenomena by which one would go forth are all nonexistent and non-apprehensible. By what phenomenon will someone go forth from phenomena?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa rnams shin tu rnam bar dag pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir dmigs su med do //
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa rnams shin tu rnam bar dag pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir dmigs su med do //
translated: Because self, sentient being, living being, and so on are taken to be utterly pure, they are non-apprehensible.

original: chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa rnams dang / phung po rnams nas ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams kyang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa rnams dang / phung po rnams nas ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams kyang /
translated: The dharma-element and so on, and the aggregates up to the unentangled dharmas,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir mi dmigs te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir mi dmigs te /
translated: are not apprehended because they are taken as extremely pure.

original: so sor rang gi ngo bor dmigs pa nye bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: so sor rang gi ngo bor dmigs pa nye bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They are not apprehended as individual entities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du dmigs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du dmigs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, the dharma-element is not apprehended, up to the unentangled dharmas are not apprehended.

original: 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa smos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mtshan shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir shin tu rnam par dag pa smos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mtshan shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the mention of ‚Äúextremely pure‚Äù is because it is the knowledge of the sign of the extremely pure path of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir dmigs su med do //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir dmigs su med do //
translated: From the perspective of the antidote to the conceptualization of grasping on the path of cultivation, they are not apprehended because they are taken as extremely pure, from the stream enterer up to the perfect buddha.

original: gang dag dmigs su med ce na /
analyzed: gang dag dmigs su med ce na /
translated: What is not apprehended?

original: rang gi ngo bo dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dmigs su med do //
translated: Their own nature is not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrab 'byor rgyun tu zhugs pa dmigs @54a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor rgyun tu zhugs pa dmigs @54a * //
translated: Why is that?üîΩSubh≈´ti, the stream enterer is not apprehended, and so on up to the perfect buddha is not apprehended.

original: su med do zhes bya ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: su med do zhes bya ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: All of that is taught by they are not apprehended because they are not apprehended.

original: sgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu rnams dang / dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang /
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad nas rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu rnams dang / dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang /
translated: The results of stream-enterer and so on, the ten grounds such as the Joyous, the ground of seeing what is white,

original: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams lam gyi 'bras bur gyur pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams lam gyi 'bras bur gyur pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the ground of lineage, the eighth ground, the ground of seeing, the ground of thinning, the ground of separation from desire, the ground of realizing what is to be done, the pratyekabuddha ground, and the buddha ground, all of which are the results of the path and the bases of imputation of all ƒÅrya persons, are not observed as the referents of those terms.

original: yang gang rnam par rtog pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gang rnam par rtog pa bzhi po sngar bstan pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the four conceptions that were previously explained are related to the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de ltar 'dir ni yang gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad pa'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir ni yang gnyen po'i dbang du mdzad pa'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, here, the eight kinds of conceptual differentiation are taught in terms of the antidotes.

original: snying rje la sogs pa 'di dag ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa 'di dag ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: These, compassion, etc., are called the stores because they are the cause of enlightenment.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las tshogs kyi bsgrub pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las tshogs kyi bsgrub pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the accomplishment of the stores in the treatise of the Ornament of Clear Realization, the instruction in the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe accomplishment of definite emergence should be explained after the accomplishment of the stores.

original: // / tshogs kyi bsgrub pa bshad nas nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / tshogs kyi bsgrub pa bshad nas nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The accomplishment of definite emergence is said to have eight aspects:üîΩThe object, the cause, the result,üîΩThe practice, the support,üîΩThe benefit, the entry,üîΩAnd the path of definite emergence.üîΩThe object of definite emergence is the three vehicles.üîΩThe cause of definite emergence is the stores.üîΩThe result of definite emergence is the attainment of the result of the sravaka and so on.üîΩThe practice of definite emergence is the practice of the perfections.üîΩThe support of definite emergence is the bodhisattva.

original: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don la 'bad med dang // shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang // thob pa'i nges par 'byung nyid dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid du //
