analyzed: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don la 'bad med dang // shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang // thob pa'i nges par 'byung nyid dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid du //
translated: The benefit of definite emergence is the benefit of sentient beings.üîΩThe entry of definite emergence is the entry into the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe path of definite emergence is the path of the unique vehicle.

original: nges bar 'byung ba'i lam nyid dang // rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid ni //üîΩnges 'byung bsgrub pa yin zhes bya //
analyzed: nges bar 'byung ba'i lam nyid dang // rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid ni //üîΩnges 'byung bsgrub pa yin zhes bya //
translated: The accomplishment of definite emergence is said to have eight aspects.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de la nges par 'byung ba'i bsgyur pa ni rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byung ba'i bsgyur pa ni rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Therein, the transformation of deliverance is eightfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba dang / sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba dang / lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba dang / sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba dang / lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang /
translated: The deliverance of the object, the deliverance of equality, the deliverance of the benefit of sentient beings, the spontaneous deliverance, the deliverance of complete purification,

original: thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba dang / lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba dang / lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: the deliverance of attainment, the deliverance of the knowledge of all things, and the deliverance of the path.

original: de la @54b ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la @54b ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the deliverance of the object is threefold:

original: mchog tu nges par 'byung ba dang / spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu nges par 'byung ba dang / spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / rtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: the deliverance of the supreme object, the deliverance of abandonment, and the deliverance of realization.

original: gang du mchog nyid nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: gang du mchog nyid nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the supreme object, the deliverance is as follows:

original: ji ltar 'di ltar de dang de //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ltar de dang de //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúHow is it that this is so?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and so on, up to

original: go cha chen po bgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i go cha'i bsgrub pa chen po nyid dang / theg pa chen po la yang zhon pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i che ba nyid dang / ci'i phyir go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba'i tshogs kyi bsgrub pa'i che ba nyid kyis 'di'i chen po rnam pa gsum po nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i go cha'i bsgrub pa chen po nyid dang / theg pa chen po la yang zhon pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i che ba nyid dang / ci'i phyir go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba'i tshogs kyi bsgrub pa'i che ba nyid kyis 'di'i chen po rnam pa gsum po nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe great armor is the great accomplishment of the armor of the bodhisattva, and ‚Äòmounted on the Great Vehicle‚Äô is the greatness of engagement. ‚ÄòWhy is it called the great armor?‚Äô is the greatness of the accomplishment of the accumulations. Thus, the greatness of the three kinds of greatness‚Äîthe accomplishment of renunciation and so on‚Äîis taught.

original: de ni 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This will be explained.üîΩ‚ÄúBlessed One, the so-called Great Vehicle surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba 'di ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur bas zhes gnas brten rab 'byor gyis nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa bstan nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba 'di ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur bas zhes gnas brten rab 'byor gyis nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the accomplishment of renunciation,

original: de nyid bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, these are the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / ma 'dres pa'i bar du ji skad bstan pa rnams theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / ma 'dres pa'i bar du ji skad bstan pa rnams theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba nas brtsams te /
translated: the six perfections, all the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, all the meditative stabilization gateways, all the emptinesses, the dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the unentangled dharmas, which are the Great Vehicle‚Äôs going forth, starting from the going forth of the bodhisattva great beings.üîΩSubh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄòThat Great Vehicle will surpass the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and go forth.‚Äô

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin /
translated: Subh≈´ti, if the desire realm were thus,

original: ma nor ba de bzhin /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin /
translated: unerring,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin te /
translated: not otherwise,

original: phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: and not distorted,

original: de kho na bden pa yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na bden pa yang dag pa ste /
translated: and if it were true, real,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rtag cing brtan la ther zug mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi dngos po zhig yin na theg pa chen po 'dis kyang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rtag cing brtan la ther zug mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi dngos po zhig yin na theg pa chen po 'dis kyang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a thing that was permanent, stable, eternal, not subject to change, this Great Vehicle would not surpass and go beyond the worlds of gods, humans, and titans.

original: gang gi phyir rab 'byor 'dod pa'i khams de rnam par rtag pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtag pa'i ma rig pas rnam par gzhag cing de ni rkyen gyi 'du byed kyis rnam par bsgrubs pa sred pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab 'byor 'dod pa'i khams de rnam par rtag pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtag pa'i ma rig pas rnam par gzhag cing de ni rkyen gyi 'du byed kyis rnam par bsgrubs pa sred pa dang /
translated: But, Subh≈´ti, the desire realm is said to be ‚Äúunreal‚Äù because it is established by the ignorance of false imagination, and it is accomplished by the conditioning of conditions. It is subject to the transformation of craving,üîΩgrasping,

original: len pa dang / @55a * //üîΩsrid pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: len pa dang / @55a * // srid pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
translated: and becoming.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this Great Vehicle surpasses and goes beyond the worlds of gods, humans, and titans.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten na grags pa tsam gyi don ji lta ba nyid ma yin pas mngon par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu'i theg pa chen po ni de la mngon par zhen pa'i bcings pan yid yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa tsam gyi don ji lta ba nyid ma yin pas mngon par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu'i theg pa chen po ni de la mngon par zhen pa'i bcings pan yid yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Great Vehicle of the result of realization is not the reality of the meaning that is merely renowned in the world. Therefore, the mind is said to be the bondage of clinging to that.

original: gzhan du na theg pa chen po gnyen po nyid ni don med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na theg pa chen po gnyen po nyid ni don med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, the Great Vehicle would be pointless as an antidote.

original: de la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa po dang / gnyi ga'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig dang po dang / bzhi pa dang / bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa po dang / gnyi ga'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig dang po dang / bzhi pa dang / bdun pa'o //
translated: With reference to that, the first, fourth, and seventh words are from the perspective of the object, the subject, and both.

original: gnyis pa gnyis ni snga ma dag gis bshad pa dag gi tshig yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pa gnyis ni snga ma dag gis bshad pa dag gi tshig yin la /
translated: The second two are words that explain the former.

original: de nas de la gzhan gsum gyi dbang du byas nas ni tshig gsum yin no //
analyzed: de nas de la gzhan gsum gyi dbang du byas nas ni tshig gsum yin no //
translated: Then, from the perspective of the other three, there are three words.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa de rnams kyis mnyam pa'i nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bas gzhan du 'gyur ba'i chos can ni tshig bcu gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa de rnams kyis mnyam pa'i nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bas gzhan du 'gyur ba'i chos can ni tshig bcu gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since one definitely emerges through equality with respect to those objects, etc., one should understand that the eleven words are phenomena that are different.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / phung po la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas ma 'dres pa'i bar du dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag par gsungs pa ni theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba yin par 'dod pa'i 'og ma rnams la yang khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / phung po la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas ma 'dres pa'i bar du dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag par gsungs pa ni theg pa chen po'i nges par 'byung ba yin par 'dod pa'i 'og ma rnams la yang khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin
translated: Likewise, the statements that the realms of form and formlessness, the aggregates, and so on, the dharmadhƒÅtu, the perfect end, the perfections, and so on, up to the unmixed qualities are negated as being both entities and nonentities should be accepted by those who assert that the MahƒÅyƒÅna is the definitive escape.

original: no // spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rigs kyi sa'i chos dang / brgyad pa'i sa'i chos dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / rigs kyi sa'i gang zag nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dang /
analyzed: no // spangs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rigs kyi sa'i chos dang / brgyad pa'i sa'i chos dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / rigs kyi sa'i gang zag nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dang /
translated: From the perspective of the escape of abandonment, the qualities of the stage of potential, the qualities of the stage of the eighth, the qualities of stream entry, and so on, the individuals of the stage of potential up to perfect buddhahood,

original: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa ma yin na ni theg pa chen po 'dis kyang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dngos po dang / dngos po med pa bkag pas theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba bstan pa yin no //üîΩrtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa ma yin na ni theg pa chen po 'dis kyang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dngos po dang / dngos po med pa bkag pas theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba bstan pa yin no // rtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: And since the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not a thing or a non-thing, this Great Vehicle is taught to go forth by stopping the thing and the non-thing with regard to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.üîΩAnd since the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not a thing or a non-thing, this Great Vehicle is taught to go forth by stopping the thing and the non-thing with regard to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.üîΩAnd since the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not a thing or a non-thing, this Great Vehicle is taught to go forth by stopping the thing and the non-thing with regard to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.üîΩAnd since the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not a thing or a non-thing, this Great Vehicle is taught to go forth by stopping the thing and the non-thing with regard to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.üîΩAnd since the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not a thing or a non-thing, this Great Vehicle is taught to go forth by stopping the thing and the non-thing with regard to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du sems bskyed pa rnams dngos po dang / dngos po med @55b pa bkag pas theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du sems bskyed pa rnams dngos po dang / dngos po med @55b pa bkag pas theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: And since the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not a thing or a non-thing, this Great Vehicle is taught to go forth by stopping the thing and the non-thing with regard to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: And since the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is not a thing or a non-thing,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang / theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pas bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang / theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pas bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattvas‚Äô elimination of all afflictions that are connected to traces, their attainment of omniscience, their definite emergence through the Great Vehicle, and the thirty-two marks of a great being are taught by refuting both entities and non-entities.

original: sangs rgyas kyis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gzi brjid dang dpal gyis mnan cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gzi brjid dang dpal gyis mnan cing /
translated: The Buddha, with his splendor and glory, outshines the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa bstan to //
translated: The Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha, also teaches by refuting both entities and non-entities.

original: sangs rgyas kyis 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rang gi sku'i 'od kyis rgyas par 'gengs par mdzad pa dang / gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rang gi sku'i 'od kyis rgyas par 'gengs par mdzad pa dang / gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa bstan to //
translated: The Buddha fills with the light of his body as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River, and he teaches with a voice endowed with sixty aspects, refuting both substantiality and the absence of substantiality.

original: sangs rgyas kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams re re zhing tshad med cing grangs med ba'i 'jig rten gyis khams gsung gis go bar mdzad pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams re re zhing tshad med cing grangs med ba'i 'jig rten gyis khams gsung gis go bar mdzad pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Buddha makes himself understood in each of the innumerable world systems of the ten directions, as before.

original: de la gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu las de las kyang mnyen pa gang zhen /üîΩ'di ltar sangs rgyas kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir mnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de la gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu las de las kyang mnyen pa gang zhen / 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir mnyen pa'o //
translated: Among the sixty aspects of his voice, what is its gentleness?üîΩIt is gentle because the Buddha teaches the roots of virtue.

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la bde bar nges par mdzad pa'i phyir 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la bde bar nges par mdzad pa'i phyir 'joms pa'o //
translated: It is overwhelming because he brings about the certainty of happiness in this very life.

original: don bzang ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: don bzang ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is pleasing because it has a good meaning.

original: yi ge bzang ba'i phyir yid du 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge bzang ba'i phyir yid du 'thad pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing because of its excellent letters.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes la thob pa'i phyir dag ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes la thob pa'i phyir dag ba'o //
translated: It is pure because it is attained after the supramundane, unsurpassed.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from all the latent tendencies of the afflictions.

original: tshig dang yi ge rab tu grags pa'i phyir rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge rab tu grags pa'i phyir rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: It is clear because of its well-known words and letters.

original: mu stegs can blo gros ngan pa thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir snyan cing 'jebs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can blo gros ngan pa thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir snyan cing 'jebs pa'o //
translated: It is melodious because it possesses the qualities of the power to conquer the views of all evil-minded non-Buddhists.

original: bsgrubs pa nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mnyan par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mnyan par 'os pa'o //
translated: It is worthy of hearing because it is accomplished and leads to liberation.

original: pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rtsol ba'i phyir mi tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rtsol ba'i phyir mi tshugs pa'o //
translated: It is unassailable because it cannot be challenged by any opponent.

original: thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i phyir snyan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i phyir snyan pa'o //
translated: It is agreeable because it delights everyone.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir dul ba'o /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir dul ba'o /
translated: It is disciplined because it is the antidote to desire and so forth.

original: @56a * // bslab pa bcas ba'i thabs bde ba mnga' ba'i phyir mi rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: @56a * // bslab pa bcas ba'i thabs bde ba mnga' ba'i phyir mi rtsub pa'o //
translated: It is not harsh, because it is the means of attaining happiness through the precepts.

original: de las 'das na nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir mi brlang ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'das na nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir mi brlang ba'o //
translated: It is not violent, because it demonstrates the means of deliverance from the transcendences.

original: theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir rab tu dul ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir rab tu dul ba'o //
translated: It is well disciplined, because it teaches the training in the three vehicles.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnar snyan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnar snyan pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing to the ear, because it is the antidote to distraction.

original: ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir lus sim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir lus sim par byed pa'o //
translated: It is refreshing to the body, because it engenders concentration.

original: lhag mthong gis rab tu dga' ba skyed par mdzad pa'i phyir sems tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis rab tu dga' ba skyed par mdzad pa'i phyir sems tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: It is satisfying to the mind, because it engenders joy through insight.

original: the tshom gcod par mdzad pa'i phyir snying dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom gcod par mdzad pa'i phyir snying dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is gladdening to the heart, because it resolves doubts.

original: log par nges pa dang ma nges pa sel bas na dga' ba dang bde ba skyed ba'o //
analyzed: log par nges pa dang ma nges pa sel bas na dga' ba dang bde ba skyed ba'o //
translated: It engenders joy and well being, because it dispels wrong certainty and uncertainty.

original: bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not oppressive, because there is no regret in practicing it.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir kun shes par bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be understood because it is the basis for the perfect knowledge that comes from hearing.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig par bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be cognized because it is the basis for the perfect knowledge that comes from reflection.

original: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud mi mnga' bar chos ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba'o //üîΩrang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud mi mnga' bar chos ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba'o // rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is clear because the Master teaches the Dharma without holding anything back.üîΩIt is delightful because it delights those who have attained their own goals.

original: rang gi don thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par dga' bar byed pa'o //üîΩbsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag bar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par dga' bar byed pa'o // bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag bar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing because it is pleasing to those who have attained their own goals.üîΩIt is to be understood because it teaches the inconceivable Dharma.

original: bsam du rung ba'i chos rnams yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam du rung ba'i chos rnams yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par rig par byed pa'o //
translated: It is to be cognized because it teaches the Dharma that can be contemplated.

original: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable because it is not in contradiction with valid knowledge.

original: gdul bya rnams la ji ltar rigs par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams la ji ltar rigs par ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is connected, because it teaches in whatever way is appropriate for those to be trained.

original: don med ba mi gsung ba'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: don med ba mi gsung ba'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: It is without the fault of repetition, because it does not speak what is meaningless.

original: mu stegs byed kyi tshogs thams cad skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir seng ge'i shugs so //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi tshogs thams cad skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir seng ge'i shugs so //
translated: It is the force of the lion, because it terrifies the entire host of tirthikas.

original: gsung rgya che ba'i phyir glang po che'i sgra skad do //
analyzed: gsung rgya che ba'i phyir glang po che'i sgra skad do //
translated: It is the voice of the elephant, because its speech is vast.

original: zab pa'i phyir 'brug gi sgra dbyangs so //
analyzed: zab pa'i phyir 'brug gi sgra dbyangs so //
translated: It is the sound of the dragon, because it is profound.

original: gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir klu'i dbang po'i sgra'o //
analyzed: gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir klu'i dbang po'i sgra'o //
translated: It is the voice of the lord of the nagas, because it is worthy to be grasped.

original: snyan pa'i phyir dri za'i glu dbyangs so //
analyzed: snyan pa'i phyir dri za'i glu dbyangs so //
translated: It is the song of the gandharvas, because it is pleasant.

original: rno ba dang 'jigs pa'i phyir ka la pim ka'i sgra dbyangs so //
analyzed: rno ba dang 'jigs pa'i phyir ka la pim ka'i sgra dbyangs so //
translated: It is the sound of the kalapinga, because it is sharp and frightening.

original: thag ring por grag pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs su bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: thag ring por grag pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs su bsgrags pa'o //
translated: It is the sound of Brahma, because it is heard from afar.

original: grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar shes pa yin pa'i phyir shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs @56b su grags pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar shes pa yin pa'i phyir shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs @56b su grags pa'o //
translated: It is the sound of the kokila bird, because it is known to precede all accomplishments.

original: de la sgra smos pas ni don ston pa'i mtshan nyid sgra yin par go bar bya ba'i don to //üîΩdbyangs smos pa ni de'i brda go bar byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la sgra smos pas ni don ston pa'i mtshan nyid sgra yin par go bar bya ba'i don to // dbyangs smos pa ni de'i brda go bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúsound‚Äù is for the purpose of understanding that the definition of sound is the revealer of meaning.üîΩThe mention of ‚Äúmelody‚Äù is for the purpose of understanding the convention of that.

original: grag pa smos pas ni brda de dang rjes su sgrogs pa go bar byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: grag pa smos pas ni brda de dang rjes su sgrogs pa go bar byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúvoice‚Äù is for the purpose of understanding the proclamation of that convention.

original: 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar snyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar snyan pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúsweet‚Äù like the voice of the lord of the gods, because it is not to be surpassed.

original: bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir rnga'i sgra'o //
analyzed: bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir rnga'i sgra'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúlike the sound of a drum,‚Äù because it precedes the victory over all demons and adversaries.

original: bstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ma khengs pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ma khengs pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúnot arrogant‚Äù because it is not afflicted by praise.

original: smad pas zhum pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir mi dma' ba'o //
analyzed: smad pas zhum pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir mi dma' ba'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúnot timid‚Äù because it is not depressed by blame.

original: sgra'i bstan bcos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i bstan bcos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rjes su zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúin accord with all sounds‚Äù because it is the characteristic of all aspects in all treatises on sound.

original: bsnyel te gsungs ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir tshig zur chag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyel te gsungs ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir tshig zur chag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not broken, because he never forgets.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not incomplete, because he is always present for the activities of those to be trained.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi rton pa'i phyir ma zhum pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi rton pa'i phyir ma zhum pa'o //
translated: It is not faint, because he does not rely on gain and honor.

original: bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi zhan pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi zhan pa'o //
translated: It is not weak, because he is free from fear.

original: skyo ba med pa la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is delightful, because he has attained indefatigability.

original: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive, because it is endowed with skill in all the sciences.

original: sems can gyi don de dag thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir chub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don de dag thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir chub pa'o //
translated: It is complete, because he accomplishes all those aims of sentient beings.

original: rgyun chad pa med pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa med pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa'o //
translated: It is continuous, because it is uninterrupted.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rab tu gnas pa'i phyir 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rab tu gnas pa'i phyir 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is connected, because it is established in various forms.

original: gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam pa du mar gnas pa'i phyir sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam pa du mar gnas pa'i phyir sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It fulfills all sounds, because many sounds are present in a single sound.

original: gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: It satisfies all the faculties because it is present in the form of many objects from one.

original: ji ltar bcas pa bzhin mdzad pa'i phyir ma smad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bcas pa bzhin mdzad pa'i phyir ma smad pa'o //
translated: It is not contemptible because it does what it says.

original: phyis dus la bab par rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyis dus la bab par rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is not changeable because it is applied at the right time.

original: rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ma rtabs  pa'o //
analyzed: rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ma rtabs  pa'o //
translated: It is not nervous because it does not speak in a nervous way.

original: 'khor thag ring ba dang nye bar mtshungs par thos pa'i phyir kun tu grag pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor thag ring ba dang nye bar mtshungs par thos pa'i phyir kun tu grag pa'o //
translated: It is heard everywhere because it is heard equally by those far away and those nearby.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi don dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don thams cad dpe chos su bsgyur ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o zhes 'phags pa thogs med kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi don dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don thams cad dpe chos su bsgyur ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o zhes 'phags pa thogs med kyis gsungs so //
translated: It has the highest of all aspects because it is the example for all mundane and supramundane aims.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum bskor ba rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi @57a * //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum bskor ba rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi @57a * //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is turned three times, with twelve aspects.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo dngos po dang dngos po med pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo dngos po dang dngos po med pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is taught by way of entity and non-entity.

original: sngar ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum bskor ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: sngar ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum bskor ba 'di yin te /
translated: This is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma three times without turning back, which had not been turned in this way before.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The noble truth of suffering is to be fully known.üîΩIt is fully known.

original: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la re re zhing mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skyes pa'i phyir 'di ltar rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la re re zhing mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skyes pa'i phyir 'di ltar rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: In this way, there are twelve aspects, because for each of the four noble truths, the eye of Dharma, knowledge, understanding, and insight arise.

original: de bzhin du bden pa re re zhing yang gsum dang / bcu gnyis su chos mthun pas lan gsum rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bden pa re re zhing yang gsum dang / bcu gnyis su chos mthun pas lan gsum rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, each of the four noble truths has three and twelve aspects in common. Therefore, it is said that the wheel of Dharma was turned three times with twelve aspects.

original: sems can gang dag la bskor ba de rnams kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag par bstan pas dus gsum pa'i sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das ba'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la bskor ba de rnams kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag par bstan pas dus gsum pa'i sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das ba'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The beings for whom the wheel of Dharma was turned, by teaching them the negation of entity and non-entity, will attain complete nirvana in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das dngos po ni gang zhig lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das dngos po ni gang zhig lags /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBhagavan, what is an entity?

original: dngos po med pa ni gang zhig lags /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni gang zhig lags /
translated: What is a non-entity?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, the two are entities.

original: gnyis su med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The non-dual is a non-entity.

original: nges par 'byung ba gsum ni ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba gsum ni ched du bya ba'i nges par 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of renunciation should be understood as the renunciation of the purpose.üîΩWith regard to the renunciation of sameness, the Buddha said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, you have said that this vehicle is equal to space.‚Äù

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor khyod kyis gang yang 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dper byas pas ni theg pa chen po la phyogs yod par shes par bkag pa yin pas ring po dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor khyod kyis gang yang 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dper byas pas ni theg pa chen po la phyogs yod par shes par bkag pa yin pas ring po dang /
translated: The example of space refutes the idea that the Great Vehicle has parts.

original: thung ngu dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog gi gzugs bkag pa dang / dus gsum bkag pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang /
analyzed: thung ngu dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog gi gzugs bkag pa dang / dus gsum bkag pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang /
translated: because of the refutation of long and short, blue and yellow, etc.,üîΩand of form as shape and color, and because of the refutation of the three times, there is no origination, cessation,

original: gnas pa dang / mthar thug pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / mthar thug pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: abiding, termination, or transformation of abiding.

original: de la med pa la 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la med pa la 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Therein, origination is the occurrence of what is nonexistent.

original: yod pa las log pa ni bkag pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa las log pa ni bkag pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the negation of what exists.

original: rgyun 'dra ba ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun 'dra ba ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the continuity of the similar.

original: rgyun rnam par 'gyur ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun rnam par 'gyur ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Termination is the transformation of the continuity.

original: nye bar zhig cing rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhig cing rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Transformation of abiding is the destruction of the near and the transformation of the continuity.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / mthong @57b ba dang / thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / mthong @57b ba dang / thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang /
translated: not virtue, nonvirtue, or the ethically neutral; not what is seen, heard, known, or cognized; not what is to be known, cognized,

original: yongs su shes par bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: fully understood, actualized, abandoned, or cultivated.

original: de la shes par bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la shes par bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid de /
translated: Here, what is to be known is the knowledge of all things.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis mthong zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis mthong zhing /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas see it,

original: ye shes kyis bltas nas byang chub sems dpa' 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyis bltas nas byang chub sems dpa' 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and having seen it with their wisdom, the bodhisattvas should transcend it.

original: kun shes pa nyid ni lam shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun shes pa nyid ni lam shes pa nyid de /
translated: The knowledge of all things is the knowledge of the path.

original: des sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du shes par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du shes par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is to be known up to buddhahood.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: What is to be cognized is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: des ni ma lus pa yul du mdzad ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni ma lus pa yul du mdzad ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment.üîΩThe first generation of the thought of enlightenment is the Great Vehicle, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.

original: rnam par smin pa dang / de dang 'brel ba'i chos dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs par gtogs pa nyid bkag pas nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po mtshungs pas sems bskyed pa dang po nas nye bar bzung ste /üîΩde bzhin du sa bcu pa dang / dkar po rnam bar mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rnams dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa nas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyis bkag pas theg pa chen po ni gzugs dang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / de dang 'brel ba'i chos dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs par gtogs pa nyid bkag pas nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po mtshungs pas sems bskyed pa dang po nas nye bar bzung ste /üîΩde bzhin du sa bcu pa dang / dkar po rnam bar mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rnams dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa nas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyis bkag pas theg pa chen po ni gzugs dang /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe Great Vehicle is the cause of the first generation of the thought

original: bstan du yod pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa rnams las go bzlog pa rnams bkag pa dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / zhi ba rnams las go bzlog pa dang / mi stong pa dang /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa rnams las go bzlog pa rnams bkag pa dang / de bzhin du bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / zhi ba rnams las go bzlog pa dang / mi stong pa dang /
translated: The opposite of the following are also negated: having form, being obstructive, being concomitant, and so on; the opposite of the following: being blissful, being permanent, being peaceful, and so on; the opposite of the following: not being empty, having signs, and having aspirations; the opposite of the following: being isolated and being manifest; and the opposite of the following: being attainable and being fully attainable.

original: mtshan ma dang / smon pa yod pa de rnams go bzlog pa dang / dben pa dang / snang ba las go bzlog pa rnams dang / thob pa dang / nye bar thob pa dang / brjod du yod pa dang / rab tu brjod du yod pa gnyis bkag pas ni theg pa chen po ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang / smon pa yod pa de rnams go bzlog pa dang / dben pa dang / snang ba las go bzlog pa rnams dang / thob pa dang / nye bar thob pa dang / brjod du yod pa dang / rab tu brjod du yod pa gnyis bkag pas ni theg pa chen po ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: By negating the following two: being expressible and being fully expressible, the MahƒÅyƒÅna is taught to be equal to space.

original: sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor gang khyod kyis 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' sems can tshad mad grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor gang khyod kyis 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' sems can tshad mad grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de yang de bzhin no //
translated: In terms of the definite emergence for the sake of sentient beings, it says, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, just as space provides room for countless, innumerable sentient beings, so too, Subh≈´ti, is this Great Vehicle.‚Äù

original: sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po de yang med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po ni sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa @58a * //
analyzed: sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po de yang med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po ni sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa @58a * //
translated: Because sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle do not exist, the Great Vehicle provides room for countless, innumerable sentient beings.

original: yin no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle are not apprehended.

original: yang sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po tshad med ba'i phyir sngar bstan pa ltar theg pa chen po sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po tshad med ba'i phyir sngar bstan pa ltar theg pa chen po sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, just as was previously explained, the Great Vehicle provides room for sentient beings because sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle are immeasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sems can la sogs pa dmigs su med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la sogs pa dmigs su med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings and so on are not apprehended.

original: yang sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po grangs med pa'i phyir de nyid kyis sems can grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po grangs med pa'i phyir de nyid kyis sems can grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because of the infinitude of sentient beings, of space, and of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, therefore, as previously explained, it is the liberator of the infinitude of sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of them are unapprehendable.

original: yang sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po rnams tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa nyid kyi phyir de lta bas na sngar bshad pa ltar sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po rnams tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa nyid kyi phyir de lta bas na sngar bshad pa ltar sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because of the immeasurability and infinitude of the realms of sentient beings, of the dharma-element, of space, and of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, therefore, as previously explained, it is the liberator of the infinitude of sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams thams cad dmigs su med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad dmigs su med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of them are unapprehendable.

original: yang sems can dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / 'dus ma byas dang / mi 'jal ba dang / mi 'grangs pa dang / mi dpogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad med pa de nyid kyis sngar bstan pa de ltar sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang sems can dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / 'dus ma byas dang / mi 'jal ba dang / mi 'grangs pa dang / mi dpogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad med pa de nyid kyis sngar bstan pa de ltar sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because of the non-existence of sentient beings, of the TathƒÅgatas, of space, of the Great Vehicle, of the unconditioned, of the immeasurable, of the infinite, and of the incalculable, all dharmas are non-existent. And it is precisely because of this non-existence of all dharmas that he makes room for sentient beings as has been explained above.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not apprehended.

original: gzhan yang bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / grangs med pa rnams dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / grangs med pa rnams dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because of the non-existence of a self, of sentient beings, of a living being, etc., of the limit of existence, of the incalculable, and of all dharmas, he makes room for sentient beings precisely because of this non-existence of all dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not apprehended in this way.

original: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams dang / khams dang / theg pa chen po dang / mi 'jal ba dang / mi 'grangs pa dang / mi dpogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams dang / khams dang / theg pa chen po dang / mi 'jal ba dang / mi 'grangs pa dang / mi dpogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because there is no self, etc., no realm of the inconceivable, no aggregates such as form, etc., no elements, no Great Vehicle, no immeasurable, no infinite, and no incalculable, therefore it is the liberator of beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not apprehended.

original: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / mi 'jal ba dang / mi 'grangs ba dang / mi dpogs pa med pa nyid @58b kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / mi 'jal ba dang / mi 'grangs ba dang / mi dpogs pa med pa nyid @58b kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can gyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because there is no self, etc., no eye, etc., no space, no Great Vehicle, no immeasurable, no infinite, and no incalculable, therefore it is the liberator of beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not apprehended.

original: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa nyid dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can rnams kyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa nyid dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis sems can rnams kyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is because of the self and so on, the perfections such as generosity, space, the Great Vehicle, the immeasurables, the countless, the infinite, and the non-existence of all phenomena that sentient beings are liberated by that very [non-existence].

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because those [phenomena] are non-apprehensible.

original: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnams nas ma 'dres pa dang / rigs kyis dang / rgyun du zhugs ba la sogs pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang /
analyzed: yang bdag la sogs pa dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnams nas ma 'dres pa dang / rigs kyis dang / rgyun du zhugs ba la sogs pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang /
translated: Moreover, it is because of the emptiness of the self and so on, sentient beings, and likewise the factors of enlightenment and so on up to the unmixed [factors], the lineages, the stream-enterers and so on, the ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis na sems can rnams kyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po dang / chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis na sems can rnams kyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Because the vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas, the omniscience of the TathƒÅgatas, space, the Great Vehicle, and all dharmas are non-existent, therefore it is the liberator of beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are non-apprehensible.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang / dper brjod pa dang / theg pa chen po sngar bstan pa ltar sems can rnams kyi go 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang / dper brjod pa dang / theg pa chen po sngar bstan pa ltar sems can rnams kyi go 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as nirvƒÅ·πáa, space, similes, and the Great Vehicle were taught above, so too it is the liberator of beings.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the s≈´tra:

original: rab 'byor yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi go 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi go 'byed pa'o //
translated: The realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa, the immeasurables, the countless, and the infinite liberate beings.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na theg pa chen po 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa mang du dpe gzhan brgyud pa zlos pa'i nyes pa'i skabs med do //
analyzed: de lta yin na theg pa chen po 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa mang du dpe gzhan brgyud pa zlos pa'i nyes pa'i skabs med do //
translated: If that is so, then in the passage beginning ‚ÄúBy this Great Vehicle,‚Äù there is no occasion for the fault of repeating the example through another intermediary.

original: de dang de rtogs pa'i bye brag gi gnas skabs kyis gong nas gong du sems can gyi don mang bas rim gyis 'jug pa shes pa'i don du de bzhin du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang de rtogs pa'i bye brag gi gnas skabs kyis gong nas gong du sems can gyi don mang bas rim gyis 'jug pa shes pa'i don du de bzhin du bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is taught in that way for the purpose of knowing the gradual engagement, because the state of realization of each of those is a higher and higher state, and the benefit for sentient beings is greater and greater.

original: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
translated: As it is said in other s≈´tras:

original: zhi ba'i blo gros rnam grangs 'di ltar rig par bya ste /üîΩji lta ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sems can tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros rnam grangs 'di ltar rig par bya ste / ji lta ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sems can tshad med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú≈öƒÅntimati, it should be understood in this way.üîΩThe closer one gets to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment, the more sentient beings one brings to maturity, in immeasurable, countless, and limitless ways.‚ÄùüîΩWith regard to spontaneous renunciation, it is said:

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor @59a * //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor @59a * //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the bodhisattva great beings who are skilled in the perfection of wisdom, who practice the perfection of wisdom, should practice like this.

original: gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, you have said:

original: nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba'am /
translated: In the sky and in the Great Vehicle,

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba mthong ba yang med /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba mthong ba yang med /
translated: no coming or going is seen,

original: gnas pa yang med /
analyzed: gnas pa yang med /
translated: no abiding is seen.

original: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin par bstan te /
translated: The non-existence of coming, going, and abiding is taught to be spontaneous deliverance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are unmoving.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / mig la sogs pa rnams dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag ba'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / mig la sogs pa rnams dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag ba'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
translated: The aggregates such as form, the eyes and so forth, the six elements such as earth, the dharmadhƒÅtu, suchness, the perfect limit, the inconceivable expanse, the perfections,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / stobs la sogs ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / 'dus byas dang / rang bzhin dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / stobs la sogs ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / 'dus byas dang / rang bzhin dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'ong ba dang /
translated: the factors of enlightenment, the powers and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha, perfect complete enlightenment, the characteristics of the conditioned, the nature, and the essence itself,

original: 'gro ba dang / gnas pa bkag pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba shes par byed pa'i ched yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / gnas pa bkag pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba shes par byed pa'i ched yin no //
translated: and the refutation of coming, going, and abiding are for the purpose of knowing spontaneous renunciation.

original: mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: With regard to renunciation that transcends extremes, it is said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄòThe Mahayana is not apprehended in the past,

original: phyi ma dang / dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: phyi ma dang / dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: the future, or the present.‚Äô

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The Mahayana is called the sameness of the three times.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore it is called the Mahayana.‚Äù

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ni mtha' las 'das ba'i nges par 'byung ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ni mtha' las 'das ba'i nges par 'byung ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The equality of the three times is taught to be the transcendence of extremes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the three times are its equality, and the Mahayana and the bodhisattva are empty of that very nature.

original: dus gsum ni de'i mnyam pa nyid yin pa dang / theg pa chen po dang ; byang chub sems dpa' ni de dang de'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyis ni gcig nas bcu'i bar gyi grangs bkag pas theg pa chen po la mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: dus gsum ni de'i mnyam pa nyid yin pa dang / theg pa chen po dang ; byang chub sems dpa' ni de dang de'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyis ni gcig nas bcu'i bar gyi grangs bkag pas theg pa chen po la mnyam pa dang /
translated: By emptiness, the enumeration from one to ten is negated, and so the Mahayana is equal.

original: mi mnyam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / ming dang / ming med pa nas /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / ming dang / ming med pa nas /
translated: It is equal in terms of desire and freedom from desire, anger and freedom from anger, ignorance and freedom from ignorance, name and no name, form and no form, up to the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of no aspects.

original: mi dge ba dang / dge ba dag dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / kha na ma thob ba dang bcas ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / dge ba dag dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / kha na ma thob ba dang bcas ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: non-virtuous and virtuous, with-outflows and without-outflows, reprehensible and irreproachable, afflicted and unafflicted,

original: nyon mongs pa zad pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / @59b 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / @59b 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
translated: afflictions and their exhaustion, mundane and supramundane, afflictive and purifying, cyclic existence and nirvana, permanent and impermanent,

original: bdag dang / zhi ba dang / de dag las go bzlog pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang / de las 'das ba yang mi dmigs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang / zhi ba dang / de dag las go bzlog pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang / de las 'das ba yang mi dmigs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: happy and unhappy, self and not self, peaceful and not peaceful, their opposites, the realms of desire and so on, and transcending them, are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of them are not apprehended by way of their intrinsic reality.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form and so on of the past and so on are empty.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For emptiness is not apprehended by emptiness.üîΩBecause form, etc. of the past, etc. is not apprehended, the three times are the same.

original: 'das pa la sogs ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis na sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis na sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfections are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mnyam pa nyid la mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sameness of sameness is not apprehended.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The applications of mindfulness, etc. up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should be similarly described as not being apprehended because the past, etc. and the applications of mindfulness, etc. are not possible as objects.

original: de bzhin du sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dang / so so'i skye bo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dang / so so'i skye bo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the past, etc. and the individual, etc. up to the tathagatas are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sentient beings are not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, thus the vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is called the sameness of the three times.

original: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Abiding in that, bodhisattva great beings surpass the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The defining characteristics of attainment are presented from the perspective of going forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs shing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur to //üîΩthob po 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs shing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur to //üîΩthob po 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, past, future, and present bodhisattva great beings have attained, will attain, and are attaining the knowledge of all aspects by training in this Great Vehicle.‚Äù

original: nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i nye bar dgod bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags ba'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid dang rjes su mthun pa yin zhing /üîΩtheg pa chen po @60a * //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i nye bar dgod bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags ba'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid dang rjes su mthun pa yin zhing / theg pa chen po @60a * //
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as the attainment of the complete, because it is the cause of the attainment of the realization of all noble persons, and because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of definite release.üîΩThe meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as the attainment of the complete, because it is the cause of the attainment of the realization of all noble persons, and because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of definite release.üîΩThe meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as the attainment of the complete, because it is the cause of the attainment of the realization of all noble persons, and because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of definite release.üîΩThe meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as the attainment of the complete, because it is the cause of the attainment of the realization of all noble persons, and because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of definite release.üîΩThe meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as the attainment of the complete, because it is the cause of the attainment of the realization of all noble persons, and because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of definite release.

original: bstan pa thob pas khyad par shes par bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad bsdus pa dang / mnyam par 'jug pa thob pa bstan pas ma lus pa thob pa yin par shes par bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa thob pas khyad par shes par bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad bsdus pa dang / mnyam par 'jug pa thob pa bstan pas ma lus pa thob pa yin par shes par bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as the attainment of the complete, because it is the cause of the attainment of the realization of all noble persons, and because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of definite release.

original: theg pa chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Great Vehicle is all those dharmas that are taught, from the perfections, etc., up to the dharmas on the side of awakening, from form, etc., up to the unentangled Buddhadharmas, and up to the element of the hearers.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: All those dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: They are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: have no obstruction,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med bar mtshan nyid gcig pa sha stag ste zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thob cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med bar mtshan nyid gcig pa sha stag ste zhes bya ba ni rtog pa thob cing /
translated: and are of one single mark‚Äîthat is, no mark.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam grangs kyis ji skad du bshad pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni theg pa chen po bstan pa dang rjes su mthun no //
