analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam grangs kyis ji skad du bshad pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni theg pa chen po bstan pa dang rjes su mthun no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is in accord with the teaching of the Great Vehicle as it has been explained by the enumeration of the escape.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: theg pa chen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas chos thams cad gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa thob pa'i rnam grangs kyis theg pa chen po dang rjes su mthun par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas chos thams cad gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa thob pa'i rnam grangs kyis theg pa chen po dang rjes su mthun par bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the Great Vehicle, in the Perfection of Wisdom and so on, all phenomena are taught to be nondual and not to be made dual, by way of synonyms for attainment, in accordance with the Great Vehicle.

original: de la thob ba ni nges bar 'byung ba'i don rnam pa gsum bkag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thob ba ni nges bar 'byung ba'i don rnam pa gsum bkag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therein, attainment should be understood to have the characteristic of the negation of the three kinds of object of renunciation.

original: yang dgag ba rnam pa gsum ni 'di ltar thob par bya ba dgag pa dang / thob pa po dgag ba dang / de gnyis kyi 'brel pa dgag pa'o //üîΩtshe dang ldan par rab 'byor ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sngon gyi mtha' dmigs su med pa yin zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang dgag ba rnam pa gsum ni 'di ltar thob par bya ba dgag pa dang / thob pa po dgag ba dang / de gnyis kyi 'brel pa dgag pa'o // tshe dang ldan par rab 'byor ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sngon gyi mtha' dmigs su med pa yin zhes bya ba dang / ci'i phyir na gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, the three negations are as follows: the negation of the object of attainment, the negation of the attainer, and the negation of the relation between the two.üîΩVenerable Subh≈´ti, why is it that the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva is said to be unapprehendable in the past?

original: byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas par rig par bya ba yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas par rig par bya ba yin /
translated: And why is it that because form is infinite, the bodhisattva is to be known as infinite?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattva‚Äù is also like that‚Äîit does not exist and is not found.

original: de skad du de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad du thams cad rnam ba thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams
analyzed: de skad du de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad du thams cad rnam ba thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams
translated: In that way, if a bodhisattva great being does not see anything at all, in any way at all, in every way at all, then what bodhisattva and what perfection of wisdom should he advise and instruct?üîΩ‚ÄúBodhisattva‚Äù is just a name.

original: shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smras zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming @60b tsam du bas so zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzugs mngon par grub pa lta gang zhig mchis /
analyzed: shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smras zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming @60b tsam du bas so zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzugs mngon par grub pa lta gang zhig mchis /
translated: What bodhisattva will there be who has accomplished form?

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so //
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so //
translated: What has not been accomplished is not form.

original: mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi'am zhes smra /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi'am zhes smra /
translated: Should one advise and instruct in the perfection of wisdom that has not been accomplished?‚Äù

original: de skad du mngon par ma grub pa las gud na yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyib dmigs su ma mchis so zhes smra /
analyzed: de skad du mngon par ma grub pa las gud na yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyib dmigs su ma mchis so zhes smra /
translated: Thus, in the Uncreated, it is said, ‚ÄúApart from that, a bodhisattva is not perceived.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar bstan pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar bstan pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: If it is taught in that way, then the teaching beginning with ‚Äúat that time‚Äù is given.

original: de la dris pa dang po bstan pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la dris pa dang po bstan pa nas brtsams te /
translated: In that regard, the first question is taught, beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is taught in that way.‚Äù

original: thob par bya ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sems can med pa'i phyir dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / sngon dang / phyi ma dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnams su byang chub sems dpa' khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pas dus gsum du thob par bya ba'i don med par shes par bya ba'i ched yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par bya ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sems can med pa'i phyir dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / sngon dang / phyi ma dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnams su byang chub sems dpa' khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pas dus gsum du thob par bya ba'i don med par shes par bya ba'i ched yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúat that time‚Äù is that, in order to refute the attainment, it is said that because sentient beings do not exist, and because emptiness, isolation, the absence of intrinsic nature, and the extremes of the prior limit, the posterior limit, and the middle are refuted in the acceptance of the bodhisattva, one should understand that there is no object of attainment in the three times.

original: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du med pa'i phyir dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar du med pa'i phyir dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa dang /
translated: Likewise, because the aggregates and so on, the perfections, the factors of enlightenment, and so on, up to and including the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha, are nonexistent, and because of emptiness,üîΩ

original: rang bzhin med pa rnams kyis sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa rnams kyis sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: So too, because the aggregates and so on, the perfections, the factors of enlightenment and so on up to and including the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha do not exist, and because emptiness, isolation and the absence of intrinsic nature refute the acceptance of the bodhisattva in the past and so on,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: med pa nyid la sogs par sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyis na med pa nyid la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam grangs gzhan du gsungs pas /
analyzed: med pa nyid la sogs par sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyis na med pa nyid la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam grangs gzhan du gsungs pas /
translated: Because the nonexistence of the past and so on is not observed in nonexistence and so on, the perfections and so on are stated as synonyms of nonexistence and so on.üîΩThe s≈´tras state:

original: mdo las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: mdo las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin //
translated: Emptiness is not other than form.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs kyi sgo rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs kyi sgo rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of meditative stabilization, the gateways of meditative stability, the Dharma-element, suchness, and the very limit of reality.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams med pa la sogs pas sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams med pa la sogs pas sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' khas blangs pa'i thob pa bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva‚Äôs acceptance of the past, etc. is refuted by the non-existence of the noble persons, such as the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: med pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Because, beginning with non-existence,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar du de dag thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar du de dag thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: all of that is non-dual and not divided into two.

original: thob pa po dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzugs kun @61a * //
analyzed: thob pa po dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzugs kun @61a * //
translated: With the aim of refuting the one who attains, beginning with ‚Äúbecause form is infinite,‚Äù

original: tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: up to ‚Äúbecause the bodhisattva is infinite,‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregates beginning with form, up to the unentangled qualities of the Buddha, are not apprehended in the past, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Because of emptiness, the so-called form of a bodhisattva does not exist and is not apprehended, and so on up to

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar de dag gis stong pa nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar de dag gis stong pa nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the emptiness of those, beginning with the aggregates such as form, up to the TathƒÅgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The great bodhisattva is not apprehended in any respect, in any way, in any manner, in any time, in any period of time, in any eon, in any world system, in any place, in any direction, or anywhere, and so on up to

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid du mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dang / sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid du mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from the aggregates such as form up to the unentangled qualities of a Buddha, up to the non-apprehension of a Buddha in a Buddha.

original: de la thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid thams cad du'o //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúeverywhere‚Äù means in all the characteristics of things such as the aggregates.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mtha' dag dang bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mtha' dag dang bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means the entire nature of the Bodhisattva‚Äôs aggregates, etc., and their collections.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means the special aspects of inner emptiness, etc.

original: yang thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Again, ‚Äúall‚Äù means the characteristics of the brief and extensive aspects.

original: thams cad gnyis smos pa ni dngos po thams cad nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad gnyis smos pa ni dngos po thams cad nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad nyid do //
translated: The repetition of ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to all things and all aspects.

original: thob par bya ba dang / 'thob par byed pa dang / thob pa po 'brel pa bkag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gang yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: thob par bya ba dang / 'thob par byed pa dang / thob pa po 'brel pa bkag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gang yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
translated: In terms of the refutation of the connection between the one who attains, the attainment, and the one who is attained, it says, ‚ÄúThe so-called bodhisattva is a name that is adventitiously ascribed.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ming tsam yin pa nyid kyis na med cing mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa bkag cing tha snyad tsam du gsungs pa dang / shin tu mngon par ma grub pa dag gis bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ming tsam yin pa nyid kyis na med cing mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa bkag cing tha snyad tsam du gsungs pa dang / shin tu mngon par ma grub pa dag gis bkag pa yin no //
translated: Since all phenomena are mere names, they are nonexistent and unobservable. Thus, the text refutes their manifest substantiality and declares them to be mere conventions, and it refutes them as being utterly unmanifest.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i don ni glo bur du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i don ni glo bur du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this regard, the meaning of ‚Äúnot being the essence‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúadventitious.‚Äù

original: sgro btags pa'i don ni ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don ni ming du btags pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúsuperimposition‚Äù is ‚Äúascribed by name.‚Äù

original: bdag bdag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag bdag ces bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúself‚Äù is ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: bdag shin tu ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: bdag shin tu ma grub pa'o //
translated: The self is utterly unsubstantial.

original: bdag ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / yang chos thams cad kyi 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pas chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid de gang dang yad bral @61b bas ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / yang chos thams cad kyi 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pas chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid de gang dang yad bral @61b bas ma yin no //
translated: And again, since the intrinsic reality of the aggregation of all phenomena is refuted, all phenomena are the intrinsic reality of non-entityness, and therefore impermanence is not due to the absence of something.

original: de bzhin du de rnams nyid gang dang yang bral bas ma yin pas dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i bar nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de rnams nyid gang dang yang bral bas ma yin pas dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i bar nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, since they are not due to the absence of anything, they are virtuous, not subject to reproach, and so on, up to and including the absence of intrinsic reality, and they are not permanent and not subject to destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin no //
translated: Because that is their intrinsic nature.

original: yang chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis mngon par grub pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis mngon par grub pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, since the establishment of all phenomena is refuted by their non-composite nature,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dmigs su med pa nyid kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dmigs su med pa nyid kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are empty by nature, due to the non-apprehension of manifest activity.

original: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba bkag pas mngon par ma grub pa nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba bkag pas mngon par ma grub pa nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa ste /
translated: Because of the negation of arising, ceasing, abiding, and transforming, that perfection of wisdom is non-established, due to non-establishment.

original: de mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Those two dharmas called ‚Äònon-established‚Äô and ‚Äòperfection of wisdom‚Äô are not two, are not divided, are not broken apart.

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pa dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jigs /üîΩmi dang nga /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pa dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i sems mi 'jigs / mi dang nga /
translated: Because of seeing all phenomena as inactive and like illusions, etc., the bodhisattva‚Äôs mind is not destroyed,

original: skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is not frightened,üîΩis not terrified.

original: chos de dag la 'di ltar yongs su rtogs pa de'i tshe nye bar mi len /
analyzed: chos de dag la 'di ltar yongs su rtogs pa de'i tshe nye bar mi len /
translated: When one thoroughly investigates those dharmas in that way, at that time one does not take them up,

original: mi gnas / mngon par zhen par mi byed /
analyzed: mi gnas / mngon par zhen par mi byed /
translated: does not abide in them, does not become fixated on them.

original: tha snyad du 'dogs pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad du 'dogs pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: It is the designation that is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang ; chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis na dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang ; chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis na dmigs su med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are unarisen and all phenomena are essenceless, they are unobservable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos rnams dang / de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: chos rnams dang / de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Because phenomena and their emptiness, etc. are not two nor divided.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams kyi 'grib pa de yang chos ma lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams kyi 'grib pa de yang chos ma lags so //
translated: Similarly, the diminution of phenomena is not a phenomenon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos rnams dang 'grib pa ni gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su bgyir ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: chos rnams dang 'grib pa ni gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su bgyir ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because phenomena and their diminution are not two nor divided.

original: gang yang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis shing /
translated: And that which is from form up to omniscience is not two nor divided.

original: nyams pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang / thob pa po gnyis ka bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang / thob pa po gnyis ka bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase in the Dharma discourse called 'The Unfailing One' indicates that both the object to be attained and the attainer are negated.

original: gsum pa rnams bkag pa ni thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa rnams bkag pa ni thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The negation of the third should be understood as the escape from attainment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the escape into the knowledge of all modes,

original: byang chub des kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa shes te /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la @62a * //
analyzed: byang chub des kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa shes te / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la @62a * //
translated: it is said that through that knowledge of all modes, one knows the modes of all dharmas.

original: sogs pa rnams dang zhes bya ba nas ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du rnam pa shes te /
analyzed: sogs pa rnams dang zhes bya ba nas ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du rnam pa shes te /
translated: The phrase the aggregates, etc., beginning with form indicates the aggregates, sense fields, and components, etc.üîΩ The phrase up to the unentangled dharmas indicates the powers, confidences, etc.

original: mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma'i rnam pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa bkag pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma'i rnam pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The modes, tokens, and signs of all dharmas are called the modes of all dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid mchog tu song bas na mchog tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid mchog tu song bas na mchog tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is the perfection of wisdom itself that has gone to the highest, it is called the perfection.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgyu ma nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgyu ma nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: It is in order to know that the illusion is just the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs nas chos thams cad kyi bar du re re zhig ces bya ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs nas chos thams cad kyi bar du re re zhig ces bya ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag ces bya ba nas /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is from form up to all phenomena, each one, and from permanent and impermanent up toüîΩpeaceful and not peaceful, and secluded and not secluded, in order to know that it is included in all aspects by the examination of phenomena itself.

original: zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba'i bar du chos yongs su brtags pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du bsdus par shes par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni ma skyes pa nyid nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de'i ngo bo nyidüîΩyod pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba'i bar du chos yongs su brtags pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du bsdus par shes par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni ma skyes pa nyid nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de'i ngo bo nyidüîΩyod pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is from the non-arising up to the knowledge of all aspects, because it refutes the existence of their nature.

original: de ltar 'grib pa gang yin pa dang / gnyis su byar med pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar 'grib pa gang yin pa dang / gnyis su byar med pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, all phenomena, which are neither diminished nor made complete, are neither conjoined nor disjoined.üîΩ

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: In this way, all phenomena, which are not subject to decrease and are not to be made dual, are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: They are formless,

original: bltar med pa /
analyzed: bltar med pa /
translated: cannot be pointed out,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and are unimpeded.üîΩIn this way, they are of a single mark‚Äîthat is, the mark of no mark.üîΩThe non-arising of phenomena and the fact that phenomena are not different from one another are synonyms.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pas chos skye ba med pa dang / chos rnams ni gcig la gcig tha mi dad pa'i rnam grangs su byas pas chos thams cad nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du rnam par dag pa'i slad du ma skyes pa mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nye bar btags pa yin no
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pas chos skye ba med pa dang / chos rnams ni gcig la gcig tha mi dad pa'i rnam grangs su byas pas chos thams cad nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du rnam par dag pa'i slad du ma skyes pa mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nye bar btags pa yin no
translated: Therefore, the perception of non-arising, from phenomena up to the buddhas, is designated as the perfection of wisdom.

original: // de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'gro ba lnga rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: // de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'gro ba lnga rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattvas and the five classes of beings are not different.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / byang chub thob pa'i lam de bsgom pa med pas dka' ba spyod pa yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / byang chub thob pa'i lam de bsgom pa med pas dka' ba spyod pa yang mi 'thad la /
translated: It would not be tenable that they practice austerities because they do not cultivate the path to the attainment of the fruit of stream enterer and so on and enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow that the tathƒÅgatas would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood and turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni chos ma skyes pa la thob pa yod pa dang / khong du chud pa yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bdag ni chos ma skyes pa la thob pa yod pa dang / khong du chud pa yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, I do not assert that the unarisen has attainment and realization.

original: ma skyes pa la rgyun du zhugs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la rgyun du zhugs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that the unarisen has stream enterer.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: I do not assert that the fruit of stream enterer exists.üîΩStarting from here, it is shown that it is untenable to accept any phenomena.

original: chos thams cad khas len pa mi 'thad par bstan pa @62b dang ; ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i chos de dag la skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa thob pa'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad khas len pa mi 'thad par bstan pa @62b dang ; ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i chos de dag la skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa thob pa'am /
translated: And it is shown that it is untenable to accept that the unarisen and arisen phenomena are attained as arisen or unarisen.

original: thob par bya ba med par dris pas de gnyi ga yang dngos por mi 'dod par ston pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i chos dag thob pa'i dri bas de gnyi ga dngos por 'dod pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: thob par bya ba med par dris pas de gnyi ga yang dngos por mi 'dod par ston pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa'i chos dag thob pa'i dri bas de gnyi ga dngos por 'dod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Since he asked about the non-existence of attainment, the Lord demonstrated that neither is a real entity.üîΩSince he asked about the attainment of dharmas that are unarisen and arisen, he refuted the notion that either is a real entity.

original: thob par bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa med par dris pas na de gnyi ga yang bden pa gnyis su gsungs pas mngon par rtogs par brjod pa bzhin du de gnyi ga yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thob par bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa med par dris pas na de gnyi ga yang bden pa gnyis su gsungs pas mngon par rtogs par brjod pa bzhin du de gnyi ga yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since he asked about the non-existence of attainment and realization, the Lord said that neither exists in the two truths, just as he said that realization is expressed.

original: de nyid kyis na ma skyes pa'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na ma skyes pa'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since he refuted the arising of the unarisen,

original: ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba yang bdag gis brjod par spobs pa med do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba yang bdag gis brjod par spobs pa med do //
translated: he also had no confidence in expressing the arising of the unarisen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye ba med pa dang / spobs pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir skye ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / spobs pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir skye ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because arising, confidence, and expression are not associated with the realization of arising, because they are without defining characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are non-arisen.

original: de la spobs pa brjod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de la spobs pa brjod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúeloquence‚Äù is a term for expression.

original: brjod pa ni brjod par bya ba yin pas na brjod pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni brjod par bya ba yin pas na brjod pa ste /
translated: Expression is that which is to be expressed,

original: don no // thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa da bzhin du 'gro ba lnga'i dbye ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: don no // thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa da bzhin du 'gro ba lnga'i dbye ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: meaning. Just as attainment and realization exist as worldly conventions, so too is the division into five destinies.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: don dam par ni las dang / rnam par smin pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni las dang / rnam par smin pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately, they are free from the characteristics of karma, ripening, arising, ceasing, affliction, and purification.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Is an unarisen phenomenon produced?üîΩOr is a arisen phenomenon produced?

original: 'on te skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur zhes dris pas ni /
analyzed: 'on te skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur zhes dris pas ni /
translated: By asking this,

original: de gnyi ga skye bar 'dod pa bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga skye bar 'dod pa bkag pa yin te /
translated: both are refuted.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba de zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba de zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that ‚Äúthat which exists‚Äù is that which is.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes dris pa ni gzugs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes dris pa ni gzugs nas brtsams te /
translated: The question What is it that does not wish to cause the arising of an unarisen phenomenon? is asked because

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du ma skyes pa yang mi skye ba dang / ma skyes pa'i chos zhes brjod pas dris pa thams cad kyi lan la thogs pa med pas gnas brtan rab 'byor ni chos ston pa'i nang na mchog tu bya bar 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du ma skyes pa yang mi skye ba dang / ma skyes pa'i chos zhes brjod pas dris pa thams cad kyi lan la thogs pa med pas gnas brtan rab 'byor ni chos ston pa'i nang na mchog tu bya bar 'os pa yin te /
translated: all phenomena, beginning with form, are unarisen and do not arise, and because the question is asked by expressing unrisen phenomena, the elder Subh≈´ti is worthy of being called supreme among those who teach the Dharma, because he is unimpeded in answering all questions.

original: chos thams cad la mi gnas pas mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'i 'os yin pas dbang bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi gnas pas mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'i 'os yin pas dbang bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is supreme by not abiding in any phenomena, he is worthy of being called one who teaches the perfection of wisdom. Therefore, he is to be understood as being worthy of being called one who teaches the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung pa rnams nas chos thams cad kyi bar du rang bzhin stong pa nyid nye bar bzung nas nang la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa ston pa la gnas par dbang @63a * //üîΩbar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung pa rnams nas chos thams cad kyi bar du rang bzhin stong pa nyid nye bar bzung nas nang la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa ston pa la gnas par dbang @63a * //üîΩbar shes par bya'o //
translated: Because he does not abide internally, etc., having taken up the emptiness of inherent nature of all phenomena, from the aggregates beginning with form up to all phenomena, he is to be understood as being worthy of being called one who teaches non-apprehension.

original: 'di'i mdo ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong na de nyid kyi phyir nang na yang mi gnas /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong na de nyid kyi phyir nang na yang mi gnas /
translated: The sutra passage here is: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, form is empty of the intrinsic nature of form. For that very reason, it does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na yang mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol na yang mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it does not exist externally, and so on.‚Äù

original: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa yang yod do //
translated: With reference to the path as the means of deliverance, it is said: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, there is also a mundane perfection of generosity,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la /
translated: and there is also a supramundane perfection of generosity.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i lam ston pa na sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po dmigs pas 'jig rten las mi g-yo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i lam ston pa na sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po dmigs pas 'jig rten las mi g-yo //
translated: When the path that causes the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects is taught, one does not move away from the mundane by objectifying the gift, the giver, and the receiver.

original: mi 'phags / mi 'da' bas na de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'phags / mi 'da' bas na de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one does not transcend, does not go beyond, therefore it is called the mundane perfection of generosity.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa des ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa des ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity that is dedicated to perfect enlightenment by means of the purity of the three sectors is called the supramundane perfection of generosity because it transcends the mundane by transcending the mundane.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nges pa brnyes pas na 'jig rten las g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nges pa brnyes pas na 'jig rten las g-yo ba'o //
translated: Here, it is supramundane because it attains the certainty of the supramundane path.

original: de'i thabs nye bar mtshon pas na 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs nye bar mtshon pas na 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is noble because it is characterized by the means for that.

original: de'i bar chad kyi chos yongs su spangs pa na 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bar chad kyi chos yongs su spangs pa na 'da' ba'o //
translated: It is transcendent because it abandons the qualities that obstruct that.

original: yang na g-yo ba ni sems bskyed pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: yang na g-yo ba ni sems bskyed pa'i dus su'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is supramundane at the time of generating the mind.

original: 'phags pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i dus su'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i dus su'o //
translated: It is noble at the time of the factors conducive to insight.

original: 'da' ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i dus su'o zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan no //
analyzed: 'da' ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i dus su'o zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan no //
translated: It is transcendent at the time of the knowledge of the Dharma of suffering. This is another formulation.

original: 'di la go bzlog pa mi g-yo //
analyzed: 'di la go bzlog pa mi g-yo //
translated: Here, the opposite should be understood as ‚Äúnot wavering,‚Äù

original: mi 'phags / mi 'da' ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'phags / mi 'da' ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: ‚Äúnot rising,‚Äù and ‚Äúnot passing beyond.‚Äù

original: gang gis 'jig rten mngon par grub pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten mngon par grub pa'am /
translated: It is the perfection of the worldly one who establishes the world,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten dang mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten dang mnyam pa'am /
translated: or who is equal to the world,

original: 'jig rten gyi phyir gang zhig sbyin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phyir gang zhig sbyin par byed pa'am /
translated: or who gives for the sake of the world,

original: gang gis 'jig rten mi 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten mi 'byung ba'am /
translated: or who does not appear in the world,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten la srid pa'am /üîΩ'jig rten du skye bar byed pas de ni 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten la srid pa'am / 'jig rten du skye bar byed pas de ni 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no //
translated: or who is possible in the world,üîΩor who is born in the world.

original: gang gis 'jig rten 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten 'da' ba'am /
translated: It is the perfection of the supramundane one who transcends the world,

original: gang gis 'jig rten sgrol ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten sgrol ba'am /
translated: or who liberates the world,

original: gang gis 'jig rten la brgal ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten la brgal ba'am /
translated: or who crosses over the world,

original: gang gis 'jig rten na mi srid pa'am /üîΩgang gis 'jig rten las nges par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten na mi srid pa'am / gang gis 'jig rten las nges par 'byung ba'am /
translated: or who is impossible in the world,üîΩor who goes beyond the world,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten pa rnams 'don pa'i phyir yin pa'am /üîΩgang 'jig rten gyis bla mar gyur pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten pa rnams 'don pa'i phyir yin pa'am /üîΩgang 'jig rten gyis bla mar gyur pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or who is for the sake of rescuing those in the world,üîΩor who is superior to the world.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni byang chub kyi lam nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa la sogs @63b pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni byang chub kyi lam nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa la sogs @63b pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are the path to enlightenment itself, because they are the cause of the realization of all noble beings of the past, etc., because the perfection of wisdom is their generator,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nges par 'byung ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems zhum pa nyid kyis mi skrag pa la sogs pa dang ma bral ba'i yid la byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nges par 'byung ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems zhum pa nyid kyis mi skrag pa la sogs pa dang ma bral ba'i yid la byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because they are to be known as the renunciation of the supramundane path of the noble ones, and because they are mental attentions that are not separated from non-fear, etc. due to mental depression.

original: de ltar na shin tu spros nas bkod pa'i yang dag pa'i tshig de rnams kyis brjod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu spros nas bkod pa'i yang dag pa'i tshig de rnams kyis brjod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, they are expressed by those correct words that are set forth in great detail.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can med pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of sentient beings, the non-existence of a self-nature, emptiness, isolation, and the non-attainment of complete buddhahood, one should know that mental attention is the non-attainment of complete buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should say that all dharmas, beginning with form, up to the knowledge of all modes, are not separated from the mental attention of a Bodhisattva.

original: de ltar nges par 'byung ba brgyad po 'di dag nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byung ba brgyad po 'di dag nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these eight emancipations should be known as the accomplishment of emancipation.

original: go cha'i bsgrub pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang rigs pa'i tshul nyid yin te /
analyzed: go cha'i bsgrub pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang rigs pa'i tshul nyid yin te /
translated: These accomplishments, beginning with the armor, are just the method of reasoning.

original: go cha bgos nas 'jug pa yin la zhugs pa ni dpung gi tshogs sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: go cha bgos nas 'jug pa yin la zhugs pa ni dpung gi tshogs sogs pa yin no //
translated: One sets out having donned the armor, and having set out, one is the one who gathers the army.

original: dpung gi tshogs bsags pa ni pham pa med par rgyal ba thob pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs bsags pa ni pham pa med par rgyal ba thob pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The accumulation of the army is the definite emergence of the attainment of victory without defeat.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // bsgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // bsgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
translated: the generation of the Thought, the precepts, the four limbs of definite emergence, and the basis of practice,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs pa dag dang ched dang ni //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs pa dag dang ched dang ni //
translated: the nature of the Reality limit, the objects, the purpose,

original: go cha'i 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // tshogs ni nges par 'byung bcas rnams //
analyzed: go cha'i 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // tshogs ni nges par 'byung bcas rnams //
translated: the activity of the engagement of the armor, and the collection with definite emergence,

original: thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
analyzed: thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
translated: are the omniscience of the Sage.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i go rims kyis 'brel ba yin par blta par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i go rims kyis 'brel ba yin par blta par bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as the connection by the order of gradual occurrence.

original: 'dis ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gyi go rims kyang rigs pa'i tshul yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gyi go rims kyang rigs pa'i tshul yin te /
translated: This is the method of reasoning for the order of the words of the meaning of the generation of the Thought, etc.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ni gdams ngag tshol ba don du gnyer ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ni gdams ngag tshol ba don du gnyer ba yin no //
translated: By the generation of the Thought of enlightenment, one seeks the precepts.

original: gdams ngag phyin ci ma log pa la gnas pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha skye'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag phyin ci ma log pa la gnas pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha skye'o //
translated: The factors conducive to insight arise in one who is established in the unerring instructions.

original: de nas ni bsgrub pa'i rten te /
analyzed: de nas ni bsgrub pa'i rten te /
translated: Then, the basis of practice is

original: rten gyi chos gang dang gang la dmigs pa dang / gang gi ched du bya ba dang / sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten gyi chos gang dang gang la dmigs pa dang / gang gi ched du bya ba dang / sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi gang yin pa'o //
translated: the four kinds of practice, which are the objective support, the purpose, and the practice itself, in regard to any given phenomenon that is the basis.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the realization of omniscience, from the treatise that teaches the perfection of wisdom as instructions, the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / @64a * //  rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bstan nas lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / @64a * //  rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bstan nas lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having explained the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path should be explained.üîΩIn this regard, first,

original: de la re zhig / lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig / lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make the gods suitableüîΩ, he obscures the light

original: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
analyzed: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
translated: , and in order to make the humans suitable, he teaches the Dharma.

original: zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúin order to make the gods suitable‚Äù are the remainder of the verse.

original: de la 'od kyis mog mog por byas pa ni gang lha'i tshogs thams cad kyi 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad nas 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal bsal bar
analyzed: de la 'od kyis mog mog por byas pa ni gang lha'i tshogs thams cad kyi 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad nas 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal bsal bar
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe light of all the hosts of gods was eclipsed by the light of the TathƒÅgata‚Äù is made in order to remove the pride of the guardians of the world and so forth in their meditative absorptions and so forth.

original: bya ba'i don du'o zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i don du'o zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is made in order to make them suitable recipients for the teaching.

original: bsal ba ni de rnams snod du rung bar bya ba'i mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: bsal ba ni de rnams snod du rung bar bya ba'i mdzad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMaking them suitable recipients‚Äù is the activity of making them suitable vessels.

original: de rnams nyid la byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams nyid la byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is in order to teach them how the great bodhisattvas should abide in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gang gnas par bya zhes gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bstan pa nyan par 'dod pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gang gnas par bya zhes gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bstan pa nyan par 'dod pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate the knowledge of the path, the elder Subh≈´ti teaches in order to listen to the meaning of ‚Äúhow one should abide in the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de la rang bzhin gyi 'od ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'od do //üîΩyul so sor nges pa ni gang byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de bstan pa'i skal ba med pa nyid kyis na byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi 'od ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'od do // yul so sor nges pa ni gang byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de bstan pa'i skal ba med pa nyid kyis na byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa
translated: Natural light is the light that arises from the evolution of karma.üîΩThe meaning of the object being specific is that the knowledge of the bodhisattva path is not shared with the sravakas and so on, because those who have not generated the mind of enlightenment do not have the good fortune to be taught the perfection of wisdom.

original: dang thun mong ma yin no zhes bstan te yul so sor nges pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dang thun mong ma yin no zhes bstan te yul so sor nges pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the object being specific.

original: de'i mdo ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i mdo ni 'di yin te /
translated: The sutra says:

original: koo shi ka lha'i bu gang blan med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka lha'i bu gang blan med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Kausika, those sons of gods who have not generated the mind for unexcelled, perfect enlightenment should generate it.

original: gang yang nges par zhugs pa 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa de dag skal ba med mod kyi zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang nges par zhugs pa 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa de dag skal ba med mod kyi zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who have entered certainty and cut the continuum of cyclic existence do not have the good fortune.

original: khyab pa ni gang sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: khyab pa ni gang sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The meaning of the pervasion is that from the generation of the mind of enlightenment,

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyogs gcig pa ma yin no zhes khyab pa'i don dang / gang zag mthar gyis pa'i khyad par gyi don gyis te //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyogs gcig pa ma yin no zhes khyab pa'i don dang / gang zag mthar gyis pa'i khyad par gyi don gyis te //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not partial is the universal meaning, and the special meaning of the individual is the meaning of the individual.

original: de ltar byas nas 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon @64b du 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad na 'di 'thad par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon @64b du 'gro ba'i dbang du mdzad na 'di 'thad par gyur pa yin te /
translated: If it is done in this way, it is tenable in terms of the prior freedom from attachment.

original: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na de dag la yang rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na de dag la yang rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: However, if they generate the mind for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, I rejoice in that.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa ni chos las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos la dmigs par byed pas de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs gang la yang kho bo bar chad mi byed do //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa ni chos las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos la dmigs par byed pas de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs gang la yang kho bo bar chad mi byed do //
translated: I do not create obstacles for any of their virtuous activities, because they focus on a Dharma that is superior to the Dharma.

original: des ni theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that the classification into three vehicles is intentional, not definitive.

original: rang bzhin ni gang ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam so sor nges pa'i lam yin zhing rtogs pas ni 'bras bu'i lam yin pa de ltar ni lam shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gang ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam so sor nges pa'i lam yin zhing rtogs pas ni 'bras bu'i lam yin pa de ltar ni lam shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The nature is that the path of the bodhisattva who knows the path is not like the path of the sravakas and so on, which is a path that is individually determined and is realized as the path of the result.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spong ba ma yin pas rang gi ngo bo khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gyis ji skad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spong ba ma yin pas rang gi ngo bo khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gyis ji skad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the nature is superior in essence because it is not the complete abandonment of the afflictions.

original: byed pa ni gang ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir spong bsgom par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: byed pa ni gang ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir spong bsgom par byed pa yin la /
translated: The function is that the path of the sravakas and so on is cultivated in order to abandon and to manifest the limit of reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The realization of the bodhisattva is not like that.

original: gzhan du na 'di'i lam shes pa nyid ni sems can yong su smin pa la sogs pa'i byed pa sgom pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di'i lam shes pa nyid ni sems can yong su smin pa la sogs pa'i byed pa sgom pa yin te /
translated: Otherwise, the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattva would be cultivated as the function of bringing sentient beings to maturity and so on.

original: de'i byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the result of that function is superior in meaning.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi rung bar byed pa'i yul so sor nges pa dang / khyab pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang byed pa rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi rung bar byed pa'i yul so sor nges pa dang / khyab pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang byed pa rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the object of the path knowledge, its certainty, its pervasion, its nature, and its function,

original: da ni nyan thos kyi lam brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nyan thos kyi lam brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: now, since the ≈õrƒÅvaka path is to be described, therefore:

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni ;üîΩ/'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //üîΩnyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni ; /'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi / rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni // nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
translated: The way of path knowledgeüîΩis to be known through the ≈õrƒÅvaka path

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: by way of the non-observation of the aspects of the four noble truths.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyis sa la sogs pa'i khams drug / bu ga nam mkha'i khams zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyis sa la sogs pa'i khams drug / bu ga nam mkha'i khams zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that the six elements such as earth and so on are the aggregates of form and so forth, and the space element is the cavities.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan ba'i yid la byed pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa 'dod pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan ba'i yid la byed pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa 'dod pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the limbs of dependent arising are the desire for the vehicles of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth, and the meaning of unmixed.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med @65a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med @65a * //
translated: suffering, selfless,üîΩpeaceful,üîΩa disease, a boil, a thorn, a calamity, an affliction,üîΩan obstruction, a plague, a disaster, a calamity, a misfortune,

original: pa dang / zhi ba dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rdu dang / sdig pa dang / pha rol nyid dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang /
analyzed: pa dang / zhi ba dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rdu dang / sdig pa dang / pha rol nyid dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang /
translated: and a danger.

original: 'tshe ba rnams ni nyan thos kyi lam rnam pa rnams yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir sbyor bas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tshe ba rnams ni nyan thos kyi lam rnam pa rnams yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir sbyor bas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The aspects of the ≈örƒÅvaka path are taught to be applied by the non-apprehension of the mental attentions to impermanence, up to peace.

original: de la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas zhi ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba nas zhi ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the aspects of the truth of suffering are from ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù up to ‚Äúpeaceful.‚Äù

original: nad ces bya ba nas sdig pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: nad ces bya ba nas sdig pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspects of the truth of origination are from ‚Äúa disease‚Äù up to ‚Äúa calamity.‚Äù

original: pha rol dang / 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni de dag re re la yid 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol dang / 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni de dag re re la yid 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspects of disgust with each of them are ‚Äúthe other shore‚Äù and ‚Äúsubject to destruction.‚Äù

original: g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni de dag re re nyid la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni de dag re re nyid la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoving‚Äù and ‚Äúcompletely perishing‚Äù are the aspects of detachment from each of those.

original: 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni de dag re re la 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni de dag re re la 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFear,‚Äù ‚Äúillness,‚Äù and ‚Äúviolence‚Äù are the aspects of cessation with regard to each of those.

original: de ltar byas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the noble disciples enter the meditative absorption of cessation in order to become disgusted and detached.

original: de la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúImpermanent‚Äù means that it has the nature of arising and perishing.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúSuffering‚Äù means that it is associated with the outflows.üîΩ‚ÄúEmpty‚Äù means that it is not a self.

original: rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúImpersonal‚Äù means that it is not a person.

original: de ltar byas na mi rtag pa yang 'phags pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na mi rtag pa yang 'phags pa'i lam yin te /
translated: Thus, the noble path is also impermanent.

original: zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa ma yin pas 'di sdug bsngal ba nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa ma yin pas 'di sdug bsngal ba nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is free from outflows, it is not contrary to the noble ones, and therefore it does not follow that it is suffering.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis btags pa'i bdag gis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis btags pa'i bdag gis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúselfless‚Äù because it is empty of the self that is imagined by others.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid bdag med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid bdag med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúpeaceful‚Äù because it is itself selfless.

original: nad ces bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sa bon dang 'dra bar rgyu'i rtsa bar gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshu ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩzug rdu zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad ces bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sa bon dang 'dra bar rgyu'i rtsa bar gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // shu ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // zug rdu zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called a ‚Äúdisease‚Äù because it is the root cause of suffering, like a seed that is the cause of a fruit.üîΩIt is called a ‚Äúboil‚Äù because it is the origin of suffering.üîΩIt is called a ‚Äúthorn‚Äù because it is the condition of suffering.

original: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
translated: It is called ‚Äúevil‚Äù because it is the cause of the succession of suffering.

original: rab tu 'byung ba nyid kyis shin tu 'joms pa @65b nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba nyid kyis shin tu 'joms pa @65b nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe supreme going forth‚Äù because it is the complete destruction of suffering through renunciation.

original: pha rol zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúother‚Äù refers to the fact that they are opposed to the former.

original: 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'i dngos pos 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'i dngos pos 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúsubject to destruction‚Äù refers to the fact that they are subject to destruction by the very nature of their opposition.

original: yid 'byung ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are also the objects of disgust.

original: g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor gnas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor gnas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù refers to the fact that they do not remain in existence in the same form.

original: rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid la ltos pa med par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid la ltos pa med par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúsubject to change‚Äù refers to the fact that they are subject to change by nature, without any cause.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dmigs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is that they are also the objects of detachment.

original: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dang gzhan gyi gnong pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dang gzhan gyi gnong pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúfearful‚Äù refers to the fact that they are the basis of fear in this life and the next.

original: 'go ba'i nad ces bya ba ni srin po la sogs pa rtsol ba las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad ces bya ba ni srin po la sogs pa rtsol ba las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúdisease‚Äù refers to the fact that they are the source of all the troubles of living beings.

original: 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang / thog 'bab pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang / thog 'bab pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The harm is the basis for the occurrence of the disturbance of the great elements, the falling of lightning, and so on.

original: 'gog pa'i dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes 'thad pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to say that it becomes the object of cessation.

original: yid la byed pa de nyid kyis ma rig pa 'gog pa ni bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa zhes bya ba gsum ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de nyid kyis ma rig pa 'gog pa ni bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa zhes bya ba gsum ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The cessation of ignorance by that very attention is the three aspects of the truth of cessation: selflessness, peace, and isolation.

original: nges par 'byung ba rnam pa bzhi ni gang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa nyid kyi yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba rnam pa bzhi ni gang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa nyid kyi yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes par bstan pa yin te /
translated: The four kinds of deliverance are taught as the knowledge by way of non-apprehension of the attention of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-conditioning.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pas ji ltar nges par 'byung ba dang / gang nges par 'byung ba dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pas ji ltar nges par 'byung ba dang / gang nges par 'byung ba dang / mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa'o ;
translated: The deliverance is by the three doors of liberation, and so on; the what is delivered is the non-conditioning.

original: / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor ni lam gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor ni lam gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The yoga of the non-apprehension of the nature of the elements of enlightenment is the aspect of the path.

original: de rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa'i don gyis na lam gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa'i don gyis na lam gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: It is the aspect of the path because it causes one to attain the city of nirvana.

original: de nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya bas ni rtogs pa ma lus pa'i rigs pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya bas ni rtogs pa ma lus pa'i rigs pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: That very [yoga] is called the application of the non-apprehension of the practice of the perfections such as generosity. It is the aspect of reasoning because it is the reasoning for all realizations.

original: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na bdag dang / bdag gi dang 'brel ba'i chos la so sor rtogs pas na bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na bdag dang / bdag gi dang 'brel ba'i chos la so sor rtogs pas na bdag med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, when one practices the perfection of wisdom, one realizes the self and the phenomena connected with the self, so it is selfless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdge @66a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdge @66a * //
translated: Why is that?üîΩIt is because of the non-apprehension of the self and phenomena connected with the self.

original: ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems 'grogs pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis ni 'grogs pa ma yin pas byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems 'grogs pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems 'grogs pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis ni 'grogs pa ma yin pas byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems 'grogs pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two roots of virtue do not accompany each other, the thought of awakening and the thought of dedication do not accompany each other.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gnyis ni gcig la gcig yod pa ma yin zhing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gnyis ni gcig la gcig yod pa ma yin zhing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Because the thought of awakening and the thought of dedication do not exist in relation to each other, and are not observed. This is the aspect of accomplishment.

original: rtogs pa'i phyir bsgrub pa yin pas na bsgrub pa'o /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i phyir bsgrub pa yin pas na bsgrub pa'o /
translated: It is accomplishment because it is realization.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?
