original: byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dag ni sems ma yin pa nyid kyis na sems ma yin pas sems ma yin pa yongs su bsngo ba ni mi 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dag ni sems ma yin pa nyid kyis na sems ma yin pas sems ma yin pa yongs su bsngo ba ni mi 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: That which is not thought is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is inconceivable is not thought.

original: de ltar chos so sor brtags pa la mngon bar zhen pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pas nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos so sor brtags pa la mngon bar zhen pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pas nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Thus, the non-attachment to the examination of the Dharma is the perfection of wisdom itself, and so is the aspect of emancipation.

original: mngon bar zhen pa med par 'gro ba ni nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon bar zhen pa med par 'gro ba ni nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because emancipation is the going without attachment.

original: nyan thos kyi lam la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa rnam pa bcu drug tu bzhag pa bshad zin nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa rnam pa bcu drug tu bzhag pa bshad zin nas /
translated: The sixteen aspects of the four noble truths as objects of the ≈õrƒÅvaka path have been explained.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the factors conducive to penetration should be mentioned.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //
translated: The noble ≈õrƒÅvaka‚Äôs path

original: gzugs la sogs pa stong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa stong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because form, etc. are empty,

original: stong pa nyid rnams dbyer med pas //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnams dbyer med pas //
translated: the emptinesses are undifferentiated.

original: dro ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dro ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the stage of heat is taught.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a scripture declares,

original: koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: Kausika, form is empty of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And similarly, feeling, etc. are empty of feeling, etc. The emptiness of form, etc. is not dual and is not nondual, and so on.

original: de dag mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pas /
translated: Since they are not perceived,

original: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: the summits are accepted.

original: ces bstan pa'i mdo ni ji skad du /
analyzed: ces bstan pa'i mdo ni ji skad du /
translated: The teaching of the sutra is as follows:

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Kausika, here the bodhisattva mahasattva should not stand in form, etc. by way of not taking a stand on anything.üîΩAnd similarly, he should not stand in feeling, etc.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la @66b gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde la rtag pa la sogs tshul gyis //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la @66b gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // de la rtag pa la sogs tshul gyis //
translated: There, the acceptances are

original: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
analyzed: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
translated: the refutation of the stand by way of permanence, etc.

original: zhes bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bstan te /
translated: So it is said.

original: ji skad du mdo las /üîΩgzugs rtag ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las / gzugs rtag ces bya ba 'am /
translated: As a sutra teaches:

original: mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not abide in the thought that form is permanent or impermanent,

original: bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang /
translated: happy or sad, self or selfless, peaceful or not peaceful, empty or not empty,üîΩwith signs or signless, having aspirations or lacking aspirations.

original: mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang ; smon pa med ces bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang ; smon pa med ces bya bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Abide without objectifying anything.üîΩThe path of the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas is explained

original: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni //üîΩmi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis //üîΩchos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
analyzed: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni // mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis // chos kyi mchog tu 'gyur bshad de //
translated: in the ten groundsüîΩthrough extensive teachings on nonabiding.

original: zhes bstan pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi lam yin te /
translated: It is explained to be the supreme doctrine.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sutra teaches:

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sangs rgyas kyi sgra yang yod par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sangs rgyas kyi sgra yang yod par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas should not abide in the first bh≈´mi by way of an objective mental support, and so on, up to ‚ÄòIn my buddha realm may there not even be the sound of the word buddha.‚ÄôüîΩ

original: bya'o zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: bya'o zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: The great bodhisattva should not abide in the first ground by way of apprehending it, up to he should not abide in the first ground by way of apprehending it, saying, ‚ÄúIn my buddhafield, may the sound of buddha not exist.‚ÄùüîΩWhy is that?

original: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //
analyzed: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //
translated: Because the Buddha, knowing, does not see phenomena.

original: zhes bstan pa'i mdo ni ji skad du /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i mdo ni ji skad du /
translated: The s≈´tra that teaches this says:

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag
translated: Thus, the tathƒÅgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddha, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, does not apprehend any phenomena because of not apprehending all phenomena.

original: nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nas brtsams te /
translated: Starting from there,

original: 'di zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa dang 'brel par byas pas nyan thos kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa dang 'brel par byas pas nyan thos kyi lam yin no //
translated: This is connected with the chapter, so it is the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is in all cases the method of non-apprehension.

original: lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the mastery of knowledge of the path,

original: shes bya nyan thos kyi lam gyi rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya nyan thos kyi lam gyi rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: the object of knowledge is the explanation of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: nyan thos kyi lam bshad nas //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam bshad nas //
translated: Having explained the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam brjod par bya'o //
translated: the path of the pratyekabuddhas should be stated.üîΩTo that, first:

original: de la re zhig / rang 'byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig / rang 'byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of realizing the self-originated,

original: gzhan gyis @67a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis @67a * //
translated: others

original: bstan kyang mi dgos la //
analyzed: bstan kyang mi dgos la //
translated: do not need to teach.

original: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge of the rhinoceros-like

original: zab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
analyzed: zab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
translated: is declared to be profound.

original: ces bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the pratyekabuddha.

original: gzhan gyis bstan kyang mi dgos pa'i don ni gang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gang gnod sbyin gyi skad la sogs pa ni shes par rung gi / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bshad pa ni don shes par mi rung zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan kyang mi dgos pa'i don ni gang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gang gnod sbyin gyi skad la sogs pa ni shes par rung gi / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bshad pa ni don shes par mi rung zhes bstan te /
translated: The elder Subh≈´ti‚Äôs explanation is not suitable for understanding the meaning.

original: de la gnod sbyin rnams rang gi brda go bar byed de /
analyzed: de la gnod sbyin rnams rang gi brda go bar byed de /
translated: There, the yak·π£as understand their own language.

original: gnod sbyin gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sgra'o //
translated: The yak·π£as‚Äô language is the language of the yak·π£as.

original: spyi ni tshig ste ji snyed kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs pa ni skad de /
analyzed: spyi ni tshig ste ji snyed kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs pa ni skad de /
translated: The general term is the word. The complete meaning that is desired to be expressed is the language.

original: ngag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúspeech‚Äù is that.

original: gang dang gang gi gtam gyi sgo gzhan gyis dris pa de dang de'i lan smra ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi gtam gyi sgo gzhan gyis dris pa de dang de'i lan smra ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The explanation of whatever is asked by others through the door of whatever conversation is the expression.

original: de lta bu ni shes par rung gi 'phags pa gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa dang / brjod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / gtan la phab par ston pa de ni shes par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu ni shes par rung gi 'phags pa gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa dang / brjod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / gtan la phab par ston pa de ni shes par mi rung ngo //
translated: Such a thing is possible to know, but it is not possible to know the noble elder Subh≈´ti‚Äôs teaching, expression, demonstration, analysis, clarification, and definitive teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la gsol ba btab nas ston pa de ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la gsol ba btab nas ston pa de ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The teaching that is requested and then taught is the teaching.

original: dris na lan smra ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dris na lan smra ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The answering of questions is the expression.

original: de gnyis gdul bya rmongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis gdul bya rmongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'chad pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: Those two, from the perspective of the disciples‚Äô confusion, are the demonstration.

original: bag med pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ched du ston pa mdzad pa ni rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bag med pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ched du ston pa mdzad pa ni rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: From the perspective of the heedless, the teaching that is deliberately demonstrated is called the analysis.

original: de yang lha'i bu dag yi ge gcig kyang brjod pa med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de yang lha'i bu dag yi ge gcig kyang brjod pa med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, it is said, ‚ÄúO sons of the gods, not a single syllable is expressed.‚Äù

original: ston pa dang / nyan pa bkag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni yi ge med pa yin te /
analyzed: ston pa dang / nyan pa bkag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni yi ge med pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom and perfect enlightenment are without syllables, because the teacher and the listener are prohibited,

original: sbrul pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i dpes yi ge med par ston pa dang / nyan pa dang / shes par byed pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbrul pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i dpes yi ge med par ston pa dang / nyan pa dang / shes par byed pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because they are taught, heard, and known without syllables, as shown by the examples of a magical creation, a dream, an echo, and an illusion.

original: chos ston pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa ji ltar med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos ston pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa ji ltar med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is no teaching of the Dharma and no verbal expression?

original: chos ston pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / chos ston pa'i tshig tu smra bas kyang rnam par g-yeng ba chen por 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / chos ston pa'i tshig tu smra bas kyang rnam par g-yeng ba chen por 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Because it is the cause for attaining the result of teaching the Dharma, and because the verbal expression of teaching the Dharma is a great distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng bas kyang rgyud shas cher 'khrugs pa skyed par byed pa yin par dgongs pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub @67b sems dpar gyur pa na 'di ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar tshig tu smra
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bas kyang rgyud shas cher 'khrugs pa skyed par byed pa yin par dgongs pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub @67b sems dpar gyur pa na 'di ltar bdag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar tshig tu smra
translated: Also, distraction greatly disturbs the mindstream.

original: ba med par yang chos ston cing sems can gyi don gyi bya ba rdzogs par byed par nus par gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa yin no //
analyzed: ba med par yang chos ston cing sems can gyi don gyi bya ba rdzogs par byed par nus par gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the Bhagavat Buddha was a bodhisattva, he made the following aspiration: ‚ÄúHaving attained buddhahood, may I be able to teach the Dharma like a wish-fulfilling jewel, without speaking, and may I be able to complete the activities that benefit sentient beings.‚ÄùüîΩTo demonstrate that it is possible to teach the meaning without speaking,

original: tshig tu smra ba med par yang don ston pa rung pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba med par yang don ston pa rung pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: gang dang gang don gang gang la //
analyzed: gang dang gang don gang gang la //
translated: Whatever the meaning,üîΩwhatever the listener,

original: ji lta ji ltar de la nyan //üîΩde la sgra med kyang don te //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar de la nyan // de la sgra med kyang don te //
translated: however the listener hears it,

original: de ni de lta de ltar snang //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta de ltar snang // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the meaning appears in that way, even without sound.

original: de la ye shes zab mo 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ye shes zab mo 'di yin te /
translated: This is the profound wisdom.

original: de skad du mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: kye ma gnas brtan ba 'byor 'di ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: kye ma gnas brtan ba 'byor 'di ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: The Lord: Ah, Subhuti, this is the clear light of the Elder,

original: zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston pa la /üîΩphra ba bas kyang shin tu phra bar 'jug go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston pa la / phra ba bas kyang shin tu phra bar 'jug go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.

original: de la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis nye bar bstan pa'i don shes par mi nus shing zab ba yin la /
analyzed: de la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis nye bar bstan pa'i don shes par mi nus shing zab ba yin la /
translated: The Elder Subhuti has shown the meaning of profound as being that which cannot be known, and subtle as being that which cannot be expressed in words.üîΩThe Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.

original: yi ge gcig tsam yang ma brjod par thob bas shin tu zab pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge gcig tsam yang ma brjod par thob bas shin tu zab pa yin no //
translated: The Elder Subhuti has shown the meaning of profound as being that which cannot be known, and subtle as being that which cannot be expressed in words.üîΩThe Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.

original: de nyid mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rang nyid kyis mngon bar rtogs pa dang / rkyen zab mo khong du chud pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rdzogs par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rang nyid kyis mngon bar rtogs pa dang / rkyen zab mo khong du chud pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rdzogs par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.üîΩThe Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.üîΩThe Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.üîΩThe Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.üîΩThe Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle as if it were gross.

original: bdag nyid gcig pu'i don du dmigs nas rang nyid sangs rgyas pas na rang sangs rgyas so //üîΩnyan thos su thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pu'i don du dmigs nas rang nyid sangs rgyas pas na rang sangs rgyas so //üîΩnyan thos su thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The Lord: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is the clear light of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which shows what is profound as if it were shallow, and what is subtle

original: de ni gzhan gyi lung la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi lung la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not depend on the teachings of another.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs it a perfect buddha?,‚Äù it is not.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pas de rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pas de rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is superior to them by means of the benefit of sentient beings through omniscience.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni gang gis ji tsam zhig rtogs pa tsam de la rang nyid mngon du sangs rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni gang gis ji tsam zhig rtogs pa tsam de la rang nyid mngon du sangs rgyas pa yin no //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas are self-buddhas who realize just that much.

original: yang de rnams kyis rtogs pa ni gang ji tsam zhig rtogs she na /üîΩgzung bar rtogs pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
analyzed: yang de rnams kyis rtogs pa ni gang ji tsam zhig rtogs she na / gzung bar rtogs pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is realized by them? How much is realized?‚Äù

original: rten gyi bse ru lta bu'i lam //
analyzed: rten gyi bse ru lta bu'i lam //
translated: The path of the rhinoceros-like is

original: yang dag bsdus pa shes par bya //
analyzed: yang dag bsdus pa shes par bya //
translated: to be understood as the true collectionüîΩof the realization of the apprehended, the nonabandonment of the apprehender,

original: zhes ston pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes ston pa yin te /
translated: and the support.üîΩThe path of the rhinoceros-like is to be understood as the true collection of the realization of the apprehended, the nonabandonment of the apprehender, and the support.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas phung po dang / khams dang / @68a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas phung po dang / khams dang / @68a * //
translated: Because they are taught in terms of the discriminations apprehended by them, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, up to the knowledge of all aspects are extensively taught.

original: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rgya cher rang bzhin zab pa dang / phra ba bkag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa yin par bstan pas ni de rnams nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rgya cher rang bzhin zab pa dang / phra ba bkag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa yin par bstan pas ni de rnams nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the Buddha is taught to have abandoned one part of the obscurations to omniscience by refuting their profound and subtle natures, it implicitly teaches that they are superior to the ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩThis is not a teaching on the Dharma of speech.

original: 'di ni ngag gi chos bstan pa ma yin no zhes rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du mdzad nas byang chub tu btags pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gi chos bstan pa ma yin no zhes rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du mdzad nas byang chub tu btags pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught in terms of the pratyekabuddhas, up to ‚Äúthere is no designation of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: de rnams kyis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon the discriminations apprehended by them.

original: yi ger btags pa med do zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi rang gi mngon par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩla la zhig rgyun tu zhugs ba'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yi ger btags pa med do zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi rang gi mngon par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // la la zhig rgyun tu zhugs ba'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: There is no designation in syllables means that they are their own realization.

original: la la zhig rang byang chub thob par 'dod na yang bzod pa 'di la ma brten par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i bar ni lam shes pa nyid la lam thams cad yul du bya dgos nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: la la zhig rang byang chub thob par 'dod na yang bzod pa 'di la ma brten par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i bar ni lam shes pa nyid la lam thams cad yul du bya dgos nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If someone wishes to abide in the result of stream entry, up to if someone wishes to attain individual enlightenment, it is not accomplished without relying on this acceptance. This is stated in the knowledge of the path, where all paths must be taken as objects.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la de rnams kyis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la de rnams kyis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni spangs pa yin la /
translated: In the path of the pratyekabuddhas, the conceptualization of apprehending those is abandoned.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni sems can de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: From the perspective of not abandoning the conceptualization of the apprehender, it is stated, Those sentient beings are like an illusion,

original: chos bstan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chos bstan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: and those teachings of the dharma are also like an illusion.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni 'dzin pa'i dngos po med par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni 'dzin pa'i dngos po med par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pratyekabuddhas have not realized the absence of the substantial subject.

original: sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dang 'di la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dang 'di la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa las brtsams te /
translated: The previous statement, ‚ÄúOne should train like an illusory person, from the perspective of the knowledge of all aspects,‚Äù and this statement are not contradictory.

original: phung po la sogs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bur bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bur bshad pa yin no //
translated: From the aggregates up to nirvƒÅ·πáa, it is explained that they are like a dream and like an illusion.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgyu ma dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de las gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de las gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Because there is no duality and no division in an illusion and in nirvƒÅ·πáa, etc.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ma spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ma spangs pa yin no //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas have not eliminated the aspect of grasping the path.

original: rtogs pa'i rten rigs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshol ba bstan nas rang sangs rgyas dgag @68b pa'i don te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rten rigs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshol ba bstan nas rang sangs rgyas dgag @68b pa'i don te /
translated: The statement from the viewpoint of the potential that is the support for realization is for the purpose of refuting pratyekabuddhas, having taught the perfection of wisdom to irreversible bodhisattva mahasattva and so on.

original: de rnams nyid gzugs la sogs pa dang / de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa gnyis phan tshul rtog pa bkag ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid gzugs la sogs pa dang / de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa gnyis phan tshul rtog pa bkag ste /
translated: Those very ones are refuted in terms of both form and so on and its emptiness and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'di la chos gang yang ma brjod ma bshad de /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'di la chos gang yang ma brjod ma bshad de /
translated: Because in this way nothing at all is said or explained here.

original: de bzhin du 'di la sems can gang yang yid ches par byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du mdzad nas sems can gang yang yid ches par byed pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la sems can gang yang yid ches par byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gang gsungs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang du mdzad nas sems can gang yang yid ches par byed pa med do //
translated: Similarly, in this way no sentient being at all is caused to believe, as stated by the passage up to ‚Äúthere is no sentient being at all that is caused to believe.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i gnas su byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshigs don med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni de gsal bar byas pa yin no //üîΩtshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po rgyas par bstan zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / rten gyi sbyor ba'i gnas su byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshigs don med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni de gsal bar byas pa yin no // tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po rgyas par bstan zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In the section on the application of the basis, the phrase ‚Äúthe bodhisattva‚Äù is clarified by the words ‚Äúis not found.‚Äù

original: rnam pa mang po zhig gi mtha' rdzogs par byas nas /üîΩtshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam pa mang po zhig gi mtha' rdzogs par byas nas / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúWell then, Venerable Subh≈´ti, in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are taught in detail‚Äù and ending with the words ‚Äúthe bodhisattva, the great being, will have the eloquence that is exalted and distinguished above all worlds‚Äù is the section on the teaching of the three vehicles.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags shing khyad par du zhugs pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'i bar du yang 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags shing khyad par du zhugs pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'i bar du yang 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, it is so‚Äù and ending with the words ‚Äúthe bodhisattva, the great being, will have the eloquence that is exalted and distinguished above all worlds‚Äù is the section on the teaching of the three vehicles.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mngon bar 'dod pa'i don yang dag par grub pas dngos por gyur pa'i rten med par yang rtogs pa'i chos thob par bstan pa'i ched du sprul pa'i me tog gtor ba yin la /

translated: The passage up to ‚Äúin a way that is not objectified‚Äù indicates that the flowers emanated were to demonstrate that the attainment of the Dharma of realization is not dependent on a substantial basis, since the intended meaning of the s≈´tra is perfectly established.üîΩJust as those flowers were unarisen flowers,

original: me tog de dag kyang ma skyes pa'i me tog yin pa dang 'dra bar gzugs nas brtsams te /üîΩchos thams cad kyi bar dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du ma byung ba nyid kyis de nas brtsams te /
analyzed: me tog de dag kyang ma skyes pa'i me tog yin pa dang 'dra bar gzugs nas brtsams te / chos thams cad kyi bar dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du ma byung ba nyid kyis de nas brtsams te /
translated: from form up to the perfect buddhas are unarisen.üîΩFrom that point onward,

original: 'di zhes bya ba'i bar du byed pa dang 'brel par bsgrubs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi lam rtogs pa'i rten bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba'i bar du byed pa dang 'brel par bsgrubs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi lam rtogs pa'i rten bstan pa yin no //
translated: the passage up to ‚Äúthis‚Äù is established as being related to the action of the buddhas. This demonstrates the basis for the realization of the path of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas de dag gis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas de dag gis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
translated: Since those pratyekabuddhas have eliminated the conception of apprehending, their realization of the pratyekabuddha path is superior to that of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams las sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams las sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: But the Buddha's realization is superior to that of the pratyekabuddhas because he has abandoned the conceptualization of grasping.üîΩThe superiority of the cause of realization is shown by the family.

original: rigs kyis ni rtogs pa'i rgyu khyad zhugs par bstan pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yin no //üîΩde ni @69a * //
analyzed: rigs kyis ni rtogs pa'i rgyu khyad zhugs par bstan pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yin no // de ni @69a * //
translated: This is the path of the pratyekabuddha.üîΩWith regard to the path of the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩbtags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / btags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar //
translated: the stage of warmth is taught as follows:üîΩThe stage of warmth is the aspect of the path of insight

original: ston pa'i rnam pa dror gyur pa //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa'i rnam pa dror gyur pa // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: that is not in conflict with the reality of the imputed.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni de ltar btags pa dang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni de ltar btags pa dang mi 'gal la /
translated: Oh! The elder Subhuti does not contradict the imputed,üîΩand he teaches reality. He is said to have profound wisdom.

original: chos nyid kyang ston pa ni shes rab zab po zhes bya ba dang / gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston pa ni shes rab zab po zhes bya ba dang / gzugs ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: Form is a mere imputation,

original: de yang chos nyid de /
analyzed: de yang chos nyid de /
translated: and that is reality.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi 'gal bar ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The elder Subhuti teaches without contradiction.

original: rtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs //üîΩ'grib pa med la sogs pas phye //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs // 'grib pa med la sogs pas phye //
translated: The peak is the form, etc.

original: zhes bstan te /üîΩgang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: zhes bstan te / gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: The formless is distinguished by the absence of decrease, etc.üîΩIt is taught that one does not train in order to increase or decrease anything, from form up to omniscience.

original: yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar bya ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that one does not train in order to grasp or abandon anything, from form up to omniscience.

original: bzod pa ni /üîΩnang stong nyid la sogs pa yis //
analyzed: bzod pa ni / nang stong nyid la sogs pa yis //
translated: Patience isüîΩThe patience of not grasping form, etc.

original: gzugs sogs mi 'dzin phyir bzod pa //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs mi 'dzin phyir bzod pa // zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Due to inner emptiness, etc.

original: gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su gzung ba med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su gzung ba med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that one does not grasp anything, from form up to omniscience, due to inner emptiness up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.üîΩThe supreme mundane state isüîΩThe aspect of the non-arising, etc.

original: gzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyi //üîΩrnam pa can ni chos kyi mchog / ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyi //üîΩrnam pa can ni chos kyi mchog / ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: Of form, etc.

original: ji skad du gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong /
analyzed: ji skad du gzugs kyi skye ba mi mthong /
translated: The arising of form is not seen,

original: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / sogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba mi mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / sogs pa dang / 'bri ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba mi mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: its cessation, its adoption, its discarding, its defilement, its purification, and so forth, its decrease, its increase are not seen.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bshad nas mthong ba'i lam phan yon dang bcas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ;
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bshad nas mthong ba'i lam phan yon dang bcas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ;
translated: Having explained the path of the pratyekabuddha, from the perspective of the path of seeing and its benefits, it is said:üîΩThrough four moments of acceptance and knowledge

original: bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi yis //
analyzed: bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi yis //
translated: of the truths,

original: lam shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam //üîΩphan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do //
analyzed: lam shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam // phan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do //
translated: the path of seeing

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: is explained, along with its benefits.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni gcig @69b las gcig gud na med par dgag pa'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis ston te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni gcig @69b las gcig gud na med par dgag pa'i rnam grangs gzhan gyis ston te /
translated: Regarding this, the acceptance of the knowledge of phenomena with regard to suffering is taught through another enumeration, negating that the Tathagatas exist separately from each other.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: koo shi ka gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not apprehended in the suchness of form,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: nor is the TathƒÅgata apprehended apart from suchness.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni koo shi ka gzugs rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgya che ba yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni koo shi ka gzugs rgya che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgya che ba yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering is the vastness of the perfection of the bodhisattvas, Kau≈õika, because form is vast.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /
translated: Kau≈õika, it is because the prior limit of form is not apprehended,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
translated: the later limit is not apprehended,

original: dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //üîΩsdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang koo shi ka gzugs gzhal du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no // sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang koo shi ka gzugs gzhal du med pa'i phyir /
translated: and the middle is not apprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhal du med pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhal du med pa yin te /
translated: The acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of suffering is the infinitude of the perfection of the bodhisattvas, Kau≈õika, because form is immeasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzhal du med pa'i phyir dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzhal du med pa'i phyir dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Kau≈õika, it is explained like this: because form is immeasurable, it is not apprehended.

original: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi gzugs 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi gzugs 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: What is called immeasurable is that whose form cannot be measured in terms of change.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni gang koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshad med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni gang koo shi ka gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshad med do //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of suffering is taught in the passage beginning with Kau≈õika, this perfection is immeasurable because form is immeasurable.

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /üîΩnam mkha'i tshad ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na / nam mkha'i tshad ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Kau≈õika, it is like this:üîΩfor example, the measure of space cannot be apprehended.

original: tshad ces bya ba ni dbyings rnams phra rab kyi bar du gzhig tu rung bar bshad pa yin pas tshad rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ces bya ba ni dbyings rnams phra rab kyi bar du gzhig tu rung bar bshad pa yin pas tshad rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: What is called measure is explained as being suitable to be destroyed down to the most subtle particles, so measures are not the characteristic of the formless.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang koo shi ka gzugs mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang koo shi ka gzugs mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa yin te /
translated: The patience that is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the origin is taught in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúKau≈õika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas is infinite because form is infinite.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtha' dang dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtha' dang dbus mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Kau≈õika, it is because the end and the middle of form are not apprehended.‚Äù

original: de ni rgyu bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu bkag pa yin no //
translated: This is the refutation of the cause.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis na kun 'byung bkag pa yin no //üîΩchos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas @70a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis na kun 'byung bkag pa yin no // chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas @70a * //
translated: The refutation of the origin is by the infinitude of the perfection, because the knowledge of all aspects has an infinite objective support.

original: pa nyid kyis ni rab tu skye ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid kyis ni rab tu skye ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: The refutation of arising is by the infinitude of the perfection, because the dharma-dhƒÅtu is infinite.

original: de bzhin nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni skye ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid mtha' yas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni skye ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: The refutation of birth is by the infinitude of the perfection, because suchness is infinite.

original: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the infinitude of sentient beings,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa sems can gyi khams la dmigs par byed par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa sems can gyi khams la dmigs par byed par bstan pa yin no //
translated: the infinitude of the perfections shows the forbearance of the dharma of the origin, which takes the realm of sentient beings as its object.üîΩThe knowledge of the dharma of the origin is the one who is never separate from the attention of the perfection of wisdom.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is indicated by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúThis should be held as the Tathagata himself.‚Äù

original: de'i mdo ni lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor dang ma bral bar gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i mdo ni lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor dang ma bral bar gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The sutra says, ‚ÄúDivine son, if a bodhisattva becomes never separate from the yoga of nonapprehending the perfection of wisdom, he should be held as the Tathagata himself.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are extensively taught.‚Äù

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi 'dor ba'i tshul zhes bya ba niüîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar che'o bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi 'dor ba'i tshul zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar che'o bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIt is amazing how they take up the perfection of wisdom that accords with omniscience‚Äù indicates the perfection of wisdom that is taken up in order to attain omniscience.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThey will be protected, guarded, and hidden by the gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, gandharvas, and so on‚Äù indicates the perfection of wisdom that is taken up in order to attain the qualities of a great being.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThey will not be overcome by any harm or opportunity for downfall‚Äù indicates the perfection of wisdom that is taken up in order to attain the qualities of a buddha.

translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThey will be protected, guarded, and hidden by the gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, gandharvas, and so on‚Äù indicates the perfection of wisdom that is taken up in order to attain the qualities of a great being.

original: gzhan dag la rgya cher 'chad pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang mi 'bral ba de dag ni bdud sdig can la sogs pa thams cad kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phan yon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la rgya cher 'chad pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang mi 'bral ba de dag ni bdud sdig can la sogs pa thams cad kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phan yon bstan pa yin no //
translated: And they are not separated from the thought of the knowledge of all modes, and they cannot be overcome by all the demons, etc.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar gang gis gang du glags rnyed par 'gyur ba de dag nyid med do //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar gang gis gang du glags rnyed par 'gyur ba de dag nyid med do //
translated: Because of the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects, etc.üîΩup to the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes.üîΩBecause of the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes, etc.üîΩup to the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang sems can thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir de rnams la mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang sems can thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir de rnams la mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, they cannot be harmed by humans, nonhumans, and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa mtha' yas pa mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa mtha' yas pa mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: On the eighth moment of the path of seeing, bodhisattvas perform infinite deeds of intention.

original: gzhan du na skad cig ma dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med par 'gog par ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na skad cig ma dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med par 'gog par ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, on the ninth moment, they would fall into cessation without regard for the realm of sentient beings.

original: de yang spyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i spyod pas rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir de rnams yang ba ma spangs pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang /
translated: What is the receptivity to the knowledge of the teaching on the path?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is that which does not increase or decrease,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nges pa nas ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nges pa nas ;
translated: from the determination of attachment, aversion, and delusion,

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin pa'i bar du nye bar byed de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin pa'i bar du nye bar byed de /
translated: up to the grasping of nirvana.

original: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it does not increase or decrease.

original: lam la chos shes pa ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas de dag gis lha rnams kyis byas pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / nang gi bar chad kyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas de dag gis lha rnams kyis byas pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / nang gi bar chad kyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du bsrung ba dang /
translated: The knowledge of the teaching on the path is that which the Buddhas of the ten directions, considering the obstacles created by gods, those formed from the elements, and internal obstacles, respectively,

original: bskyab pa dang / bskyang bar mdzad pa dang / 'di ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi dge ba'i chos rnams rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bskyab pa dang / bskyang bar mdzad pa dang / 'di ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi dge ba'i chos rnams rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: and to protect, and to nurture, and in this way, by way of non-apprehending, the wholesome dharmas beginning with the perfection of giving and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects will increase.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang srog gcod pa yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang srog gcod pa yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The forbearance of subsequent knowledge with regard to the path is taught as permission to do such things as beginning with ‚Äúwhere there is killing,‚Äù

original: bdag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur /üîΩgzhan yang de la 'jog pa dang / de nyid kyi legs pa brjod par 'gyur ba la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur / gzhan yang de la 'jog pa dang / de nyid kyi legs pa brjod par 'gyur ba la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúI will attain the knowledge of all aspects,‚ÄùüîΩand to establish others in that and to speak in praise of that.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni gang de pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni gang de pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subsequent knowledge with regard to the path is taught as permission to do such things as beginning with ‚Äúwhen they practice the six perfections,‚Äù

original: sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of generosity is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, shared in common with all sentient beings, by way of non-apprehension.

original: de'i mdor gtogs par gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i mdor gtogs par gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The verse included in that sutra is this:

original: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag //
translated: Suchness and the buddhas

original: phan tshun rten pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun rten pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: are not mutually dependent.üîΩThe acceptance of synonyms,üîΩthe greatness, the immeasurability,üîΩthe non-apprehension of the end,

original: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad med nyid bcas dang // dpag med mtha' nyid med pa dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad med nyid bcas dang // dpag med mtha' nyid med pa dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //

original: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams la sogs pa stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid @71b ni thob pa dang // rnam par byang kun yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams la sogs pa stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid @71b ni thob pa dang // rnam par byang kun yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
translated: And the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩThe pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,

original: mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs la sogs //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs la sogs //
translated: And the teachings of the buddhas and so on.

original: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
translated: In the way of the knowledge of all aspects,üîΩOne should establish sentient beings

original: bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
translated: In generosity and so on,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bsngo ba //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bsngo ba //
translated: And dedicate to perfect enlightenment.

original: lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: The moment of the knowledge of the path

original: zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: lam shes pa nyid la mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /

original: // / mthong ba'i lam bshad nas /
analyzed: // / mthong ba'i lam bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the path of seeing,

original: da ni bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the path of meditation will be discussed.

original: de la re zhig 'di'i byed pa brjod par bya ba yin la phyis ni de ston par 'gyur ro //

translated: What are the six?üîΩCompletely disciplined, victorious over demons and afflictions,üîΩunshakable by harm,
