original: rnam pa thams cad du 'dud pa'i byed pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad kyang rtogs pas ngar 'dzin pa med par thams cad la 'dud pa'i don gyis na yongs su 'dud pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'dud pa'i byed pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad kyang rtogs pas ngar 'dzin pa med par thams cad la 'dud pa'i don gyis na yongs su 'dud pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no
translated: The function of complete obeisance is that, since one realizes all aspects, one is without grasping at ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and one completely bows to all.

original: // nyon mongs pa las nges par rgyal ba'i byed pa ni gang g-yul gyi nang du zhugs pa'i skyes bu'i dpes 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs ma lus pa las rgyal zhing brdzi ba med pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bar las nges par rgyal ba'i
analyzed: // nyon mongs pa las nges par rgyal ba'i byed pa ni gang g-yul gyi nang du zhugs pa'i skyes bu'i dpes 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs ma lus pa las rgyal zhing brdzi ba med pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bar las nges par rgyal ba'i
translated: The function of victory over the afflictions is that, through the example of a person who has entered into battle, one is victorious over the entire host of attachment and so forth, and one is not overcome by them.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yang nas yang du bya ba nyid du shes par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yang nas yang du bya ba nyid du shes par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one should understand that the path of meditation is to be done again and again.

original: yul gyi gnod pas zil gyis mi non pa'i byed pa ni gang de la la zhig gis me mdag gis gtor tam /
analyzed: yul gyi gnod pas zil gyis mi non pa'i byed pa ni gang de la la zhig gis me mdag gis gtor tam /
translated: The function of not being overcome by harm from objects is that, if someone were to throw burning coals at one,

original: byad byas sam /
analyzed: byad byas sam /
translated: or if one were to be cut with a knife,üîΩor if one were to be beaten with a stick,üîΩor if one were to be harmed with a weapon,

original: mtshon dang / chu dang / dug la sogs pa'i gnod pas de la gnod @72a * //
analyzed: mtshon dang / chu dang / dug la sogs pa'i gnod pas de la gnod @72a * //
translated: He is not harmed by weapons, water, poison, and so on.

original: par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: byang ni byang phyogs kyi mi ma yin pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: byang ni byang phyogs kyi mi ma yin pa'i rigs so //
translated: The north is the class of non-human beings in the north.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi byed pa ni gang chos thams cad mi dmigs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing sems can thams cad kyi sems la rnam par blta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstanüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi byed pa ni gang chos thams cad mi dmigs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing sems can thams cad kyi sems la rnam par blta bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The function of perfect complete enlightenment is that, by not apprehending any phenomena, one attains unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment and sees the minds of all sentient beings. This is what is taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten gyi yul mchod pa nyid kyi byed pa ni gang yang snying po byang chub kyi dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i rnal 'byor gyi rten gyi yul bar chad med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten gyi yul mchod pa nyid kyi byed pa ni gang yang snying po byang chub kyi dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i rnal 'byor gyi rten gyi yul bar chad med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The function of the object of worship, which is the basis of the perfection of wisdom, is that, by the example of the essence of enlightenment, the uninterrupted object of the yoga of the perfection of wisdom is [attained].

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i rigs thams cad kyis srung ba dang / skyob pa la sogs pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rigs thams cad kyis srung ba dang / skyob pa la sogs pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that all the divine clans protect, guard, etc.

original: byed pa bshad nas yang bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byed pa bshad nas yang bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Having explained the functions, the path of cultivation is twofold:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: with-outflows and without-outflows.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni mos pa dang / bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni mos pa dang / bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, that with-outflows is called the function of aspiration, dedication, and rejoicing.

original: zag pa med pa yang mngon bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang mngon bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That without-outflows is characterized by accomplishment and complete purification.üîΩBecause of aspiration, attention is made.

original: gang gi phyir mos pa yid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩmos pa rang gi don dang ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mos pa yid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
translated: In terms of that, it is taught:üîΩAspiration should be known as threefold:

original: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam pa gsum du shes par bya //
analyzed: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam pa gsum du shes par bya //
translated: for one's own benefit, for the benefit of both, and for the benefit of others.

original: zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because of that, it is taught:

original: gang zhig gis rang gi don du mos pa'i rang gi don nyid rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang zhig gis rang gi don du mos pa'i rang gi don nyid rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: For one who aspires for one's own benefit, one's own benefit will be fulfilled.

original: bsngo ba'i tshul gyis ni gzhan gyi don du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsngo ba'i tshul gyis ni gzhan gyi don du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And by the method of dedication, it becomes for the benefit of others.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don du bya ba gang yin pas ni gnyi ga'i don rdzogs par byed do //üîΩgang zhig gang gis gzhan gyi don du bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du 'gyur mod kyi rang gi don yang dag par rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don du bya ba gang yin pas ni gnyi ga'i don rdzogs par byed do // gang zhig gang gis gzhan gyi don du bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du 'gyur mod kyi rang gi don yang dag par rdzogs par byed de /
translated: And that which is done for the benefit of both oneself and others fulfills the aims of both.

original: 'di la rang gi don dgag pa med ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di la rang gi don dgag pa med ba'i phyir te /
translated: And that which is done for the benefit of others by whatever means fulfills the aims of oneself, because there is no obstruction to ones own aim in this.

original: gzhan gyi don dang mi 'gal ba nyid kyis de rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang mi 'gal ba nyid kyis de rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: It fulfills the aims of others because it is not in conflict with the aims of others.

original: de dag re re yang /
analyzed: de dag re re yang /
translated: Each of these aims is threefold:

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
translated: small, middling, great

original: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod //üîΩces bstan te /
analyzed: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod // ces bstan te /
translated: each is considered threefold.

original: rang gi don gyi mos pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi mos pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste /
translated: The interest of ones own aim is small, middling, and great.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: de la @72b rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po ni gang yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don la mos pa'i bar gang yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la @72b rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po ni gang yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don la mos pa'i bar gang yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the small, medium, and great interest in one‚Äôs own aim? What is the small, medium, and great interest in the aims of others?

original: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: It is divided into small of the small, etc.

original: de yang rnam gsum de ltar na //üîΩrnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
analyzed: de yang rnam gsum de ltar na // rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
translated: It is threefold, and thus

original: ces bstan te /
analyzed: ces bstan te /
translated: is asserted to be of twenty-seven kinds.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yin bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yin bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúeach‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: rang gi don la sogs pa la mos pa chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi don la sogs pa la mos pa chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The small, medium, and great interest in one‚Äôs own aim, etc., should be understood as threefold.

original: de ltar rang gi don la mos pa 'di ni rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don la mos pa 'di ni rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: This interest in one‚Äôs own aim is ninefold.

original: 'di ltar chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang ; chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang ; chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: Thus, there is the small of the small, the small of the medium, the small of the great, the medium of the small, the medium of the medium, the medium of the great, the great of the small, the great of the medium, and the great of the great.

original: de bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa dang / gzhan gyi don la mos pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa dang / gzhan gyi don la mos pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should mention the aspects of aspiration for one's own and others' aims, and aspiration for others' aims.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: thus,

original: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod do zhes bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod do zhes bstan te /
translated: it is taught that there are twenty-seven types.

original: mos pa zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: mos pa zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma nyid yin no //
translated: Aspiration is the basic type.

original: de la rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis pa bcangs la mchod pa bgyis pa dang / sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug ste mchod par byas pa bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur
analyzed: de la rang gi don la mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du bgyis pa bcangs la mchod pa bgyis pa dang / sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug ste mchod par byas pa bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur
translated: But the perfection of wisdom is the cause of the knowledge of all modes,

original: pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la brten bar gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi skur gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de la brten bar gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi skur gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: and because it is the basis of that, it is the Buddha‚Äôs body.

original: mchod pa brnyes pas na /
analyzed: mchod pa brnyes pas na /
translated: It is worshipped,

original: dang po'i mchod pa'i las 'di nyid de bas bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po'i mchod pa'i las 'di nyid de bas bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: and therefore this first act of worship is the one that brings the greater increase in merit.

original: chung ngu'i 'bring ni koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring ni koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: The small of the medium is the one who, Kausika, thinks:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi de dag las gang sangs rgyas la mos pa mi byed pa dang / de bzhin du chos dang / dag 'dun la shin tu brten pa de lta bu ni nyung ngu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi de dag las gang sangs rgyas la mos pa mi byed pa dang / de bzhin du chos dang / dag 'dun la shin tu brten pa de lta bu ni nyung ngu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and similarly, those who do not have faith in the Dharma, and those who do not have faith in the Sa·πÖgha, are said to be few, and so on.

original: tshig re re zhing phra ba rgya cher bstan pa nas /
analyzed: tshig re re zhing phra ba rgya cher bstan pa nas /
translated: This is taught extensively, with each word, in detail.

original: koo shi ka 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan sgrib pa med pas @73a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan sgrib pa med pas @73a * //
translated: Kau≈õika, with the unobstructed eye of the Buddha,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can tshad med grangs med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can tshad med grangs med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: I see countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the worlds of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, who have given rise to the mind set on perfect awakening.

original: byang chub tu spyod kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: byang chub tu spyod kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas /
translated: Although they practice for awakening, they are not endowed with the skillful means of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la gcig gam gnyis shig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gcig gam gnyis shig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, one or two will stand on the irreversible level.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: le lo can la sogs pas mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub par bsgrub pa ni dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: le lo can la sogs pas mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub par bsgrub pa ni dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is difficult for the lazy, etc. to accomplish complete enlightenment.

original: gang chung ngu'i chen po ni de bzhin du myur zhing bde bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang chung ngu'i chen po ni de bzhin du myur zhing bde bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The small of the great is taught from the beginning of the desire to quickly and easily fully awaken to unexcelled perfect enlightenment,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs kyang rung /
translated: whether the Tathagata is present

original: mya ngan las 'das kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das kyang rung ste /
translated: or has passed into Nirvana,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdag gi ston pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdag gi ston pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is my teacher.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang / mos pa gsum pa'i rnam pa yongs su gsal bar byas pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang / mos pa gsum pa'i rnam pa yongs su gsal bar byas pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Because it is the cause for attaining all the qualities of a Buddha, and because it clarifies the aspect of the third aspiration.

original: 'bring gi chung ngu ni de bzhin du gang rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten byas te /
analyzed: 'bring gi chung ngu ni de bzhin du gang rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten byas te /
translated: The small of the medium is taught from the beginning of making a stupa of the seven precious substances,

original: de la mchod pa'i bsod nams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mchod pa'i bsod nams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The merit of worshipping them is not as much as the merit that comes from worshipping the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'bring gi 'bring ni de bzhin du gang 'dzam bu'i gling rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i dpes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring gi 'bring ni de bzhin du gang 'dzam bu'i gling rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i dpes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium of the medium is taught by the example of the whole world of Jambudvipa made of the seven precious substances.

original: 'bring gi chen po ni de bzhin du gang gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i mchod rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //üîΩchen po'i chung ngu ni de bzhin du gang stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring gi chen po ni de bzhin du gang gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i mchod rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no // chen po'i chung ngu ni de bzhin du gang stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium of the great is taught by the example of this world system of four continents made of the seven precious substances.üîΩThe great of the small is taught by the example of a world system of a thousand.

original: chen po'i 'bring ni de bzhin du gang stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i 'bring ni de bzhin du gang stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the medium is taught by the example of a world system of a million.

original: chen po'i chen po ni de bzhin du gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po ni de bzhin du gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the great is taught as follows: ‚ÄúIt is like this, Subh≈´ti. If all the sentient beings in this great billionfold world-system were to become humans, and each of them were to build a st≈´pa made of the seven precious substances, and having built them were to honor them all with flowers, perfumes, and so on,

original: rang gi don la mos pa rnam pa dgu bstan nas /
analyzed: rang gi don la mos pa rnam pa dgu bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the nine aspects of devotion to one‚Äôs own aim,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa rnam pa dgu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa rnam pa dgu brjod par bya'o //
translated: he should state the nine aspects of devotion to one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô aims.

original: de la @73b re zhig chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag las sems can re res rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i mchod rten byas te /
analyzed: de la @73b re zhig chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag las sems can re res rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i mchod rten byas te /
translated: In this regard, the small of the small aspect is taught as follows: ‚ÄúIf all the sentient beings in this great billionfold world-system were to become humans, and each of them were to build a st≈´pa made of the seven precious substances,

original: mchod pa'i bsod nams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson pa bsod nams ches shin tu mang du bskyed pa nyid la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa'i bsod nams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson pa bsod nams ches shin tu mang du bskyed pa nyid la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: and having built them were to honor them all with flowers, perfumes, and so on, the merit from that worship would be far surpassed by the merit that comes from striving in this perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: chung ngu'i 'bring ni gang koo shi ka khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring ni gang koo shi ka khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The medium of the small is from ‚ÄúKau≈õika, you should take up the perfection of wisdom‚Äù up to ‚ÄúKau≈õika, the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the bodhisattvas.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium of the small is the extensive teaching on the benefits of seeing the Dharma and so on, beginning from ‚ÄúKau≈õika, you should take up the perfection of wisdom.

original: chung ngu'i chen po ni gang kun dga' bo 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po ni gang kun dga' bo 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: The great of the small is beginning from ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, what do you think?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin ba sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam /üîΩzhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin ba sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam / zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Is generosity the perfection of generosity that is not dedicated to omniscience?

original: chos thams cad de rnams kyi stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad de rnams kyi stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And ending with ‚ÄúBecause all phenomena are empty of those,

original: gnyis su med pa nyid yin pas gnyis su med par yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi sngon du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'gro ba nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid yin pas gnyis su med par yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi sngon du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'gro ba nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni
translated: they are nondual, and because of the method of dedication without duality, the perfection of wisdom goes before all the perfections.üîΩThe small of the medium is the extensive teaching on the benefits of the Dharma of realization, beginning from ‚ÄúKau≈õika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa as recipients of the ten virtues‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad rab tu shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa rnam pa gsum yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩ'bring gi chung ngu ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang rab tu ldan pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams las tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po tshad med pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad rab tu shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa rnam pa gsum yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro // zhes bstan pa yin no // 'bring gi chung ngu ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang rab tu ldan pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams las tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po tshad med pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Because it is the cause for knowing all the aspects of purification, and because it fully illuminates the three kinds of interest in one's own and others' aims.üîΩThe medium small is taught as the possession of the aggregates of morality, etc., which are immeasurable, in the aggregates of morality, etc., of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, in the possession of the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: 'bring gi 'bring ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa de la ni lha'i bu dag spobs pa nye bar bsgrub par sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring gi 'bring ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa de la ni lha'i bu dag spobs pa nye bar bsgrub par sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium medium is taught as the establishment of eloquence in the teaching of the Dharma endowed with the perfection of wisdom, etc., by the sons of the gods, etc.

original: 'bring gi chen po ni gang yang pha dang ma la sogs pa nas mi slob pa'i bar thams cad kyis kyang dben zhing yid du 'ong bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: 'bring gi chen po ni gang yang pha dang ma la sogs pa nas mi slob pa'i bar thams cad kyis kyang dben zhing yid du 'ong bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no /
translated: The medium-great is taught to be that which is isolated from all, from one's father and mother up to the nonlearner, and to be that which is pleasing.

original: chen po'i chung ngu ni gang stobs pa mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngu ni gang stobs pa mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The small of the great is taught to be that which is not robbed of strength, and so on,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems @74a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems @74a * //
translated: up to the nonlearner's mind of omniscienceüîΩis not robbed.

original: mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba dang ma bral bar byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa bdun pa'i skabs su bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba dngos po med par shes par bya ba'i don gyis yin no zhes bstan no //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba dang ma bral bar byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa bdun pa'i skabs su bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba dngos po med par shes par bya ba'i don gyis yin no zhes bstan no //
translated: The nonlearner's path of meditation is not robbed by the seven aspects, by the meaning of the knowledge of the nonexistence of things.

original: chen bo'i 'bring ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha'i ris thams cad kyang der dong zhing glegs bam du chud pa 'di klog pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'chang ba dang / kun chub par bya ba la sogs ba dang / de dag la chos kyi sbyin pa 'di byin par gyur cig ces sems bskyed par bya ste /üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen bo'i 'bring ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha'i ris thams cad kyang der dong zhing glegs bam du chud pa 'di klog pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'chang ba dang / kun chub par bya ba la sogs ba dang / de dag la chos kyi sbyin pa 'di byin par gyur cig ces sems bskyed par bya ste / zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMay I go to all the divine realms in the worlds of the ten directions.‚Äù

original: chen po'i chen po ni gang lha'i tshogs 'ongs pas mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan par gyur ba dang / lus dang / sems las su rung ba thob nas chos gos la sogs ba la shas cher chags pa bkag pa dang / mos pa rnam pa dgu'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po ni gang lha'i tshogs 'ongs pas mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan par gyur ba dang / lus dang / sems las su rung ba thob nas chos gos la sogs ba la shas cher chags pa bkag pa dang / mos pa rnam pa dgu'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the great is taught for the sake of clarifying the meaning of the nine kinds of aspiration, for those who have come to the divine assemblies, who have become endowed with great aspiration, who have attained fitness of body and mind, and who have been restrained from excessive attachment to Dharma robes and so on.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa rnam pa dgu bstan nas gzhan gyi don la mos ba rnam pa dgu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa rnam pa dgu bstan nas gzhan gyi don la mos ba rnam pa dgu brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having taught the nine aspects of interest in one's own and others' aims, he will now discuss the nine aspects of interest in others' aims.

original: de la re zhig chung ngu'i chung ngu ni gang yang glegs bam du bris ba 'di gzung ba dang / mchod pa 'ba' zhig tsam byed kyi ma bzung ba nas gzhan dag la rgya cher mi ston na ma tshang ba'i byed pas /
analyzed: de la re zhig chung ngu'i chung ngu ni gang yang glegs bam du bris ba 'di gzung ba dang / mchod pa 'ba' zhig tsam byed kyi ma bzung ba nas gzhan dag la rgya cher mi ston na ma tshang ba'i byed pas /
translated: In this regard, the smallest of the small is when someone merely upholds this scripture and worships it, but does not explain it extensively to others, because of not having studied it.üîΩThe one who makes the action complete generates much more merit.üîΩThe small of the medium is when someone, having studied it, does not explain it to others, but meditates on it.

original: las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni bsod nams ches mang du skyed par bstan pa yin no //üîΩchung ngu'i 'bring ni gang yang koo shi ka khyod kyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bkang ba zhig kyang rnyed ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni bsod nams ches mang du skyed par bstan pa yin no // chung ngu'i 'bring ni gang yang koo shi ka khyod kyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bkang ba zhig kyang rnyed ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The medium of the small is when someone, having studied it, explains it to others, but does not do so with the intention of making a living.üîΩThe medium of the medium is when someone, having studied it, explains it to others, but does not do so with the intention of making a living, and does not do so with the intention of attaining the higher worlds.üîΩThe medium of the great is when someone, having studied it, explains it to others, but does not do so with the intention of making a living, nor with the intention of attaining the higher worlds, but does not do so with the intention of attaining the Disciple or Solitary Realizer's awakening.

original: cha gnyis las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa blang bar bgyi ba nyid la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: cha gnyis las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa blang bar bgyi ba nyid la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the small is when someone, having studied it, explains it to others, but does not do so with the intention of making a living, nor with the intention of attaining the higher worlds, nor with the intention of attaining the Disciple or Solitary Realizer's awakening, but does not do so with the intention of attaining the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe small of the great is when someone, having studied it, explains it to others, but does not do so with the intention of making a living, nor with the intention of attaining the higher worlds, nor with the intention of attaining the Disciple or Solitary Realizer's awakening, nor with the intention of attaining the knowledge of all aspects, but does not do so with the intention of attaining the knowledge of paths.üîΩThe medium of the great is when someone, having studied it, explains it to others, but does not do so with the intention of making a living, nor with the intention of attaining the higher worlds, nor with the intention of attaining the Disciple or Solitary Realizer's awakening, nor with the intention of attaining the knowledge of all aspects, nor with the intention of attaining the knowledge of paths, but does not do so

original: chung ngu'i chen po ni gang sbyor ba 'di dang ldan pa de ni nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa'i dogs pa med pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi donüîΩla mos pa rnam pa gsum gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po ni gang sbyor ba 'di dang ldan pa de ni nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa'i dogs pa med pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don la mos pa rnam pa gsum gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the small is taught for the sake of the three kinds of interest in the benefit for others, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.üîΩThe small of the medium is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for others, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.üîΩThe great of the medium is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for others, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.üîΩThe small of the great is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for others, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: 'bring gi chung ngu ni gang yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di de bzhin gshegs ba'i sku gdung gis byur bur gtams @74b pa zhig dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig 'dom du stsal na /
analyzed: 'bring gi chung ngu ni gang yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di de bzhin gshegs ba'i sku gdung gis byur bur gtams @74b pa zhig dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig 'dom du stsal na /
translated: The medium of the great is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for others, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: 'di nyid mchog yin pa nyid la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid mchog yin pa nyid la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the great is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for others, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.üîΩThe small of the small is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for oneself, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.üîΩThe medium of the small is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for oneself, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.üîΩThe great of the small is taught in order to clarify the three kinds of interest in the benefit for oneself, from the time when one possesses this application until one is fully enlightened, because there is no danger of falling to the levels of the

original: 'bring gi 'bring ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams mdo la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ston par mdzad pa dang / chos smra ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ni 'di las byung ba yin pa'i phyir de gnyis kyang mi 'dra ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring gi 'bring ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams mdo la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ston par mdzad pa dang / chos smra ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ni 'di las byung ba yin pa'i phyir de gnyis kyang mi 'dra ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium of the medium is taught by the example of the ten directions' world systems' buddhas teaching the dharma of the twelve branches of excellent speech such as the sutras, and the dharma teachers teaching the perfection of wisdom, because they arise from this perfection of wisdom.

original: 'bring gi chen po ni gang mthu dang rab tu ldan pa'i rgyal po la brten pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba'i dpes gang gis kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / mchod pa la rnyed pa la sogs bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring gi chen po ni gang mthu dang rab tu ldan pa'i rgyal po la brten pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba'i dpes gang gis kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / mchod pa la rnyed pa la sogs bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great of the medium is taught by the example of a person who is supported by a very powerful king and is not afraid of anyone, and by the example of worship with gain and so on.

original: chen po'i chung ngu ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur gtams pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa cha gnyis su byas te /
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngu ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur gtams pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa cha gnyis su byas te /
translated: The small of the great is that it is taught that if one were to take the relics of the Tathagata that fill worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river in the ten directions and divide the perfection of wisdom into two parts,

original: gcig 'dom du bcug na 'di nyid len pa mchog yin pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig 'dom du bcug na 'di nyid len pa mchog yin pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: and if one were to take one part of the perfection of wisdom, that would be the best.

original: chen po'i 'bring ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi thugs su chud pa'i rgyu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i 'bring ni gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi thugs su chud pa'i rgyu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium of the great is that it is taught that the cause for the realization of all the noble beings in the worlds of the ten directions is the perfection of wisdom.

original: theg pa chen po ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The great vehicle is that it is taught that this great perfection of wisdom is the great vehicle, beginning with the words:üîΩThis perfection of wisdom is the great vehicle of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: shing rnams lo ma dang / me tog dang ; 'bras bu dang / dbyibs sna tshogs kyang grib ma la khyad par dang / bye brag mi dmigs pa'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mi dmigs shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro gcig pa nyid dang /
analyzed: shing rnams lo ma dang / me tog dang ; 'bras bu dang / dbyibs sna tshogs kyang grib ma la khyad par dang / bye brag mi dmigs pa'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mi dmigs shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro gcig pa nyid dang /
translated: The example of the trees, with their various leaves, flowers, fruits, and shapes, but with no difference or distinction in their shade, illustrates the nonapprehension of all the perfections and their identity in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa rnam pa dgu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa rnam pa dgu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The nine kinds of interest in the welfare of others are clarified by this teaching.

original: mos ba'i rnam pa thams cad la yang chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa nas dpe gzhan dang / gzhan gyis chos gang dang gang bstan pa de'i rjes su 'brangs nas chen po'i chen po la sogs pa las go ba zlog pas mi mthun ba'i phyogs shes par bya'o //üîΩde la rang @75a * //
analyzed: mos ba'i rnam pa thams cad la yang chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa nas dpe gzhan dang / gzhan gyis chos gang dang gang bstan pa de'i rjes su 'brangs nas chen po'i chen po la sogs pa las go ba zlog pas mi mthun ba'i phyogs shes par bya'o // de la rang @75a * //
translated: And in all the kinds of interest, from the lesser-lesser to the greater-greater, one should understand the counteragents by the reverse order, following the teachings of each of the other examples.

original: gi don la mos pa ni gzhan gyi don la mos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gi don la mos pa ni gzhan gyi don la mos par 'gyur la /
translated: Therein, interest in one's own welfare becomes interest in the welfare of others.

original: gnyis pa ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The second is the practice with obstacles.

original: gsum pa la ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: In the third, it is the preparation for the uninterrupted path.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa bshad nas da ni bstod pa la sogs pa brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa bshad nas da ni bstod pa la sogs pa brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the mental attention of devotion, now, in order to explain the praise, etc., it is said:üîΩIn the stages of devotion

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //üîΩmos ba'i gnas skabs rnams la ni //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la // mos ba'i gnas skabs rnams la ni //
translated: to the perfection of wisdom,üîΩone should praise, honor, and extol

original: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod //
analyzed: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod //
translated: with three sets of nine.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: de la dang po 'di ni bstod pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de la dang po 'di ni bstod pa tsam yin te /
translated: Among them, the first is just praise,

original: gang yang sngar bstan pa las /
analyzed: gang yang sngar bstan pa las /
translated: as it was taught above.

original: la la zhig bris te /
analyzed: la la zhig bris te /
translated: Someone writes it down,

original: glegs bam du bgyis nas gzhan la gsal ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: glegs bam du bgyis nas gzhan la gsal ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: makes it into a book, and clarifies it for others,

original: sbyin pa'i bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that the merit of generosity increases greatly.

original: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi drung du song ste bshad cing bstan na snga ma dag pas bsod nams shas cher 'phel te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi drung du song ste bshad cing bstan na snga ma dag pas bsod nams shas cher 'phel te /
translated: The second, having gone in front of others and explained and taught, the merit increases greatly more than the former.

original: de ni bstod pa yin par bsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bstod pa yin par bsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is considered praise, etc., and is taught.

original: gsum pa ni gang sems can gcig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa dang / 'dzam bu gling gi sems can de dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod par gyur pa ni bsod nams mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang sems can gcig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa dang / 'dzam bu gling gi sems can de dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod par gyur pa ni bsod nams mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The third is that one should establish a single sentient being in the result of stream-enterer, and that one should establish the sentient beings of the Rose Apple Land in the ten paths of virtuous action.üîΩIt is taught that one‚Äôs merit increases more and more,

original: de nyid gzhan la byin na bsod nams mang du 'phel bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan la byin na bsod nams mang du 'phel bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: and that if one gives that very thing to others, one‚Äôs merit increases more and more.

original: bzhi pa ni gang sems can gcig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gang sems can gcig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is that one should establish a single sentient being in the result of once-returner.

original: lnga pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa ni de bzhin du sems can gcig lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fifth is that one should establish a single sentient being in the result of non-returner.

original: drug pa ni gang de bzhin du sems can gcig cig dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni gang de bzhin du sems can gcig cig dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sixth is that one should establish a single sentient being in the state of an arhat.

original: bdun pa ni gang de bzhin du sems can gcig cig rang byang chub la bzhag na zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa ni gang de bzhin du sems can gcig cig rang byang chub la bzhag na zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The seventh is that one should establish a single sentient being in the state of a pratyekabuddha.

original: brgyad pa ni gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The eighth is that if one were to establish a single sentient being in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, that would be an increase in merit that is much greater than if one were to establish all sentient beings in the world system of four continents in the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du bzhugs pa @75b yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don du bzhugs pa @75b yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it is for the sake of the continuity of the way of the Buddhas.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
translated: Therein, the way of the Buddhas is the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: bkur ba yang cha dgur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bkur ba yang cha dgur shes par bya'o //

original: de la bkur ba dang po ni 'di yin te /
