translated: The twenty-ninth is that the merit increases greatly by teaching the meaning and the words without error.

original: mang du 'phel ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mang du 'phel ba nyid yin no //
translated: The thirtieth is that the merit increases greatly by teaching the meaning and the words without error.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di las nges par 'khrungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di las nges par 'khrungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the Buddhas are definitely born from this.

original: brgyad pa ni gang yang bskal pa tshad med grangs med par sbyin ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa' bcos ma las go bzlog pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pas phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa
analyzed: brgyad pa ni gang yang bskal pa tshad med grangs med par sbyin ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa' bcos ma las go bzlog pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pas phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa
translated: The eighth is that, for immeasurable, countless eons, the bodhisattva practices generosity and so forth, and through the perfection of wisdom, he is free from the error of apprehending them, in the opposite way to the counterfeit bodhisattva.

original: ni bsod nams mang du skyes @76a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ni bsod nams mang du skyes @76a * // par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that he will generate much merit.

original: bkur ba'i cha dgu pa ni gang yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bkur ba'i cha dgu pa ni gang yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The ninth aspect of respect is that, beginning with the sentient beings of Jambudvipa,

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dzin
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dzin
translated: It is better to establish a single sentient being in the result of stream enterer than to establish the sentient beings of all the world systems of the ten directions as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the result of stream enterer.üîΩüîΩIt is better to establish a single sentient being in the result of once returner than to establish all the sentient beings of all the world systems of the ten directions as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the result of stream enterer.üîΩ

original: du bcug cing phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bzhag pa ni bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: du bcug cing phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bzhag pa ni bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the merit of causing a single sentient being to enter into and be established in the stage of irreversibility for unexcelled, perfect enlightenment is greater than the merit of establishing as many sentient beings as there are in the world systems of the ten directions, as many as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river, in the result of stream entry.

original: bkur ba'i cha rnam pa dgu bstan nas /
analyzed: bkur ba'i cha rnam pa dgu bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the nine aspects of respect,

original: da ni bsngags pa'i cha rnam pa dgu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bsngags pa'i cha rnam pa dgu brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the nine aspects of praise should be stated.

original: de la bsngags pa'i cha dang po ni 'dir gang de bzhin du sems can ji snyed cig kho na dgra bcom pa nyid du zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bsngags pa'i cha dang po ni 'dir gang de bzhin du sems can ji snyed cig kho na dgra bcom pa nyid du zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The first aspect of praise is taught here as ‚Äúhowever many sentient beings are established in the state of an arhat.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa ni gang yang de ltar sems can de snyed cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang yang de ltar sems can de snyed cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is ‚Äúhowever many sentient beings are established in the result of non-returner.‚Äù

original: gsum ba ni gang de bzhin du de ltar re zhig sems can de snyed cig dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa bas zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum ba ni gang de bzhin du de ltar re zhig sems can de snyed cig dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa bas zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The third is taught by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúSuppose someone were to establish as many sentient beings as there are in a great trichiliocosm in the state of an arhat.

original: bzhi pa ni gang de bzhin du sems can de snyed kho na rang byang chub la bkod na zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gang de bzhin du sems can de snyed kho na rang byang chub la bkod na zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is taught by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúSuppose someone were to establish as many sentient beings as there are in a great trichiliocosm in the state of a pratyekabuddha.

original: lnga pa ni gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba byas pa bas sems can gcig cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la bkod pa'i bsod nams ches cher mang du 'phel ba nyidüîΩdu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba byas pa bas sems can gcig cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la bkod pa'i bsod nams ches cher mang du 'phel ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fifth is taught by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúCompared to someone who inspires all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, someone who establishes a single sentient being in the state of a non-returner would generate incalculably more merit.

original: drug pa ni gang de bzhin du gling bzhi pa'i sems can de nyid du bkod pa bas zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni gang de bzhin du gling bzhi pa'i sems can de nyid du bkod pa bas zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sixth is taught by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúCompared to someone who establishes all the sentient beings of a four-continent world system in the state of a non-returner, someone who inspires a single sentient being to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening would generate incalculably more merit.

original: bdun pa ni gang de bzhin du stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de nyid du bkod pa pas zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa ni gang de bzhin du stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de nyid du bkod pa pas zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The seventh is taught by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúCompared to someone who establishes all the sentient beings of a billion-world universe in the state of a non-returner, someone who inspires a single sentient being to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening would generate incalculably more merit.

original: brgyad pa ni gang de bzhin du stong gnyis pa dang / gsum ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams de nyid du yang dag par bkod pa na zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni gang de bzhin du stong gnyis pa dang / gsum ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams de nyid du yang dag par bkod pa na zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The eighth is when he perfectly establishes sentient beings in the two thousandfold world systems, in the three thousandfold world systems, and in the world systems of the ten directions.

original: bsngags pa'i cha dgu pa ni gang yang 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bsngags pa'i cha dgu pa ni gang yang 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te /
translated: The ninth aspect of praise is when he begins with the Rose Apple LandüîΩand establishes all the sentient beings of each of the ten directions‚Äô world systems, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the stage of nonregression.

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can @76b thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod nas phyir mi ldog pa de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gang yang rung
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can @76b thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod nas phyir mi ldog pa de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gang yang rung
translated: Then, from among those nonregressing bodhisattva great beings, he knows that any one of them

original: ba zhig myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs bar 'tshang rgya bar mngon bar shes nas /
analyzed: ba zhig myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs bar 'tshang rgya bar mngon bar shes nas /
translated: will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The merit of teaching the perfection of wisdom without error increases much more.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la spro ba skyed pa rnams la legs so legs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pas bsngags pa'i tshig gis don yongs su gsal bar byas ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la spro ba skyed pa rnams la legs so legs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pas bsngags pa'i tshig gis don yongs su gsal bar byas ba yin no //
translated: He praises them with the words Excellent, excellent! to encourage the bodhisattvas, and by this praise he clarifies the meaning.

original: de la bstod pa ni rang gi don la mos pa'i yul la yin no //
analyzed: de la bstod pa ni rang gi don la mos pa'i yul la yin no //
translated: Here, praise is for those who aspire to their own goal.

original: bkur ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa yin no //
analyzed: bkur ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa yin no //
translated: Respect is for those who aspire to their own and others' goals.

original: bsngags pa ni gzhan gyi don du mos pa la yin no //
analyzed: bsngags pa ni gzhan gyi don du mos pa la yin no //
translated: Praise is for those who aspire to others' goals.

original: de ltar bstod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni tshig gi don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid yin gyi rig byed smra ba rnams kyi don smra ba'i bstod pa ltar don dang 'gal ba'i gcam gsag tu smra ba ni ma
analyzed: de ltar bstod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni tshig gi don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid yin gyi rig byed smra ba rnams kyi don smra ba'i bstod pa ltar don dang 'gal ba'i gcam gsag tu smra ba ni ma
translated: Thus these praises and so on are characterized by the correct understanding of the meaning of the words, but they are not like the praises of the meaning-mongers of the Vedic hymns, which are mere flattery contradicting the meaning.

original: yin no // gang yang tshad phyed dang bzhi aam ni bkur ba nyid de zhes smras te /
analyzed: yin no // gang yang tshad phyed dang bzhi aam ni bkur ba nyid de zhes smras te /
translated: Yes, it is.üîΩSome say that the half-mora a is the best, because it is the most esteemed.

original: de rnams kyi ni sgra'i tshangs pa ni mchog yin par bkur ba'o zhes kha cig zer mod kyi 'dir ni yang ji skad bshad pa rtogs pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ni sgra'i tshangs pa ni mchog yin par bkur ba'o zhes kha cig zer mod kyi 'dir ni yang ji skad bshad pa rtogs pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: But here, as we have explained, the definition of a mora is the time required to comprehend a syllable.

original: gang yang bsngags pa'i dbang du byas nas sreg rdzas kyi bsngags pa bdag gis shes so zhes smras la /
analyzed: gang yang bsngags pa'i dbang du byas nas sreg rdzas kyi bsngags pa bdag gis shes so zhes smras la /
translated: Some say that the praise of the sacrificial substances is understood from the praise of the sacrificer.

original: lan dang ldan pa'i tshig phyi nas brjod nas de ni 'di dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa yin no zhes smra mod kyi de yang sgrar gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lan dang ldan pa'i tshig phyi nas brjod nas de ni 'di dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa yin no zhes smra mod kyi de yang sgrar gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: But the praise of the sacrificer is stated later in the sentence, so the praise of the sacrificial substances is not understood from the praise of the sacrificer.

original: 'dir ni yang cha dgu pa'i rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni yang cha dgu pa'i rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsngags pa yin no //
translated: Here, the definition of a mora is the time required to comprehend nine syllables.

original: tshang dang / cha dang / char bgo ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshang dang / cha dang / char bgo ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmora‚Äù is ‚Äúpart‚Äù and ‚Äúdivision into parts.‚Äù

original: de ltar byas na mdo gzhan de dang de'i gleng gzhi las /
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo gzhan de dang de'i gleng gzhi las /
translated: Thus, in the context of the statements in various s≈´tras,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bkur la bsngags pa dang lhan cig bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa de 'thad par gyur pa nyid yin no //üîΩmos pa yin la byed pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bkur la bsngags pa dang lhan cig bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa de 'thad par gyur pa nyid yin no // mos pa yin la byed pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: Then the Bhagavat, together with all the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas and all the Buddhas, was seated.

original: // / mos pa @77a * //
analyzed: // / mos pa @77a * //
translated: This is the explanation of the activity of devotion.

original: yid la byed pa dang / bstod pa dang / bkur ba dang / bsngags pa bshad zin nas da ni yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba brjod par byad ba yin pas na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang / bstod pa dang / bkur ba dang / bsngags pa bshad zin nas da ni yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba brjod par byad ba yin pas na /
translated: The mental attention of devotion, praise, honor, and acclaim have been explained. Now, in order to explain the mental attention called ‚Äúdedication,‚Äù

original: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
translated: The special dedication

original: de yi byed pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de yi byed pa nyid dang ni //
translated: Its activity

original: de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
analyzed: de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
translated: It has the aspect of non-apprehension

original: phyin ci log gi med nyid dang // dben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi med nyid dang // dben dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
translated: Non-existence of error, isolation, and the accumulation of merit of the Buddhas

original: rang bzhin dran pa'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: rang bzhin dran pa'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: The nature of mindfulness

original: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas kyis ni rjes gnang dang // khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang chen po dang ; / bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas kyis ni rjes gnang dang // khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang chen po dang ; / bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: small, middling, and great.

original: bsod nams ches 'byung bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams ches 'byung bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the best, because it produces the greatest amount of goodness.

original: zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la /
translated: This is taught in the following verses.

original: de la yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can ni 'di yin te /
translated: The special dedication is as follows:

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams las byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba 'di nyid rab ces bya'o
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams las byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba 'di nyid rab ces bya'o
translated: Compared to the merit of all the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas from their deeds of giving and so forth, the dedication of the great bodhisattvas to unsurpassed, complete, perfect enlightenment through the method of nonapprehending is the best,

original: // dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is the most excellent,

original: gtso bo zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is the foremost.

original: de la rab ces bya ba ni rab rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rab ces bya ba ni rab rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, best has two aspects:

original: dam par gyur pa'i rab nyid dang // brtson 'grus 'bar bas gtso bor gyur ba gnyis pa med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dam par gyur pa'i rab nyid dang // brtson 'grus 'bar bas gtso bor gyur ba gnyis pa med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The best of the holy ones, and the foremost of those with blazing effort, by being without a second.

original: de la dam bar gyur pa'i rab nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dam bar gyur pa'i rab nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The best of the holy ones is twofold:

original: mchog nyid ni thabs la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: mchog nyid ni thabs la mkhas pas so //
translated: The supreme one is by skill in means.

original: phul zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: phul zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: The foremost one is by the perfection of wisdom.

original: gtso bor gyur pa 'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa 'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The foremost one is twofold:

original: mnyam pa med pas gtso bo nyid yin pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pas gtso bo nyid yin pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: It is foremost by being without equal, and it is foremost by being equal to the unequalled.

original: tshig bdun gyis de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig bdun gyis de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the seven verses teach its distinguishing characteristics.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i byed pa ni gang yang sems can rnams kyi theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa'i rgyur gyur pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i byed pa ni gang yang sems can rnams kyi theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa'i rgyur gyur pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The activity of dedication is that which is the cause for teaching the path of emancipation of the three vehicles for all sentient beings, and so it is said to be without equal.

original: mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang / mnyam pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang / mnyam pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is unequalled because it is the cause for attaining the equality of the Buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos @77b la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos @77b la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the difference between the Disciples and so on and the Bodhisattvas is due to their respective aims of self and others.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsngo ba ni gang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsngo ba ni gang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The dedication of nonapprehending is as follows. Beginning with the first generation of the thought of enlightenment of all the Buddhas of the ten directions,

original: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / des yongs su bsdus pa dang / theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / des yongs su bsdus pa dang / theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: one rejoices in all the roots of virtue of the aggregates of morality and so on, and of the beings who are included in them and who are matured by the three vehicles and who are liberated.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i dngos po ni gang yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i dngos po ni gang yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: What is the entity of the dedication?üîΩWhat is the entity, the object, the enlightenment, the thought, the roots of virtue, the entity of the merit that is the object of rejoicing, and the dedication?

original: dngos po dang / dmigs pa dang / byang chub dang / sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni gang zhig yin zhes bya ba dang / sems de ni zad cing 'gags la med par gyur pa nyid nas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsngos pa legs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dmigs pa dang / byang chub dang / sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni gang zhig yin zhes bya ba dang / sems de ni zad cing 'gags la med par gyur pa nyid nas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsngos pa legs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: That thought is exhausted, ceased, and gone, and all phenomena are non-entities, following after the non-apprehension of forms, etc.

original: de la dngos po ni rigs so //
analyzed: de la dngos po ni rigs so //
translated: Therein, the entity is the lineage.

original: dmigs pa ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The object is all phenomena.

original: byang chub ni ched du bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni ched du bya ba'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the aim.

original: sems ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought is the conception of grasping.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni ma chags ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni ma chags ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The roots of virtue are non-attachment, etc.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni sems las byung ba'o //
translated: The entity of the merit that is the object of rejoicing is the mental factor.

original: de dag zad pa ni bstsags pa rnam par 'jig pas so //
analyzed: de dag zad pa ni bstsags pa rnam par 'jig pas so //
translated: Their exhaustion is through the destruction of their accumulation.

original: 'gags pa ni rgyun gyis 'jigs pas so //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni rgyun gyis 'jigs pas so //
translated: Their cessation is through the destruction of their continuity.

original: med pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pas so //
analyzed: med pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pas so //
translated: Their non-existence is through the destruction of their intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par gyur pa ni rnam par 'gyur pa'i 'jig pas so //
analyzed: rnam par gyur pa ni rnam par 'gyur pa'i 'jig pas so //
translated: Their transformation is through the destruction of their transformation.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsngo ba ni gang yang sems gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang de yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsngo ba ni gang yang sems gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang de yin no //
translated: The dedication with the characteristic of non-distortion is that by which the mind that is dedicated is also that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is taught that all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos bo mngon bar 'du bya ba de phung po la sogs pas dben par shes zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos bo mngon bar 'du bya ba de phung po la sogs pas dben par shes zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The dedication of seclusion is that by which the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, knowing that the basis of meritorious action to be dedicated is secluded from the aggregates, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de nyid kyi ngo bo @78a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de nyid kyi ngo bo @78a * //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects, dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: nyid kyis dben par shes te zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyis dben par shes te zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to ‚Äúknowing it to be empty of selfhood.‚ÄùüîΩThe dedication of the recollection of the nature of the roots of virtue of the buddhas is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the buddhas themselves, and the dedication of the nature of the roots of virtue of sentient beings is the dedication of the roots of virtue of sentient beings themselves.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rigs su gtogs pa'i rang bzhin dran pa'i yongs su bsngos pa ni yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dge pa'i rtsa pa'i rigs su gtogs pa gang yin pa dang ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang // de bzhin du bsod nams bya pa'i dngos po yongs su bsngo ba yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rigs su gtogs pa'i rang bzhin dran pa'i yongs su bsngos pa ni yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dge pa'i rtsa pa'i rigs su gtogs pa gang yin pa dang ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang // de bzhin du bsod nams bya pa'i dngos po yongs su bsngo ba yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The dedication of the object of merit is the dedication of the object of merit of the buddhas themselves, and the dedication of the object of merit of sentient beings is the dedication of the object of merit of sentient beings themselves.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chen pos thabs la mkhas pas de dag la bslab par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' chen pos thabs la mkhas pas de dag la bslab par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The dedication of skill in means is taught by ‚ÄúHere the great bodhisattva should train in those skills.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang kha zas dug dang bcas pa'i dpes mtshan ma'i 'du shes can gyi yongs su bsngo ba ni dug can zug rdu can te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang kha zas dug dang bcas pa'i dpes mtshan ma'i 'du shes can gyi yongs su bsngo ba ni dug can zug rdu can te /
translated: The dedication without signs is taught by the example of poisoned food. The dedication with signs is like poisoned food, and the dedication without signs is like unpoisoned food.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúI dedicate this root of merit to the complete purification of the Buddha-field.‚ÄùüîΩThe dedication approved by the Buddhas is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúJust as those Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened

original: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bla na med pa thugs su chud pa de bzhin du bdag gis bla
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gang ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bla na med pa thugs su chud pa de bzhin du bdag gis bla
translated: Ones have realized the unsurpassed Buddha-knowledge, in the same way I also dedicate this to complete, unsurpassed, and perfect

original: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: awakening.‚Äù

original: khams gsum du gtogs pa ma yin pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: khams gsum du gtogs pa ma yin pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: The dedication that does not belong to the three worlds is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, those roots of merit should be dedicated in the following way.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúNot belonging to the world of desire, the world of form, or the formless world.‚Äù

original: bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba yang chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas rnam ba gsum mo //
analyzed: bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'i yongs su bsngo ba yang chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas rnam ba gsum mo //
translated: The dedication of great merit is also threefold, according to its division into small, middling, and great.

original: de la chung ngu ni gang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam nas brtsams te /üîΩmngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya pa'i bar dang / 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas pa'i gnas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams can gyi dpes 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ba ni bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la chung ngu ni gang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam nas brtsams te / mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya pa'i bar dang / 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas pa'i gnas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams can gyi dpes 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ba ni bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The small is that which begins with the ten wholesome courses of action,üîΩup to the five superknowledges, and the worldly realizations. The example of the beings of the great trichiliocosm is taught in order to show that the dedication is of great merit.üîΩThe middling is that which begins with the same number of beings, but who have become stream-enterers up to arhats, and the merit of paying them respect, making offerings, and so forth. It is taught that this is of even greater merit.

original: 'bring ni gang yang de snyed cig kho na rgyun tu zhugs pa nas dgra bcom par gyur ba la bkur sti dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa'i @78b bsod nams kyi dpes 'di ni bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa
analyzed: 'bring ni gang yang de snyed cig kho na rgyun tu zhugs pa nas dgra bcom par gyur ba la bkur sti dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa'i @78b bsod nams kyi dpes 'di ni bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa
translated: The great is that which begins with the same number of beings, but who have become bodhisattvas abiding in the perfection of generosity, and the merit of paying them respect, making offerings, and so forth. It is taught that this is of even greater merit.

original: yin no // chen po ni gang sems can de snyed kho nar yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la gnas pa la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyis re re nas mchod pa'i bsod nams kyi dpes mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba'i
analyzed: yin no // chen po ni gang sems can de snyed kho nar yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la gnas pa la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyis re re nas mchod pa'i bsod nams kyi dpes mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba'i
translated: The great is that which is dedicated by the example of the merit of the worship of all sentient beings of the world systems of the ten directions, one by one, to the enlightenment of perfect complete Buddhahood of just those sentient beings.

original: bsod nams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The merit is as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag thams cad ni dmigs su med pa can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni dmigs su med pa can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because all of those are without objective supports.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the dedication.

original: // / yongs su bsngo pa yid la byed pa bshad zin nas /
analyzed: // / yongs su bsngo pa yid la byed pa bshad zin nas /
translated: The mental contemplation of dedication having been explained,

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩthabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis //üîΩdge ba'i rtsal yi rang ba //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas / thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis // dge ba'i rtsal yi rang ba //
translated: with regard to rejoicing,üîΩit is said:üîΩThe roots of virtue of all sentient beings

original: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
translated: are rejoiced in with method and nonapprehending.üîΩThe mental contemplation of rejoicing

original: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: is said to be the meditation here.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed par gyur par ston te ;
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed par gyur par ston te ;
translated: This shows the mental attention of rejoicing.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na rjes su yi rang ba'i dam par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na rjes su yi rang ba'i dam par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The Blessed One has taught: By how much does rejoicing become the best?

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa'i tshe //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa'i tshe //
translated: when one practices the perfection of wisdom by way of non-apprehension,

original: thabs la mkhas pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: one should dedicate those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by skillful means.

original: de la mos pa yid la byed pas ni 'byung khungs dag nas gser gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon bar 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la mos pa yid la byed pas ni 'byung khungs dag nas gser gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon bar 'du byed do //
translated: There, by the mental attention of aspiration, one accumulates merit like gold from its source.

original: yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pas ni mgar bas gser gyi rgyan bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pas ni mgar bas gser gyi rgyan bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu byed do //
translated: By the mental attention of dedication, one makes it a factor of perfect complete awakening like a gold ornament made by a goldsmith.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas ni rang gi gzhan gyis byas pa'i bsod nams dang mnyam pa nyid du thob bo //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas ni rang gi gzhan gyis byas pa'i bsod nams dang mnyam pa nyid du thob bo //
translated: By the mental attention of rejoicing, one obtains the same merit as if one had done it oneself.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the mental attention of rejoicing.

original: // / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa bstan nas /
analyzed: // / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the mental attention of rejoicing,

original: bsgrub pa brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: bsgrub pa brjod par bya ste //
translated: he should state the practice.üîΩThe essence is the highest,üîΩnot manifesting to all,

original: ngo bo nyid ni mchog nyid dang // kun la mngon du mi byed dang // chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni mchog nyid dang // kun la mngon du mi byed dang // chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
translated: and directing to the non-apprehension of phenomena,

original: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
analyzed: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //
translated: the great meaning.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, with regard to the essence,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snang @79a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snang @79a * //
translated: the Blessed One said, The perfection of wisdom illuminates...

original: bar bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bar bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: up to...

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ston pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ston pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: it shows the essence of all phenomena.

original: mchog nyid ni gang dmus long ngam lam du zhugs nas grong khyer chen por phyin par mi nus pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med par pha rol tu phyin pa lngas lam shes pa nyid du zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
analyzed: mchog nyid ni gang dmus long ngam lam du zhugs nas grong khyer chen por phyin par mi nus pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med par pha rol tu phyin pa lngas lam shes pa nyid du zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: The best is understood through the example of someone blind from birth or someone who has entered a road but is unable to reach a great city, which means that without the perfection of wisdom, the five perfections are unable to enter the knowledge of the path and omniscience.

original: kyi grong khyer chen por phyin pa'i nus pa bkag pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kyi grong khyer chen por phyin pa'i nus pa bkag pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The supreme is taught by the example of the blind person or the person who has entered the path but is unable to reach the great city, which is the negation of the ability to enter the knowledge of the path by means of the five perfections without the perfection of wisdom and to reach the great city of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos thams cad la mngon bar 'du mi byed pa ni gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon bar 'du mi byed pa ni gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The non-performance of all phenomena is taught, beginning with because of the non-establishment of form,

original: chos thams cad mngon bar 'du byed pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon bar bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon bar 'du byed pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon bar bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to the perfection of wisdom should be performed by the non-performance of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad dmigs pa med par gtogs pa la gtod par byed pa ni gang mi dge pa'i chos rnams thob par mi byed do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs pa med par gtogs pa la gtod par byed pa ni gang mi dge pa'i chos rnams thob par mi byed do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It is the one that directs all phenomena to the absence of reference points.üîΩIt is the one that does not acquire any nonvirtuous qualities.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su 'gro bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du gang la yang gtod par mi byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su 'gro bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du gang la yang gtod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not settle down on any dharma, from not taking up the unwholesome dharmas up to not settling down on nirvana, because it is included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rnam par rab tu gnas pa nyid kyi ming ji lta ba dang / mtshan ma ji lta ba de ltar gtod par mi byed cing mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de chos thams cad la gtod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rnam par rab tu gnas pa nyid kyi ming ji lta ba dang / mtshan ma ji lta ba de ltar gtod par mi byed cing mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de chos thams cad la gtod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not settle down on any dharma as it is named and as it is signified, and because he settles down on all dharmas in the aspect of nonapprehending.

original: de la ming ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni btags pa'o //
translated: There, the name is the designation.

original: mtshan ma ni 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The sign is the cause of engagement.

original: gtod pa ni gtod pa med pa nyid kyis gnyis kyi 'du shes de las ring du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs par mi byed de /
analyzed: gtod pa ni gtod pa med pa nyid kyis gnyis kyi 'du shes de las ring du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs par mi byed de /
translated: The dedication is the dedication itself, which is the going far beyond the perception of duality. Therefore, one does not apprehend anything from form to omniscience.

original: de ni yid ches pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yid ches pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the trust.

original: don chen po nyid ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du che ba dang / chung bar byed pa bkag pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: don chen po nyid ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du che ba dang / chung bar byed pa bkag pa nas brtsams te /

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar gyi stobs yongs su grub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs yongs su grub pa ma mchis par blta'o zhes bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi don chen po sangs rgyas nyid du sgrub par byed pas na pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes bstan pa yin no //

translated: From the beginning of the chapter, Because of the non-establishment of the powers of the Buddha qualities, etc., the power of the perfection of wisdom should be seen as non-established, and Because of the accomplishment of the great meaning of the Buddha, the Buddhahood, it is the great perfection. This is the teaching.

analyzed: la ma mos pa dang / phung po la sogs pa la mngon bar zhen pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa ste /

analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag ni chos spong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan to //
