translated: This is what is said.

original: thabs ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is not a method?

original: de ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas //
analyzed: de ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas //
translated: It is from the perspective of apprehending signs.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang ming nyid kyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang ming nyid kyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that by the name itself, the perfection of wisdom is made distant.

original: de nyid las bzlog pa ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid las bzlog pa ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is skill in means.

original: de dang nye ba nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dang nye ba nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as being close to that.

original: gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa las bzlog pa'i sbyor bas ni de dag rtogs pa phyogs gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa las bzlog pa'i sbyor bas ni de dag rtogs pa phyogs gcig pa yin no //
translated: Those whose practice is the opposite of the realizations of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on have one-sided realizations.

original: zhes gsungs pas de dag ni ma lus pa mthar thug par 'gro ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas de dag ni ma lus pa mthar thug par 'gro ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, they do not go to the ultimate end of those.

original: nye bar bzung nas de'i lam legs par bshad cing legs par mthar thug par bstan to //
analyzed: nye bar bzung nas de'i lam legs par bshad cing legs par mthar thug par bstan to //
translated: But those who take up the perfection of wisdom and teach it well, and show it well, they go to the ultimate end of those.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩgzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad nas / gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la //
translated: With regard to the discordant classes, it says:üîΩThe discordant class is the idea of practiceüîΩWith regard to the aggregates of form and so on, emptiness,üîΩThe phenomena included in the three times,üîΩThe phenomena with and without defilements,

original: spyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: spyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs //
translated: And the factors of enlightenment such as generosity.

original: zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la /
translated: With regard to that,

original: gang thabs la mi mkhas pas gzugs stong pa zhes bya bar 'du shes shing des 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos su 'du shes la /
analyzed: gang thabs la mi mkhas pas gzugs stong pa zhes bya bar 'du shes shing des 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos su 'du shes la /
translated: those who are not skilled in means have the idea that form is empty, and by that they have the idea of phenomena included in the three times.

original: de bzhin du @81a * //üîΩsems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du @81a * // sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Similarly,üîΩstarting from the first generation of the thought of enlightenment,

original: gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'du shes shing /
analyzed: gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'du shes shing /
translated: they have the idea of the perfection of generosity,

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'du shes pa ni chags pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'du shes pa ni chags pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: In the same way, the perception of the factors of enlightenment up to the knowledge of all aspects is attachment.

original: gnyen po gang zhig yin zhen /üîΩsbyin la sogs pa ngar 'dzin med //
analyzed: gnyen po gang zhig yin zhen / sbyin la sogs pa ngar 'dzin med //
translated: What is the antidote?

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúGenerosity and so on without grasping.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhan yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni thabs la mkhas bar gyur pas gzugs la gzugs su 'du shes ba med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni thabs la mkhas bar gyur pas gzugs la gzugs su 'du shes ba med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom, having become skilled in means, does not perceive form as form, and so on, up to:

original: bdag gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par bya'o snyam du mi sems te zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par bya'o snyam du mi sems te zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúI will attain the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa las bzlog par rnam par rtog pa thams cad bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa las bzlog par rnam par rtog pa thams cad bkag pa yin no //
translated: The negation of all conceptualization is made by the opposite of the teaching of the counteragents.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid thams cad gzung pa ni 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad gzung pa ni 'thad pa yin te /
translated: The apprehension of all emptinesses is tenable.

original: thabs la mkhas pas chags pa med do zhes so //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas chags pa med do zhes so //
translated: Through skill in means, there is no attachment.üîΩMoreover, the discordant class is taught beginning from ‚ÄúKau≈õika, here a bodhisattva who has the conception of a self‚Äù up to ‚Äúby whatever attachment one is unable to be without attachment, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom that is without attachment.‚Äù

original: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems su 'du shes pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems su 'du shes pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of attachment isüîΩ‚ÄúWhy is that?üîΩThe conception of a self up to the conception of knowers and viewers is the conception of grasping at a real self of phenomena.‚ÄùüîΩThe antidote isüîΩ‚ÄúMoreover, one who is attached to form, up to one who is attached to the knowledge of all aspects, is not a bodhisattva.‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching of the antidote is

original: chags pa gang gis chags pa med par mi nus na chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa gang gis chags pa med par mi nus na chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika, here a bodhisattva who is not attached to form, up to who is not attached to the knowledge of all aspects is a bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: chags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of the antidote is

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?üîΩThe conception of a self up to the conception of knowers and viewers is the conception of grasping at a real self of phenomena.‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching of the characteristics of the antidote isüîΩ‚ÄúKau≈õika, here a bodhisattva who is not attached to form, up to who is not attached to the knowledge of all aspects is a bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ngar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ngar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of the antidote isüîΩ‚ÄúWhy is that?üîΩThe conception of a self up to the conception of knowers and viewers is the conception of grasping at a real self of phenomena.‚Äù

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni /üîΩgzhan yang de la sbyor byed cing //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni / gzhan yang de la sbyor byed cing //
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of the antidote isüîΩ‚ÄúKau≈õika, here a bodhisattva who is not attached to form, up to who is not attached to the knowledge of all aspects is a bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: de ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog pa //
analyzed: de ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog pa //
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of the antidote isüîΩ‚ÄúWhy is that?üîΩThe conception of a self up to the conception of knowers and viewers is the conception of grasping at a real self of phenomena.‚Äù

original: zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of the antidote isüîΩ‚ÄúKau≈õika, here a bodhisattva who is not attached to form, up to who is not attached to the knowledge of all aspects is a bodhisattva.‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching of the characteristics of the antidote isüîΩ‚ÄúWhy is that?üîΩThe conception of a self up to the conception of knowers and viewers is the conception of grasping at a real self of phenomena.‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching of the characteristics of the antidote is

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika

original: gzhan dag de nyid du ngar 'dzin pa bkag pa yang dag par bstan par bya ba dang / yang dag par bskul bar bya ba dang / yang dag par spro ba bskyed par bya ba rnams chags pa'i mtha' thams cad spong ba yin te /üîΩde la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag med pa kun du zhum pa dang / yang dag par zhum par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag bar spro ba bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan dag de nyid du ngar 'dzin pa bkag pa yang dag par bstan par bya ba dang / yang dag par bskul bar bya ba dang / yang dag par spro ba bskyed par bya ba rnams chags pa'i mtha' thams cad spong ba yin te / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag med pa kun du zhum pa dang / yang dag par zhum par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag bar spro ba bskyed pa dang /
translated: Others, in order to be taught, urged, and inspired, abandon all extremes of attachment, and the self-habit is stopped.üîΩHere, those who are afflicted, heedless, and fainthearted are taught, urged, inspired, and gladdened, respectively.

original: yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa rnams @81b go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa rnams @81b go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: yang / rgyal la sogs la chags pa phra //
analyzed: yang / rgyal la sogs la chags pa phra //
translated: Attachment to kings, etc., is subtle.

original: zhes bstan pa ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bas yongs su bsngo zhing yang mtshan mar byed pa ni chags pa phra mo zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bas yongs su bsngo zhing yang mtshan mar byed pa ni chags pa phra mo zhes bstan to ;
translated: This teaches that the dedication of merit by rejoicing in the roots of virtue of those tathƒÅgatas while still conceiving of them as having attributes is a subtle attachment.

original: / yang ci'i phyir rnam pa de la chags pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: / yang ci'i phyir rnam pa de la chags pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is attachment to that aspect called attachment?

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩchos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / chos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Because:üîΩThe path of Dharma is profound

original: dben pa'i phyir na de zab nyid //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir na de zab nyid //
translated: Because it is naturally isolated.

original: ces bya ba la smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la smos te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all phenomena are naturally isolated,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab po zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab po zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is taught to be profound.

original: yang chags pa thams cad ji lta bus spong zhe na /
analyzed: yang chags pa thams cad ji lta bus spong zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how are all attachments abandoned?üîΩAttachment is abandoned by knowing

original: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni //üîΩshes pas chags ba spong ba yin //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni // shes pas chags ba spong ba yin //
translated: That phenomena are of a single nature.

original: zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gcig bar shes pa ni shes pa dang / shes bya ba mnyam pa nyid du thob pa yin pa'i phyir chags pa'i mtha' can yongs su spong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gcig bar shes pa ni shes pa dang / shes bya ba mnyam pa nyid du thob pa yin pa'i phyir chags pa'i mtha' can yongs su spong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one who knows the nature of phenomena as one, and who has attained the sameness of knower and object of knowledge, abandons the extreme of attachment.

original: yang ci'i phyir rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab mo yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab mo yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why is this perfection of wisdom profound due to its cause?

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩmthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / mthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis //
translated: BecauseüîΩit is explained as difficult to understand

original: de ni rtogs par dka' bar bshad //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni rtogs par dka' bar bshad // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: by the negation of seeing, etc.

original: gang mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes par bya ba rnams bkag pa nyid kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir shes bya ba mnyam pa nyid du zur gyis bstan pa yin no //üîΩyang ci'i rgyus /
analyzed: gang mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par shes par bya ba rnams bkag pa nyid kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir shes bya ba mnyam pa nyid du zur gyis bstan pa yin no // yang ci'i rgyus /
translated: It is taught by implication that the sameness of knower and object of knowledge is difficult to understand because it is difficult to understand due to the negation of seeing, hearing, understanding, and knowing.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rtogs par dka' zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rtogs par dka' zhe na /
translated: Again, why is this perfection of wisdom difficult to understand due to its cause?

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa mi shes phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / gzugs la sogs pa mi shes phyir //
translated: BecauseüîΩit is considered inconceivable

original: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab 'dod //
analyzed: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab 'dod //
translated: due to the non-understanding of form, etc.

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above verse.

original: gang gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du mi shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du mi shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one does not know form up to the unentangled Buddha dharmas.

original: des bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir shes pa mnyam ba nyid du zur gyis bstan te /
analyzed: des bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir shes pa mnyam ba nyid du zur gyis bstan te /
translated: Since that is inconceivable, the equality of knowledge is indirectly taught.

original: de ltar byas nas ji skad du //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas ji skad du //
translated: Having done it that way, as it is said:

original: de ltar kun shes nyid lugs la //
analyzed: de ltar kun shes nyid lugs la //
translated: Thus, in the system of complete knowledge,

original: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag //
translated: all the divisions of the discordant classes and antidotes

original: rnam da bye ma lus 'dis shes bya //
analyzed: rnam da bye ma lus 'dis shes bya //
translated: are known by this.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The commentary on the divisions of the discordant classes and antidotes is complete.

original: // / da ni sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the application will be explained.

original: gzugs de mi rtag la sogs pa //
analyzed: gzugs de mi rtag la sogs pa //
translated: That form is impermanent, etc.üîΩThat is not complete, completely complete,üîΩand the practice of stopping application

original: de ma @82a * //üîΩrdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // sbyor ba bkag pas spyod pa ni //
analyzed: de ma @82a * // rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // sbyor ba bkag pas spyod pa ni //
translated: is the absence of attachment to that,üîΩthe unchanging, the absence of an agent, the threefold stopping of application,

original: de la chags pa med nyid dang // mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // sbyor ba bkag pa rnam gsum dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras 'thob pas //
analyzed: de la chags pa med nyid dang // mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // sbyor ba bkag pa rnam gsum dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras 'thob pas //
translated: and the attainment of the result according to one's fortune.

original: de yi 'bras bu yid 'dod dang // gzhan la rag las mi gang dang // shes byed rnam bdun snang ba las //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu yid 'dod dang // gzhan la rag las mi gang dang // shes byed rnam bdun snang ba las //
translated: and the sevenfold appearance of knowledge.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: sbyor ba de ni rnam pa bcur 'gyur te //
analyzed: sbyor ba de ni rnam pa bcur 'gyur te //
translated: That application is of ten kinds.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Among them, the application to form, etc.

original: gang gal te gzugs la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gang gal te gzugs la mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: is that which, if one does not practice with form, one practices with the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid kyi bar du spyod pa bkag nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid kyi bar du spyod pa bkag nas /
translated: Having prohibited practice up to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de ltar spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin par bstan to //
translated: it is taught that such practice is permitted.

original: gzugs mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application to the aspect of impermanence of form, etc.

original: gang phung po la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid kyi bar du rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba'i rnam pa la spyod pa bkag pa ni /
analyzed: gang phung po la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid kyi bar du rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba'i rnam pa la spyod pa bkag pa ni /
translated: is that which prohibits practice with the aggregates, etc. up to the knowledge of all aspects in the aspects of permanent and impermanent, happy and suffering, self and selfless, peaceful and not peaceful,

original: de ltar spyod pa yang rjes su gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa yang rjes su gnang ba yin te /
translated: And it is also permitted to practice in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de bzhin du med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de bzhin du med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Because it has been taught that form and so on up to omniscience do not exist in that way.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzhan yang gzugs la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ma rdzogs pa'i rnam pa la spyod pa bkag nas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzhan yang gzugs la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / ma rdzogs pa'i rnam pa la spyod pa bkag nas /
translated: The application to the completion and incompletion of form and so on is the negation of engaging in the aspects of the completion and incompletion of form and so on.

original: de ltar spyod pa yang rjes su gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa yang rjes su gnang ba yin te /
translated: And it is also permitted to practice in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi ngo bo yongs su rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa bkag pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo yongs su rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa bkag pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Because it has been taught that the completion and incompletion of their nature is negated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang /
translated: What is the application to being unattached to form and so on?

original: de dag nyid la chags ba med par spyod pa nyid bkag pas yang de ltar spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de dag nyid la chags ba med par spyod pa nyid bkag pas yang de ltar spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is the negation of engaging in being unattached to those very things. It is also permitted to practice in that way.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni gang sbyor ba de mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid bzung nas nam mkha'i dpes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni gang sbyor ba de mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid bzung nas nam mkha'i dpes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The application of non-transformation is taught by the example of space, holding that the nature of the application is non-transformation.

original: de'i mdo ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: de'i mdo ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: The sutra says, ‚ÄúSubhuti, it is thus.

original: nam mkha' ni bsngags ba brjod kyang 'phel ba med la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni bsngags ba brjod kyang 'phel ba med la /
translated: Space is not increased by praise,

original: ma brjod kyang 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: ma brjod kyang 'grib pa med do //
translated: nor is it decreased by disparagement.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @82b bstan kyang 'phel ba med la /üîΩma bstan kyang 'grib ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @82b bstan kyang 'phel ba med la / ma bstan kyang 'grib ba med do //
translated: Subhuti, similarly, the perfection of wisdom is not increased by teaching,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: nor is it decreased by not teaching.‚Äù

original: byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang sbyor ba de la ni byed pa por snang ba nyid nye bar bzhugs nas sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i bsngags pa brjod pa'am /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang sbyor ba de la ni byed pa por snang ba nyid nye bar bzhugs nas sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i bsngags pa brjod pa'am /
translated: The application of the absence of an agent is taught by the example of a magical creation, holding that the appearance of an agent is present in the application.üîΩThe sutra says, ‚ÄúSubhuti, it is thus.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is not increased by praise,

original: ma brjod pa gnyis kyis rjes su chags pa dang ; khro ba med pa'i dpes de bzhin du 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: ma brjod pa gnyis kyis rjes su chags pa dang ; khro ba med pa'i dpes de bzhin du 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med do //
translated: nor is it decreased by disparagement.‚Äù

original: dka' ba'i spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dka' ba'i spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The application of difficult conduct is threefold.

original: gang de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas' difficulty is threefold.

original: de la ched du bya ba'i dka' ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la ched du bya ba'i dka' ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid yin no //
translated: Among them, the difficulty of the aim is the knowledge of all modes.

original: sbyor ba dka' ba nyid ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dka' ba nyid ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: The difficulty of application is the knowledge of paths.

original: bya ba rnams dka' ba nyid ni thams cad shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bya ba rnams dka' ba nyid ni thams cad shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: The difficulty of action is the knowledge of all things.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor bar 'dod pa dang / rtsol bar 'dod pa dang / bya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam pa gsum dang ngo //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor bar 'dod pa dang / rtsol bar 'dod pa dang / bya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam pa gsum dang ngo //
translated: In order, they are the three phrases one who wishes to apply, one who wishes to strive, and one who wishes to act.

original: dka' ba'i tshig gsum gsal bar byed de //
analyzed: dka' ba'i tshig gsum gsal bar byed de //
translated: These three phrases of difficulty are clarified.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Among them, by the knowledge of all modes, one who wishes to apply to the aim of all beings.

original: nam mkha' yongs su sgrol bar 'dod pa lam shes pa nyid kyis de la rtsol bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' yongs su sgrol bar 'dod pa lam shes pa nyid kyis de la rtsol bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: By the knowledge of paths, one who wishes to strive for that, wishing to liberate space.

original: nam mkha' bar snang la 'phang bar 'dod pa ni gang zhig thams cad shes pa nyid kyis de la bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bar snang la 'phang bar 'dod pa ni gang zhig thams cad shes pa nyid kyis de la bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire to fly through the sky and space is the desire to do that by means of the knowledge of all modes.

original: rnam pa gsum po des brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po des brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par bstan to //
translated: By these three aspects, the perfection of vigor is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sems can tshad med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mdzad kyang sems can gyi khams la 'bri ba'am /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sems can tshad med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mdzad kyang sems can gyi khams la 'bri ba'am /
translated: The ten directions' world systems' Tathagatas, although they bring to Nirvana countless beings, the realm of beings has no decrease or increase.

original: gang ba med pa ni nam mkha' go bgos pa'i dpes 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang ba med pa ni nam mkha' go bgos pa'i dpes 'thad pa yin no //
translated: This is tenable by the example of the sky-clad.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: don yod pa'i sbyor ba nyid ni gang /
analyzed: don yod pa'i sbyor ba nyid ni gang /
translated: What is the application of the unerring?

original: de nas dge slong zhig gis zhes bya ba'i ming du ma bstan pa'i skyes bu'i rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa nye bar bkod nas 'khor gzhan dag gis kyang skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa thob par bstan pa yin no //üîΩgzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba'i sbyor ba ni brgya byin gyis bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par khas blangs pa ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / sgra @83a * //
analyzed: de nas dge slong zhig gis zhes bya ba'i ming du ma bstan pa'i skyes bu'i rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa nye bar bkod nas 'khor gzhan dag gis kyang skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa thob par bstan pa yin no // gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba'i sbyor ba ni brgya byin gyis bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par khas blangs pa ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / sgra @83a * //
translated: Then, a certain monk, having set forth a realization that is in accord with the person whose name is not mentioned, it is shown that the other retinue members also attained realization according to their lot.üîΩThe application of not going by the condition of another is the acceptance of protection, nurturing, and guarding by ≈öatakratu, which is understood by the example of the impossibility of protecting, etc.,

original: brnyan dang / mig yor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba la sogs par mi nus ba nyid kyi dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: brnyan dang / mig yor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba la sogs par mi nus ba nyid kyi dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: a magical illusion, a mirage, a dream, an echo, an optical illusion, a tathƒÅgata‚Äôs emanation, the limit of reality, suchness, and the inconceivable element.

original: rigs kyi bu mo la yang dag par bsrung ba ni rnam par nyams shing dub pa'i skal ba can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la yang dag par bsrung ba ni rnam par nyams shing dub pa'i skal ba can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The sons and daughters of good lineage who are protected in this way will not be subject to decline and will be protected.

original: phyin ci ma log pa la gnas pa de nyid bsrung ba yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa la gnas pa de nyid bsrung ba yin te /
translated: Those who abide in the unmistaken are protected.

original: phyin ci ma log bar mi gnas na ni /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log bar mi gnas na ni /
translated: Those who do not abide in the unmistaken

original: mi dang / mi ma yin pa de dag gis glags rnyed par 'gyur bas bsrung bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dang / mi ma yin pa de dag gis glags rnyed par 'gyur bas bsrung bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: are not protected because they are vulnerable to humans and nonhumans.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba yin par gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba yin par gsal bar bstan to //
translated: This clearly shows that they do not go by the conditions of others.

original: shes byed rnam bdun bstan pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: shes byed rnam bdun bstan pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the seven illustrationsüîΩis as follows.

original: gang btsun pa rab 'byor ji tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' la yongs su 'gyur bas chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur snang ba yin la /üîΩ'dus pa'i sbyor bas sgyu ma lta bur snang ba yin /
analyzed: gang btsun pa rab 'byor ji tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' la yongs su 'gyur bas chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur snang ba yin la / 'dus pa'i sbyor bas sgyu ma lta bur snang ba yin /
translated: The Venerable Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúBodhisattvas see all phenomena as dreamlike because of their transformation.üîΩThey see them as illusionlike because of their combination.

original: 'gal bas smig rgyu lta bur snang ba yin /
analyzed: 'gal bas smig rgyu lta bur snang ba yin /
translated: They see them as miragelike because of their contradiction.

original: rkyen gyis brag ca lta bur snang ba yin /
analyzed: rkyen gyis brag ca lta bur snang ba yin /
translated: They see them as echolike because of their conditions.

original: mi 'da' bas gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba yin /
analyzed: mi 'da' bas gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba yin /
translated: They see them as reflectionlike because of their nontransgression.

original: rten pa med pas dri za'i grong khyer lta bur snang ba yin /
analyzed: rten pa med pas dri za'i grong khyer lta bur snang ba yin /
translated: Since there is no support, they appear like a city of gandharvas.

original: byed pa po med pas thams cad sprul pa lta bur snang ba yin par yongs su shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa po med pas thams cad sprul pa lta bur snang ba yin par yongs su shes par 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no agent, everything appears like a magical creation.

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: This is the meaning that is understood, beginning from here.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas dpes don 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas dpes don 'thad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the examples is tenable in terms of the sravakas and so on, in terms of the knowledge of all things.

original: sbyor ba rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the applications,

original: da ni mnyam ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa rlom med pa //
analyzed: da ni mnyam ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gzugs la sogs pa rlom med pa //
translated: now, in order to teach the sameness,üîΩhe says:üîΩThe sameness of the four

original: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
translated: in the absence of conceit about form and so on.

original: ces bya ba smos pa sbyor ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos pa sbyor ba'i don yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the application.

original: de la 'di ltar rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /üîΩgzugs rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te / gzugs rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Therein, it is fourfold:üîΩOne does not conceive of form,

original: gzugs kyi rlom sems su mi byed /üîΩgzugs la tha dag gi rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rlom sems su mi byed / gzugs la tha dag gi rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: one does not conceive of the conceit of form,üîΩone does not conceive of the conceit in form,

original: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: one does not conceive of the conceit about form.

original: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar la yang brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar la yang brjod bar bya'o //
translated: And likewise, it should be expressed up to the knowledge of all things.

original: rlom sems rnam pa bzhi'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rlom sems rnam pa bzhi'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: The non-conceptual cognition that refutes the four types of conceit.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The commentary on the application of sameness.

original: // / da ni mthong ba'i @83b lam brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni mthong ba'i @83b lam brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the path of seeing will be described.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mthus lha'i rigs thams cad kyi phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing sangs rgyas ston dang / 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba zab mo 'di nyid lhag chad med par ston par mdzad par sems so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mthus lha'i rigs thams cad kyi phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing sangs rgyas ston dang / 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba zab mo 'di nyid lhag chad med par ston par mdzad par sems so //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the Buddha, in each of the ten directions, all the divine clans think that the Buddhas, the noble Maitreya and so forth, the Buddhas of the Fortunate Eon, teach this very profound perfection of wisdom without addition or subtraction.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis skad cig ma bcu drug las ma gtogs bar skad cig ma gzhan med par shes par bya ba dang / dpang por gyur pa dgos pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis skad cig ma bcu drug las ma gtogs bar skad cig ma gzhan med par shes par bya ba dang / dpang por gyur pa dgos pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: It is necessary to know that there are no other moments except for the sixteen moments of the path of seeing, and to be a witness.

original: de la 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dper ma byas pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dper ma byas pa ni /
translated: Among them, the past Buddhas are not taken as an example.

original: de'i bstan pa mthar thug pa'i sbyor ba shes bar bya ba'i ched yin no //
analyzed: de'i bstan pa mthar thug pa'i sbyor ba shes bar bya ba'i ched yin no //
translated: and the ultimate application of his teaching.üîΩ

original: ma 'ongs pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du de gos pa ston pa'i ched yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du de gos pa ston pa'i ched yin no //
translated: The statement about the future is for the sake of those future sentient beings who are to be trained by him.

original: grangs stong du nges pas ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed du bskal pa bzang po pa stong du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir thabs mkhas bas gzhan dag kyang bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa med par shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: grangs stong du nges pas ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed du bskal pa bzang po pa stong du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir thabs mkhas bas gzhan dag kyang bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa med par shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The statement about the thousand is for the sake of those who are to be trained by others, in order to show that there is no obstruction to the accomplishment of the path by skillful means, since a thousand fortunate eons have been completed in the SahƒÅ world system.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the moment of the path of seeing?üîΩTherefore he says:üîΩThe accumulation of the moments of Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, and acceptance of the knowledge of the path

original: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal la sogs dben pa la //üîΩchos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig bsag nyid 'di //üîΩkun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal la sogs dben pa la // chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig bsag nyid 'di // kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam ;
translated: with regard to the separation from suffering and so on

original: / zhes bya ba smos pa ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba smos pa ste /
translated: is the path of seeing in the system of complete knowledge.

original: de la sdug bsngal chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering is as follows:

original: gang gzugs rtag ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: gang gzugs rtag ces bya ba 'am /
translated: It is the knowledge that form is permanent or impermanent,

original: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: He will teach the Dharma saying, impermanent, up to suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'das pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'das pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, the knowledge of all aspects is past,

original: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'am /üîΩda ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'am / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: future, or present.

original: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa la phyin ci log tu zhen pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa la phyin ci log tu zhen pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the attachment to the conceptual thoughts of the counteragent and the counter-correlate has been stopped.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni gang gzugs rnam par dag go zhes rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni gang gzugs rnam par dag go zhes rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The Dharma knowledge of suffering is taught as form is pure, up to the knowledge of all aspects is pure.üîΩ This is because the two kinds of conceptual thoughts as explained do not exist, and there is no attachment to the pure Dharma.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par dag go zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po med cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par dag go zhes bstan pa yin no // ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po med cing /
translated: The Dharma knowledge of the origin is taught as form is not pure, up to the knowledge of all aspects is not pure.

original: phyin ci ma log par rnam par dag pa'i chos @84a * //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par rnam par dag pa'i chos @84a * //
translated: This is because the two kinds of conceptual thoughts as explained do exist, and there is attachment to the impure Dharma.

original: ston par rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rab 'byor gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ston par rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rab 'byor gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is authorized by the Teacher.üîΩThe acceptance of the knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the perfection of wisdom, which is taught by the words ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the perfection of wisdom is pure because form, etc. up to the knowledge of all aspects is pure.‚ÄùüîΩThe knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the perfection of wisdom, which is taught by the words ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the perfection of wisdom is pure because form, etc. up to the knowledge of all aspects is pure.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩsdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no // sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rnam pa de dag nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i dpes de dag gi rnam pa yongs su dag go zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rnam pa de dag nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i dpes de dag gi rnam pa yongs su dag go zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the perfection of wisdom, which is taught by the words ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the perfection of wisdom is pure because form, etc. up to the knowledge of all aspects is pure.‚ÄùüîΩThe knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path of the perfection of wisdom, which is taught by the words ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti,

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni gang de ltar de dag gi rnam pas gos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩkun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni gang de ltar de dag gi rnam pas gos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang /
translated: The Dharma knowledge of origin is that because they are not stained by those aspects.

original: de ltar de dag gi rnam pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi rnam pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perseverance for subsequent knowledge of origin is that because they are not apprehended by those aspects.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni gang sgra brnyan gyi dpes de dag gi tha snyad kyi rnam pa med pas 'dir tha snyad kyi rnam pa don gyis bkag pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni gang sgra brnyan gyi dpes de dag gi tha snyad kyi rnam pa med pas 'dir tha snyad kyi rnam pa don gyis bkag pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of origin is that because they are not conventional aspects, as indicated by the example of an echo.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang nam mkha' brjod du med pa'i phyir rnam pa brjod du med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang nam mkha' brjod du med pa'i phyir rnam pa brjod du med do //
translated: The perseverance for Dharma knowledge of cessation is that because space is inexpressible, it is inexpressible.

original: 'dir yang gzhan gyi brgyud pa brjod pas de'i don gzhan gyi rtogs pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan gyi brgyud pa brjod pas de'i don gzhan gyi rtogs pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Here also, the meaning of that is negated by the expression of another‚Äôs continuum.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni de ltar rnam pa mi dmigs par bstan to //
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni de ltar rnam pa mi dmigs par bstan to //
translated: The Dharma knowledge of cessation is that because the aspects are not apprehended in that way.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pas mi dmigs pa'i skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang pa med pa'i rnam pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan to //üîΩ'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni gang de 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de la ni nad la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lha rnams kyang de'i phyi bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pas mi dmigs pa'i skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang pa med pa'i rnam pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan to // 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni gang de 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa de la ni nad la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lha rnams kyang de'i phyi bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The subsequent knowledge of cessation is the aspect of the complete purity of the perfection of wisdom, which is the non-observation of all phenomena due to complete purity.

original: de ston pa der yang zhag gsum du lha'i tshogs chen po 'du bar 'gyur ba @84b dang / chos ston pa bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid kyis chos gsum smos te /
analyzed: de ston pa der yang zhag gsum du lha'i tshogs chen po 'du bar 'gyur ba @84b dang / chos ston pa bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid kyis chos gsum smos te /
translated: The subsequent

original: de la lha rnams mchod par byed pa dang / blta ba dang / 'du bas ni shes par byed pa'i don yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la lha rnams mchod par byed pa dang / blta ba dang / 'du bas ni shes par byed pa'i don yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto be known‚Äù is taught by the gods worshipping it, looking at it, and gathering around it.

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rin po che thams cad shes pa'i dbang gis sdig pa thams cad zi ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rin po che thams cad shes pa'i dbang gis sdig pa thams cad zi ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: What is acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching with regard to the path?

original: dga' bar byed pas ni rin po che zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pas ni rin po che zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äújewel‚Äù is taught to mean ‚Äúto delight‚Äù because it is the cause of knowing all the perfections of wisdom, of the purification of all evil, and of the knowledge of the factors of purification.

original: lam la chos shes pa ni gang /üîΩyang lam shes pa'i dbang gis chos 'ga' yang skye ba 'am /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa ni gang / yang lam shes pa'i dbang gis chos 'ga' yang skye ba 'am /
translated: What is the knowledge of the teaching with regard to the path?üîΩBy the power of the knowledge of the path, no dharma is produced or stopped.

original: 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: up to the knowledge of the limit of reality, because of the non-discrimination of the compounded and the uncompounded,

original: rtog pa med pa'i dge ba'i rang bzhin la ni rin po che zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i dge ba'i rang bzhin la ni rin po che zhes bstan to //
translated: The nature of virtue that is nonconceptual is taught to be a jewel.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang gis chos de dang de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma rnams rtogs pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa dang mi ldan pas gos pa med pa'i rin po che yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang gis chos de dang de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma rnams rtogs pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa'i rtogs pa dang mi ldan pas gos pa med pa'i rin po che yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The receptivity to the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is taught to be a jewel that is unstained because it is not associated with the realization of phenomena and so on, since it is through the power of the knowledge of all aspects that the aspects, signs and marks of those phenomena are realized.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni gang yang ji skad du /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni gang yang ji skad du /
translated: The subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is taught to be the complete fulfillment of the intended purpose because it is said:

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi don rnam par mi shes pa dngos po'i yul shes pas rnam par rtog par yang mi byed /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi don rnam par mi shes pa dngos po'i yul shes pas rnam par rtog par yang mi byed /
translated: One who does not understand the meaning of the three jewels does not conceptualize the object of things through knowledge.

original: de dag gi mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pas gnyis su dmigs pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩmngon bar 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pas gnyis su dmigs pa med pa'i phyir / mngon bar 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the conceptualization of their signs is not observed, there is no observation of duality.

original: de'i mdor bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mdor bsdus pa ni /
translated: Its summary is:

original: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Form is not permanent, nor is it impermanent.

original: de la dad pas ba spu langs pa'i sgra ni ca co'i sgra yin no //
analyzed: de la dad pas ba spu langs pa'i sgra ni ca co'i sgra yin no //
translated: The sound of the hairs on the body standing on end through faith is the sound of the hum of bees.

original: lhag ma'i tshig gi don ni 'grel pas bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma'i tshig gi don ni 'grel pas bshad do //
translated: The meaning of the rest of the words is explained in the commentary.

original: yang ci'i phyir lam shes pa nyid bzhin du thams cad shes pa la bsgom pa'i lam logs shig na med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir lam shes pa nyid bzhin du thams cad shes pa la bsgom pa'i lam logs shig na med ce na /
translated: Why is there no separate path of cultivation in the knowledge of all aspects, as there is in the knowledge of the path?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'di ni gzhan gtso bor byed pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'di ni gzhan gtso bor byed pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The listeners' and solitary realizers' excellences are to be transcended by the bodhisattva's knowledge and seeing.

original: gang gzhan yang rgyun tu zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gzhan yang rgyun tu zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: And whatever knowledge and abandonment there is of the stream enterer up to the solitary realizer, that is the bodhisattva's acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: de ltar na gang /
analyzed: de ltar na gang /
translated: So what is it?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
analyzed: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
translated: Through knowledge one does not abide in existence,

original: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
analyzed: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
translated: Through compassion, one does not dwell in peace; through the absence of skill in means, one is far away; through skill in means, one is not far away.

original: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang / sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba yin //
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang / sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba yin //
translated: The path of insight is the side of the counteragent that is incompatible with that, the union with it, and the equality of that.

original: de 'drar kun shes nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: de 'drar kun shes nyid du 'dod //
translated: That is considered to be the state of being all-knowing.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de 'dir rjes su 'brel @85b ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dir rjes su 'brel @85b ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be seen as being related to that.

original: slob dpon rnam par grol ba'i sdes mdzad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyen pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las thams cad shes pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon rnam par grol ba'i sdes mdzad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyen pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las thams cad shes pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the perfection of wisdom instruction treatise called Ornament of Clear Realization, composed by Master Vimuktisena, which explains all-knowledge.

original: // / thams cad shes pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: // / thams cad shes pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the state of being all-knowing,

original: da ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam pa kun mngon bar byang chub pa ni yang kun mkhyen gsum po'i rnam pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam pa kun mngon bar byang chub pa ni yang kun mkhyen gsum po'i rnam pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: now, in order to show the complete realization of all aspects, the complete enlightenment of all aspects is taught again, showing the aspects of the three omnisciences.

original: de la re zhig / dmigs ba'i khyad par bzung ba la //
analyzed: de la re zhig / dmigs ba'i khyad par bzung ba la //
translated: First,

original: rnam pa zhes ni bya bar brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes ni bya bar brjod //
translated: The aspects are said to be the special supports of the objects.

original: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa rnams so //
translated: The objects are the objects of observation.

original: rnam pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang gis gang zhig gnyen po'i phyogs ni chos yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang gis gang zhig gnyen po'i phyogs ni chos yin te /
translated: The aspects are the phenomena that are the antidote side, which are the antidotes to the discordant side.

original: dper na rtag par 'dzin pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rtag par 'dzin pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, impermanence and so forth are the antidotes to the apprehension of permanence.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyang kun mkhyen gsum gyis bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyang kun mkhyen gsum gyis bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the antidote side is also included in the three omnisciences,üîΩit is said:

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
translated: Because omniscience is threefold,

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //üîΩces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod // ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is asserted to be threefold.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúaspect‚Äù is the meaning of the term ‚Äúomniscience.‚Äù

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rten can du byas pa kun mkhyen gsum gyi dbang du byas nas bden pa gang la rnam pa ji snyed yod pa de bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmed pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rten can du byas pa kun mkhyen gsum gyi dbang du byas nas bden pa gang la rnam pa ji snyed yod pa de bstan pa'i phyir / med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
translated: In order to demonstrate the number of aspects of each truth, taking the three omnisciences as the basis of the four noble truths,üîΩit is said:üîΩFrom the aspect of nonexistence

original: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
translated: up to the aspect of nonfluctuation.

original: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam de la ni bco lngar bshad //
analyzed: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam de la ni bco lngar bshad //
translated: fifteen aspects for the path.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //üîΩde la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no // de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: re zhig bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: re zhig bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: With regard to that, the Lord, in consideration of the four aspects of the truth of suffering,üîΩsaid:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom is a perfection of non-existence.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti, because of the non-existence of space.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni thams cad shes pa'i mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' med pa'i dpes med pa'i don ni rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni thams cad shes pa'i mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' med pa'i dpes med pa'i don ni rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspects of the sravakas, etc. are the aspects of impermanence, etc. of the knowledge of all things. The perfection of wisdom is the meaning of non-existence, as illustrated by the example of space.

original: de bzhin du tshig so so la yang bya bar don bshad pa dang / 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig so so la yang bya bar don bshad pa dang / 'brel to //
translated: Similarly, in the case of the individual words, the meaning is explained and connected.

original: mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa ni de la 'di'i don bshad pa dang / mtshams sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa ni de la 'di'i don bshad pa dang / mtshams sbyar ba ni /
translated: The aspect called sameness is explained as follows:

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, this is the perfection of sameness.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i @86a * //üîΩphyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i @86a * // phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, because of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.üîΩThis is the perfection of emptiness.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of happiness and suffering.

original: dben pa'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: dben pa'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The aspect of seclusion is as stated:üîΩThis is the perfection of seclusion.üîΩBecause of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: 'di ni dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
translated: This is the perfection of signlessness.üîΩBecause of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: shin tu stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of invincibility is as stated:üîΩThis is the perfection of invincibility.

original: shin tu stong pa nyid ni bdag rang dbang gi rdzas kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi brdzi ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu stong pa nyid ni bdag rang dbang gi rdzas kyis stong pa'i phyir ro // mi brdzi ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni /
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: The aspect of non-discouragement is as stated:

original: 'di ni brdzi ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brdzi ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of non-discouragement.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med par nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med par nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam pas mi brdzi ba ni mu stegs can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam pas mi brdzi ba ni mu stegs can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspect of not being overwhelmed by selflessness is not shared with any tƒ´rthikas.

original: de ltar de dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa rnams sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa rnams sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these aspects should be understood as the aspects of the truth of suffering, in the order of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba bzhi'i dbang du byas nas mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba bzhi'i dbang du byas nas mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni /
translated: The four aspects of the truth of origin are considered from the perspective of the four aspects of the truth of origin.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'di ni gnas pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of nonabiding.

original: ming dang lus med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang lus med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the designation of name and form.

original: rgyu ni bskyed pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu ni bskyed pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: The cause is called the basis because it is the support for generation.

original: de la ming ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
translated: Name is the four formless aggregates.

original: de ltar byas na de gnyi ga'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na de gnyi ga'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of both of those.

original: nam mkha'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang / 'jug pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang / 'jug pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspect of space is due to the non-apprehension of inhalation and exhalation.

original: sgrib pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspect of non-obstruction is due to the non-apprehension of obstruction.

original: brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that.

original: nam mkha' mi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' mi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because space has the characteristic of non-obstruction.

original: de lta yin pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta yin pa bden mod kyi /
translated: That is true, but

original: 'on kyang nang gi bdag nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nang gi bdag nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
translated: it is taught for the purpose of realizing the internal nature.

original: dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa gnyis ni de'i nang gi rtags su de dag de ltar bstan to //üîΩbrjod du med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa gnyis ni de'i nang gi rtags su de dag de ltar bstan to // brjod du med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Inhalation and exhalation are its internal signs, so they are taught as such.üîΩThe aspect of inexpressibility is due to the non-apprehension of investigation.

original: rtog cing dpyod nas brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog cing dpyod nas brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not expressed through investigation and analysis.

original: ming med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung @86b ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ming med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung @86b ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The aspect called ‚Äúnameless‚Äù is the non-apprehension of the aggregates of feeling, etc.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming du byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming du byas pa'o //
translated: The four aggregates of feeling, etc. are called ‚Äúname.‚Äù

original: de ltar de dag rim pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar de dag rim pa bzhin du /
translated: Thus, they are, respectively,

original: rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa yin te /
translated: the aspects of cause, origination, strong production, and condition.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rten can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rten can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as the basis of the truth of origination.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa dbye ba bzhi'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa 'gro ba med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa dbye ba bzhi'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa 'gro ba med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four aspects of the truth of cessation are taught in terms of the four divisions. The aspect of ‚Äúnon-going‚Äù is

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as stated:

original: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the apprehension of all dharmas as non-going.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa lus kyi mngon sum byas pa ni 'gro ba thob par byas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa lus kyi mngon sum byas pa ni 'gro ba thob par byas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Cessation is not the attainment of going, because it is the direct experience of the body.

original: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni chos thams cad gzung du med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni chos thams cad gzung du med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The aspect of ‚Äúinvincible‚Äù is that all phenomena are apprehended as ungraspable.

original: bzung ba thob pa'i yul nyid kyi ngo bo mi 'phrogs par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung ba thob pa'i yul nyid kyi ngo bo mi 'phrogs par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the essence of the object that is grasped and attained is made invincible.

original: mi zad pa bya ba'i rnam pa ni chos thams cad zad cing bya ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi zad pa bya ba'i rnam pa ni chos thams cad zad cing bya ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspect of ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù is that all phenomena are apprehended as exhausted and finished.

original: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni /
translated: The aspect of ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù is that

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: all phenomena are apprehended as non-arising and unceasing.

original: de ltar de dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in order, they are the aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rten can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rten can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as being based on the truth of cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa ni bco lnga ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa ni bco lnga ste /
translated: The aspects of the truth of the path are fifteen.

original: bzhi ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: The last four are the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: lhag ma ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The remaining ones are the antidotes to the obscurations to knowledge.

original: de nyid snga ma'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa la byed pa po med pa'i zhes bya ba'i rnam pa la /
analyzed: de nyid snga ma'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa la byed pa po med pa'i zhes bya ba'i rnam pa la /
translated: The first of these is stated in terms of the former.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byed pa po mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the non-apprehension of the agent is taken as a basis.

original: shes pa po la sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni shes pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shes pa po la sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni shes pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspect called ‚Äúthe non-existence of the knower, etc.‚Äù is because the non-apprehension of the knower, etc. is taken as a basis.

original: 'pho ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspect called ‚Äúnon-transmigration‚Äù is because the non-apprehension of death and rebirth is taken as a basis.

original: dul ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: dul ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The aspect called ‚Äúnon-taming‚Äù is as it is said:

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dul ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dul ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the natural taming of all phenomena is taken as a basis.

original: de ltar de @87a * //
analyzed: de ltar de @87a * //
translated: Thus,üîΩ

original: dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are, respectively, the aspects of path, reason, practice, and definite release.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po lam gyi bden pa'i rten can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po lam gyi bden pa'i rten can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of the truth of the path should be understood as the support for the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path that is the side of the antidote to the obscurations to knowledge is twofold:

original: bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mthong ba'i lam zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mthong ba'i lam zag pa med pa'o //
translated: the path of cultivation that is contaminated and the path of seeing that is uncontaminated.

original: de la bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa ni rmi lam zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa ni rmi lam zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
translated: With regard to that, the teaching from the perspective of the aspects of the path of cultivation is the aspect called dream, as it is said:

original: rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because of apprehending the nonapprehended object of seeing a dream.

original: sgra brnyan zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni sgra brjod pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra brnyan zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni sgra brjod pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspect called echo is because of apprehending the nonapprehended expression of sound.

original: mig yor zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni gzugs brnyan dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mig yor zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni gzugs brnyan dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
