translated: The aspect called ‚Äúoptical illusion‚Äù is the non-apprehension of the reflection.

original: smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni chu'i phung po dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni chu'i phung po dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The aspect called ‚Äúmirage‚Äù is the non-apprehension of the mass of water.

original: sgyu ma zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni mtshan ma dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩde ltar de dag rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam pa lnga po rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gdod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni mtshan ma dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no // de ltar de dag rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam pa lnga po rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gdod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The aspect called ‚Äúillusion‚Äù is the non-apprehension of the sign.üîΩThus, these five aspects of dream, etc., are respectively the absence of intrinsic nature, non-arising, non-ceasing, primordial peace, and natural nirvƒÅ·πáa of all phenomena.

original: lngas bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: lngas bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, these five aspects of dream, etc., are respectively the absence of intrinsic nature, non-arising, non-ceasing, primordial peace, and natural nirvƒÅ·πáa of all phenomena.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po mthong ba'i lam rnam pa drug ni rnam par rtog pa spong ba yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po mthong ba'i lam rnam pa drug ni rnam par rtog pa spong ba yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The antidote to the obscurations to omniscience is the path of seeing, which is sixfold and is posited as the abandonment of the six types of conceptualization.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtog pa spong ba gsungs pa la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtog pa spong ba gsungs pa la /
translated: The abandonment of the conceptualization of the afflicted is stated.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The aspect called ‚Äúnon-affliction‚Äù is stated in the line:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause affliction is not observed.‚ÄùüîΩThe abandonment of the conceptualization of purification is taught in the line:

original: rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni gang rnam par byang ba'i rnam pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni gang rnam par byang ba'i rnam pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no aspect of purification.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i sems dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sems dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the afflicted mind is not observed.üîΩThe abandonment of the conceptualization of traces is taught in the line:

original: bag chags kyi rnam par rtog ba spong ba ni gang rnam pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro @87b zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bag chags kyi rnam par rtog ba spong ba ni gang rnam pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro @87b zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause aspects are not observed.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is the object of the sky, which is non-apprehensible.

original: spros pa spang ba ni gang spros pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: spros pa spang ba ni gang spros pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa ni zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The elimination of conceptual elaboration is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe aspect of conceptual elaboration.

original: spros pa thams cad bcom pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad bcom pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is the object of the destruction of all conceptual elaboration.

original: spros pa zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa chos su 'du shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa chos su 'du shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Conceptual elaboration should be understood as the perception of form, etc. as entities.

original: rang gi rtog pa spong ba ni gang rlom sems kyi rnam pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa spong ba ni gang rlom sems kyi rnam pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The elimination of one‚Äôs own conceptualization is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe absence of the aspect of conceit.

original: rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is the object of the destruction of all conceit.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni gang mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni gang mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The elimination of the conceptualization of regression is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe aspect of non-regression.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni mi g-yo ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni mi g-yo ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, this is the perfection of non-regression.

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Subh≈´ti, because of the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: de ltar de dag nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i bye brag gis lam gyi bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni bco lngar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i bye brag gis lam gyi bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni bco lngar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they are the fifteen aspects of the truth of the path, which are the antidotes to the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid bstan nas lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid bstan nas lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path should be explained.

original: de la bden pa rnams kyi don gyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa rnams kyi don gyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The order of the truths should be understood in accordance with the order of their meaning.

original: don ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is their meaning?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas kun 'byung dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas kun 'byung dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The two truths of origination and path are the causes, in terms of the side of affliction and purification.

original: sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa gnyis ni 'bras bu yin pas na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa gnyis ni 'bras bu yin pas na /
translated: The two truths of suffering and cessation are the results.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa dang bcas go rims bzhin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa dang bcas go rims bzhin //
translated: Cause, path, suffering, and cessation, in order.

original: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: They are eight, seven,

original: lnga dang bco lnga zhes sgrogs so //
analyzed: lnga dang bco lnga zhes sgrogs so //
translated: and the five and the fifteen are proclaimed.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: skabs kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the aspect of the occasion.

original: de la rgyu ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba yin te /
translated: The cause is will, passion, and delight,

original: yang srid pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yang srid pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they are the origin of renewed existence.

original: /'di ltar 'dun pa'i gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: /'di ltar 'dun pa'i gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the aspect of freedom from passion is taught as the antidote to will.

original: 'dod chags de dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩbyed 'dod pa'i dngos po'i dbang du byas nas 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni mi gnas pa'i rnam pa yin @88a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags de dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no // byed 'dod pa'i dngos po'i dbang du byas nas 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni mi gnas pa'i rnam pa yin @88a * //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of passion as an objective referent.

original: par bstan to //
analyzed: par bstan to //
translated: The aspect of non-abiding is taught as the antidote to passion, in consideration of the desire to act.

original: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the object of desire.

original: de dag la chags pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas srid pa'i gnyen po ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag la chags pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas srid pa'i gnyen po ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The aspect of peace is taught as the antidote to existence, in consideration of the absence of attachment to those.üîΩBecause of the non-apprehension of all things as conceptual entities.

original: chos thams cad ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyis mngon par byang chub pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyis mngon par byang chub pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because all dharmas are taken hold of by the suchness which is the non-erroneous full enlightenment.

original: sred pa ni ma zhi ba gtso che ba yin pas de ltar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sred pa ni ma zhi ba gtso che ba yin pas de ltar byas pa yin no //
translated: Craving is the chief of the unpeaceful, and so it is treated.

original: kun 'byung gi dbye ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi dbye ba ni gsum ste /
translated: The differentiation of the origination is threefold:

original: 'dod chags kun 'byung ba dang / zhe sdang kun 'byung ba dang / gti mug kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kun 'byung ba dang / zhe sdang kun 'byung ba dang / gti mug kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: the origination of passion, the origination of hatred, and the origination of folly.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni 'dod chags med pa'i rnam pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni 'dod chags med pa'i rnam pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The counteragents to these are taught as the aspects of non-passion,

original: 'dod chags dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of the non-apprehension of the object of passion.

original: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa de bzhin du zhes sdang med pa'i rnam pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa de bzhin du zhes sdang med pa'i rnam pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as it is in regard to the nature of passion, so it is in regard to the aspects of non-hatred and non-folly.

original: zhes sdang dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes sdang dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of the non-apprehension of the object of hatred.

original: gti mug med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: gti mug med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: The aspect of non-folly is

original: gti mug gi mun pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug gi mun pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the darkness of delusion is not apprehended.

original: rab tu skye ba ni kun du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni kun du rtog pa ste /
translated: Arising is imagination.

original: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba de'i gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnyen po yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba de'i gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnyen po yin par bstan to //
translated: The antidote to that is the absence of afflictions, which is taught as the antidote to desire, etc.

original: kun du rtog pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because imagination is not apprehended.

original: rkyen ni sems can du zhen pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin te /
analyzed: rkyen ni sems can du zhen pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin te /
translated: The condition is the clinging to sentient beings and the view of the transitory collection.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the conditions of all things.

original: gnyen po ni sems can med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gnyen po ni sems can med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The antidote is the aspect of the absence of sentient beings, which is taught as the antidote to the condition.

original: sems can dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩde ltar byas pa dang / rgyu ni gang 'dod chags dang / dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems can dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no // de ltar byas pa dang / rgyu ni gang 'dod chags dang / dga' ba'o //
translated: because sentient beings are not apprehended.üîΩThus, the cause is desire and joy.

original: kun 'byung ba ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go /
translated: The origin is desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: rab tu skye ba ni gang kun du rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni gang kun du rtog pa yin no //
translated: The arising is the imagination.

original: rkyen ni gang sems can du mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rkyen ni gang sems can du mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The condition is the attachment to sentient beings.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni brgyad du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni brgyad du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the aspects of the truth of origination are eight.

original: de la lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa la tshad med pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa la tshad med pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: Now, with regard to what is stated in terms of the truth of the path, the aspects are immeasurable.

original: chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of the arising of all things.

original: @88b sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa nyid du dgongs pa yin no //üîΩyang ji ltar na /
analyzed: @88b sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa nyid du dgongs pa yin no // yang ji ltar na /
translated: It is intended that the path is the opening for immeasurable sentient beings.

original: lam sems can dpag tu med pa'i go 'byed pa yin zhe na /üîΩmtha' gnyis su rtog pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lam sems can dpag tu med pa'i go 'byed pa yin zhe na / mtha' gnyis su rtog pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Moreover, how is the path the opening for immeasurable sentient beings?üîΩThe aspects are taught as being without the conception of the two extremes.

original: mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of the observation of the two extremes.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: because of the realization of the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: de la rigs pa gang tha dad pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la rigs pa gang tha dad pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Here, the reason is stated:

original: chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of the non-differentiation of all dharmas.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i chos nyid kyis lam ma lus pa theg pa gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i chos nyid kyis lam ma lus pa theg pa gcig pa yin te /
translated: The entire path is the One Vehicle because of the non-differentiation of dharmas.

original: de la rigs pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: de la rigs pa zhes bya na /
translated: Here, the reason is stated:

original: ci'i phyir ma lus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma lus pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it entire?

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: The reason is stated: because of the absence of the highest.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las 'das pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las 'das pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reason is stated: because of the transcendence of the enlightenment of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: theg pa dman pa 'dod pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas de la bsgrub pa ni gang rtogs pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa 'dod pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas de la bsgrub pa ni gang rtogs pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The reason is stated: because of the absence of the desire for the inferior vehicle.

original: rnam par rtog pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the non-apprehension of the conceptual differentiation of the object is apprehended.

original: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas so sor yul rtogs pa med pa'i gnas ni bsgrub pa zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas so sor yul rtogs pa med pa'i gnas ni bsgrub pa zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of the conceptual differentiation of activity is referred to as the 'basis' in the sense of the establishment of the absence of the conceptual differentiation of the object.

original: yang ji ltar na de la bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de la bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med ce na /
translated: Moreover, how can there be the absence of the conceptual differentiation of activity in regard to that?

original: dpag tu med pa rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The absence of the conceptual differentiation of the object is taught as the 'aspect' in the sense of the absence of conceptual differentiation.

original: chos thams cad kyi tshad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the non-apprehension of the measure of all dharmas is apprehended.

original: thob pa yongs su spangs pa dang / ma thob pa'i thob pa dman pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa'i rtog pa med pa sngon du 'gro bas de la nges par 'byung ba ni gang chags pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thob pa yongs su spangs pa dang / ma thob pa'i thob pa dman pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa'i rtog pa med pa sngon du 'gro bas de la nges par 'byung ba ni gang chags pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The absence of the conceptual differentiation of the inferior and superior attainment of the non-attainment and the attainment is referred to as 'the going forth' in the sense of the pre-eminence of that. The absence of attachment is taught as the 'aspect' in regard to that.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the nature of space of all dharmas is apprehended.

original: de dang de'i chos rtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩde ltar byas kyang ji ltar sems can thams cad la lam go 'byed pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sems can thams cad go 'byed pa dang / rigs @89a * //
analyzed: de dang de'i chos rtogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas / de ltar byas kyang ji ltar sems can thams cad la lam go 'byed pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sems can thams cad go 'byed pa dang / rigs @89a * //
translated: The aspects of the truth of the path are sevenfold, from the point of view of the renunciation that consists of the realization of this and that doctrine.

original: pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa gang yin pa dang / sgrub pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa gang yin ba dang / gang yang nges par 'byung ba yin pa ste /
analyzed: pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa gang yin pa dang / sgrub pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa gang yin ba dang / gang yang nges par 'byung ba yin pa ste /
translated: Even though it is so, how is it that the path is the liberator of all beings? How is it that the path liberates all beings? What is the reason? How is it the reason? What is the practice? How is it the practice? What is the renunciation?

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: The aspects of the truth of the path are sevenfold.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa la mi rtag pa rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa la mi rtag pa rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The aspects of the truth of suffering are taught to be impermanence, etc.

original: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the non-annihilation of all things.

original: 'jig pa med pa las don gzhan ma yin pa'i dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa las don gzhan ma yin pa'i dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Suffering is the aspect in the sense that it is not different from the non-existence of destruction.

original: chos thams cad gdod ma nas nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad gdod ma nas nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because all things are apprehended as primordial.

original: de dag ni bde bar phyin ci log tu mngon bar zhen pa stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bde bar phyin ci log tu mngon bar zhen pa stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because they are empty of the manifest adherence to pleasure.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because all things are apprehended as non-apprehensible.

original: bdag gi rdzas mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the substance of the self is not apprehended.

original: bdag med pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Non-self is the aspect in the sense that it is not different from the non-existence of the self.

original: chos thams cad mngon bar zhen pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon bar zhen pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because all things are apprehended as non-adherence.

original: gang rang bzhin du mngon bar zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin du mngon bar zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there is no manifest adherence to a self-nature.

original: yang ji ltar byas nas gang du brtags pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi yang chos rnams la mngon bar zhen pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar byas nas gang du brtags pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi yang chos rnams la mngon bar zhen pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that one is not attached to the characteristics of things that are investigated?

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it is by the aspect of signlessness.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because all things are taken as signless.

original: de rnams 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cessation of those is preceded by the characteristic.

original: de ltar mngon du byas pas bzhi po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa dang / yang rang bzhin gang yin pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rten can rnam par gyur pa ni lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mngon du byas pas bzhi po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa dang / yang rang bzhin gang yin pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rten can rnam par gyur pa ni lnga yin no //
translated: Thus, the four aspects such as impermanence and the five natures that are the basis of the truth of suffering are transformed.

original: de 'gog pa'i rnam pa lnga ni dngos po 'gog pa nang gi mtshan nyid can la sogs pa dngos po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum te /
analyzed: de 'gog pa'i rnam pa lnga ni dngos po 'gog pa nang gi mtshan nyid can la sogs pa dngos po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum te /
translated: The five aspects of cessation are the cessation of things, which has the characteristic of internal non-existence, etc. They are threefold by the division of things.

original: gang nang gi chos rnams kyi stong pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang nang gi chos rnams kyi stong pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the emptiness of internal phenomena is an aspect.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the non-apprehension of internal dharmas is taken as a basis.

original: phyi'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa ni rnam @89b pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa ni rnam @89b pa yin te /
translated: The emptiness of the external is a mode,

original: phyi'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the non-apprehension of external dharmas is taken as a basis.

original: phyi dang nang gi stong pa ni rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi stong pa ni rnam pa yin te /
translated: The emptiness of the internal and the external is a mode,

original: phyi dang nang gi chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the non-apprehension of internal and external dharmas is taken as a basis.

original: btags pa'i 'gog pa rnam pa brgyad ni mngon bar zhen pa'i dbye bas gnyen po rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: btags pa'i 'gog pa rnam pa brgyad ni mngon bar zhen pa'i dbye bas gnyen po rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: The eight kinds of cessation of conceptual differentiation are the eight kinds of counteragent in regard to the differentiation of adherence.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang stong pa nyid ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang stong pa nyid ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The cessation of the adherence to emptiness is that which has been taught as the emptiness of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the non-apprehension of the emptiness of emptiness is taken as a basis.

original: 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam mchog yin gyi mngon par nga rgyal ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam mchog yin gyi mngon par nga rgyal ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is better to have the view of a person as large as Mount Meru than to be arrogant about one‚Äôs superior view.

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba yin bar bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba yin bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the view of emptiness is the antidote to the view of emptiness.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang chen po stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang chen po stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The cessation that is the antidote to the attachment to the shape of the physical cosmos is the emptiness of the great.

original: chen po stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is because the emptiness of the great is taken as an object.

original: phyogs dang / mtshams stong pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang / mtshams stong pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is because the emptiness of the directions and sub-directions is taken as an object.

original: don dam par mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The cessation that is the antidote to the attachment to the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: It is because the emptiness of the ultimate, which is not an object, is taken as an object.

original: / de la stong pa nyid du lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: / de la stong pa nyid du lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The view of emptiness is the antidote to the view of emptiness.

original: don dam pa ni gnyen po ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni gnyen po ma yin te /
translated: The ultimate is not an antidote.

original: yongs su grub pa tsam yin te de ni stong pa nyid dang // don dam par mngon bar zhen pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa tsam yin te de ni stong pa nyid dang // don dam par mngon bar zhen pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: It is the mere perfected nature, and it is the special object of the notional attachment to emptiness and the ultimate.

original: 'dus byas su mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang 'dus byas stong pa nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus byas su mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang 'dus byas stong pa nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The cessation of the notional attachment to the conditioned is the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the emptiness of the conditioned is apprehended as non-apprehension.üîΩThe cessation of the notional attachment to the unconditioned is the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas su mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the unconditioned is apprehended as non-apprehension.üîΩThe cessation of the notional attachment to permanence and annihilation is the emptiness of what is absolute.

original: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang shin tu stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang shin tu stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the absolute is apprehended as non-apprehension.

original: mtha' ni mtha' las 'das pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma 'khor bar mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni gang thog @90a * //
analyzed: mtha' ni mtha' las 'das pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma 'khor bar mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni gang thog @90a * //
translated: The extreme is asserted as beyond the extreme, and the cessation of the attachment to a beginning and end in cyclic existence is the aspect of the emptiness of beginningless and endless.

original: ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught: ‚ÄúThe emptiness of beginningless and endless is the aspect of the emptiness of beginningless and endless.‚Äù

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the emptiness of beginningless and endless is apprehended as non-apprehensible.üîΩThe cessation of the attachment to the aspects of the factors of enlightenment that are realized in abundance as having the characteristic of non-rejection is the aspect of the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: mang du rtogs par byed pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang dor ba med pa stong pa nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mang du rtogs par byed pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'gog pa ni gang dor ba med pa stong pa nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught: ‚ÄúThe emptiness of non-rejection is the aspect of the emptiness of non-rejection.‚Äù

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the emptiness of non-rejection is apprehended as non-apprehensible.

original: de dag ni btags pa'i 'gog pa'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad ni zhi ba'i rnam bas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni btags pa'i 'gog pa'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad ni zhi ba'i rnam bas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These are the eight kinds of cessation, which are included in the category of peace.

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyi mdzad pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba des ni byed pa po 'gog pa yin te /üîΩrnam pa yin par rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyi mdzad pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba des ni byed pa po 'gog pa yin te / rnam pa yin par rig bar bya'o //
translated: The cessation of the agent is taught in the verse:

original: yul la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩbtags pa la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa'i rnam pa ni gang chos thams cad stong ba nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yul la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / btags pa la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa'i rnam pa ni gang chos thams cad stong ba nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The cessation of the object is twofold:üîΩThe cessation of error regarding the nominal is taught in the verse:

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cessation of error regarding the nominal is the emptiness of all phenomena, because all phenomena are apprehended as nonexistent.üîΩThe cessation of error regarding the mere nominal is taught in the verse:

original: chos thams cad btags pa tsam du byas pa nyid la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa ni gang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad btags pa tsam du byas pa nyid la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa ni gang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cessation of error regarding the mere nominal is the emptiness of intrinsic identity, because the mere nominal is apprehended as nonexistent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dben pa'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin 'gog pa ni gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dben pa'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin 'gog pa ni gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The cessation of the intrinsic reality of form, etc., in terms of the emptiness of intrinsic identity of form, etc., is the emptiness of non-entities.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the emptiness of non-entities is taken as the non-apprehension of non-entities.

original: yul la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'gog pa 'di gnyis ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yul la 'khrul pa'i 'gog pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'gog pa 'di gnyis ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These two types of cessation should be understood as the aspects of renunciation.

original: de ltar byas na nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po ni 'gog pa gang yin ba dang / ji ltar yang zhi ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po ni 'gog pa gang yin ba dang / ji ltar yang zhi ba yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, what is the cessation of things that have an internal nature? And how is it peace?

original: mngon par zhen pa brgyad log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa brgyad log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it turns away from the eight attachments.

original: ji ltar gya nom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gya nom pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it sublime?

original: rang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is itself.

original: yang ji ltar nges par 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar nges par 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: And how is it renunciation?

original: gnyis su 'khrul pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su 'khrul pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it stops the error of duality.

original: gang yang nges par 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang nges par 'byung zhe na /
translated: What is the escape?

original: dngos po @90b med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po @90b med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of the non-existence of things.

original: de ltar na de dag dngos po'i 'gog pa dang / byed pa po 'gog pa dang / yul la 'khrul pa 'gog pa dang / dngos po gzhan 'gog pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag dngos po'i 'gog pa dang / byed pa po 'gog pa dang / yul la 'khrul pa 'gog pa dang / dngos po gzhan 'gog pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Thus, in terms of the cessation of things, the cessation of agents, the cessation of the error of objects, and the cessation of other things,

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsum dang / brgyad dang / gcig dang / gnyis dang / gcig ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam par gyur pa ni bco lnga'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsum dang / brgyad dang / gcig dang / gnyis dang / gcig ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rten can gyi rnam par gyur pa ni bco lnga'o //
translated: there are three, eight, one, two, and one cessation, respectively. The transformation of the truth of cessation is fifteenfold.

original: lam shes pa nyid bstan nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid bstan nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having taught the knowledge of the path, the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects should be explained.üîΩIn this regard, in terms of all noble persons, it is included in the three omnisciences.

original: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas kun mkhyen rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus bar 'gyur ba yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas kun mkhyen rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus bar 'gyur ba yin pa de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
translated: from the foundations of mindfulness up to

original: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa //
translated: the end, the aspects of Buddhahood.

original: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
analyzed: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
translated: and the buddhas are the third.üîΩThey are respectively

original: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: thirty-seven, thirty-four,

original: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
translated: and thirty-nine.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: kun mkhyen gsum gyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gsum gyi bye brag gis //
translated: They are the three knowledges,

original: lam gyi bden pa dang mthun par //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa dang mthun par //
translated: in accordance with the truth of the path.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: This is the explanation.üîΩThe truth of the path is concordant with those.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam gyi bden pa ni lam 'di gsum yin te /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam gyi bden pa ni lam 'di gsum yin te /
translated: The path is these three:

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: the path of the knowledge of all aspects, the path of the knowledge of paths, and the path of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun las gzhi yongs su shes pa'i lam ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun las gzhi yongs su shes pa'i lam ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: The path of the knowledge of all aspects has thirty-seven aspects. The path of thoroughly knowing the basis is the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the aspects.üîΩThe path of thoroughly knowing the aspects is the four right efforts.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of the non-apprehension of the body, feeling, mind, and dharmas.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni gzhi yongs su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni gzhi yongs su rtog pa yin no //
translated: These four aspects are the thorough understanding of the basis.

original: rtsol ba'i lam yang dag par spong ba ni gang yang dag par spong ba ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa nyin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba'i lam yang dag par spong ba ni gang yang dag par spong ba ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa nyin no //
translated: The path of striving is the four right efforts, which are taught as follows:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of the non-apprehension of wholesome and unwholesome dharmas.

original: de bzhin du dngos po la yongs su brtags nas sgrib pa med pa'i spong ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po la yongs su brtags nas sgrib pa med pa'i spong ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: Thus, having thoroughly examined the thing, one strives with the striving of abandonment free from obscurations.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path of purification of concentration is the four bases of supernatural powers, which are taught as follows:

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / @91a * //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / @91a * //
translated: will, striving,

original: dpyod pa rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because they are the supports for the nondiscernment of the investigations.

original: de bzhin du sgrib pa yongs su sbyong bas ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas de dag gi gnas pa las su rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrib pa yongs su sbyong bas ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas de dag gi gnas pa las su rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the path of thorough preparation is the faculties, because they make the states of the latter suitable by way of aspiration, etc.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa dang 'brel ba'i lam dbang po rnams ni gang dbang po'i rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa dang 'brel ba'i lam dbang po rnams ni gang dbang po'i rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path connected with the realization of the ƒÅryas is the powers, because they are the aspects of the powers.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because they are the supports for the nondiscernment of faith, etc.

original: de ltar byas na ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam gyis de ni 'phags pa'i yang dag par skyed pa la dbang du gyur pa dro ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sbyor bas rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa dang 'brel ba'i lam ni stobs rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam gyis de ni 'phags pa'i yang dag par skyed pa la dbang du gyur pa dro ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sbyor bas rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa dang 'brel ba'i lam ni stobs rnams te /
translated: Thus, the path of thorough preparation is the faculties, because it is the cause of the generation of the ƒÅryas‚Äô correct generation. The path connected with the realization of the peak is the powers, because it is the application that precedes the heat.

original: gang stobs rnams ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang stobs rnams ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path connected with the realization of the peak is the powers, because they are the aspects of the powers.

original: stobs rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: stobs rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the powers are apprehended as non-apprehensible.

original: de ltar dbang thob nas des mjug thogs su bden pa rtogs na ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan nas bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog gi sbyor bar gyur pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i lam byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yin te /
analyzed: de ltar dbang thob nas des mjug thogs su bden pa rtogs na ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan nas bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog gi sbyor bar gyur pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i lam byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yin te /
translated: Thus, having attained mastery, if one realizes the truth immediately thereafter, then the limbs of enlightenment are the path of clear realization, because they are the path of application of the receptivity and the supreme mundane state which overpower the discordant class such as lack of faith and so on.

original: gang byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the aspects of the limbs of enlightenment are the aspects.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the limbs of enlightenment are apprehended as non-apprehensible.

original: de la dngos po so sor rang gis rig pa'i de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po so sor rang gis rig pa'i de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path of the noble eightfold path is the path that definitely leads to purity, because it is the realization of the suchness that is individually cognized by oneself.

original: gang 'phags pa'i lam ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i lam ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The noble path is the aspect.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the noble eightfold path is taken up without being objectified.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: After that, it is the outlet for purifying the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi phyogs de rnams kyi go rims ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi phyogs de rnams kyi go rims ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the order of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de ltar byas na dngos po yongs su rtog pa'i lam dang / rtsol ba'i lam dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i las kyi lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon @91b par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: de ltar byas na dngos po yongs su rtog pa'i lam dang / rtsol ba'i lam dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i las kyi lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon @91b par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam dang /
translated: In this way, the path of thorough examination of things, the path of striving, the path of the activity of purifying meditative concentration, the path of application to clear realization, the path connected with clear realization,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / nges par 'byed pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du bzhi dang / bzhi dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / lnga dang / bdun dang brgyad kyi dbye ba rnams thams cad shes pa'i lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa bdun du bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / nges par 'byed pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du bzhi dang / bzhi dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / lnga dang / bdun dang brgyad kyi dbye ba rnams thams cad shes pa'i lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa bdun du bstan to //
translated: The path of all-knowledge is taught to have thirty-seven aspects.

original: de la lam shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa drug las gnyen po'i lam ni rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: de la lam shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa drug las gnyen po'i lam ni rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: Among the six aspects of the path of knowledge of the path, the path of antidote has three aspects.

original: lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po ni stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po ni stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: The antidote to the view is emptiness.

original: mchan ma dang rtog pa'i gnyen po ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mchan ma dang rtog pa'i gnyen po ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The antidote to characteristics and conceptualization is signlessness.

original: khams gsum du smon pa'i gnyen po ni smon pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum du smon pa'i gnyen po ni smon pa med pa yin te /
translated: The antidote to aspiration for the three realms is wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: The three doors of liberation are the aspects.

original: lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / smon pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / smon pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the view, conceptualization, and wishes are not apprehended.

original: de la stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po'o //
translated: Among them, emptiness and selflessness are the first door of liberation.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa ni smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa ni smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The aspects of impermanence, suffering, cause, origination, strong generation, and condition are wishless.

original: 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa ni mtshan ma med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa ni mtshan ma med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The aspects of cessation and path should be known as signless.

original: lam gyi rtog pa med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rtog pa med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The path is signless because it is free from conceptualization.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba de dang 'di 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba de dang 'di 'gal ba med do //
translated: The signless is the aspect of peace. There is no contradiction with that.

original: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa ste /
translated: What is signless is cessation,

original: gang gi phyir lam gyis mtshan ma med par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lam gyis mtshan ma med par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path makes it signless.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa lam shes pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi spangs pa ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa lam shes pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi spangs pa ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: The result of the path of knowledge is the benefit of sentient beings, but it is not the result of abandonment.

original: sems can gyi don yang sprul pa med par ma yin pas sprul pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩgzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma zhig pa ni bdag nyid bsam gtan nam /
analyzed: sems can gyi don yang sprul pa med par ma yin pas sprul pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te / gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma zhig pa ni bdag nyid bsam gtan nam /
translated: And the benefit of sentient beings is not without emanation. Thus the path of emanation is twofold.

original: gzugs med pa'i stoms  par 'jug pa la brten nas gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon sum du byed pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i stoms  par 'jug pa la brten nas gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon sum du byed pa ste //
translated: The non-disintegration of the ideation of form is the actualization of the ideation of form based on the attainment of the meditative stabilization of the form realm or the formless realm.

original: gang gzugs can gzugs kyi kha dog bzang po dang / ngan pa rnams la lta ba'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs can gzugs kyi kha dog bzang po dang / ngan pa rnams la lta ba'o //
translated: It is the one who has form viewing forms, good and bad colors.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par zhig pa ni bdag nyid kyi de bzhin du phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byed pa ste /üîΩgang @92a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par zhig pa ni bdag nyid kyi de bzhin du phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byed pa ste / gang @92a * //
translated: The disintegration of the ideation of form is the actualization of the ideation of external form in the same way that one actualizes the ideation of form internally.

original: gis nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gis nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is the one who does not have form internally but views forms externally.üîΩThis is stated in the s≈´tras.

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since these two are the antidotes to the obscurations to emanation, they should be understood as the second door of liberation.

original: sprul pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of afflicted emanations:

original: sdug pa'i gzugs la dga' ba dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs su sprul pa la mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i gzugs la dga' ba dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs su sprul pa la mi dga' ba'o //
translated: the pleasure of emanating a beautiful form and the displeasure of emanating an ugly form.

original: de'i gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i lus kyis mngon sum du rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i lus kyis mngon sum du rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The antidote to those is the statement, ‚ÄúOne abides in the complete actualization of the liberation of beauty with the body.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang // gcig la gcig rjes su 'brel ba'i shes pa la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pas ci 'dod pa'i gzugs la lhag par mos pa la dbang thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang // gcig la gcig rjes su 'brel ba'i shes pa la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pas ci 'dod pa'i gzugs la lhag par mos pa la dbang thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains the discernment of a single taste of mutual dependence through the mutual dependence of beautiful and ugly forms of oneself and through the knowledge of mutual dependence, one obtains power over the imagination of whatever form one desires.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam rnam pa gnyis las thar pa'i cha dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam rnam pa gnyis las thar pa'i cha dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The path of the two kinds of abiding in comfort in this life is the four formless meditative attainments.

original: zhi bar gnas pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa chags pa med pa'i phyir ni 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa chags pa med pa'i phyir ni 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cessation of ideation and feeling is so called because it is the cessation of the obscurations to the abiding in comfort of liberation.

original: gzhan gyi sprul pa'i dbang du byas pa gsum dang / bdag gi don mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa gzhan gyi ched du byas pa'i dbang du bya ba'i lam lnga ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sprul pa'i dbang du byas pa gsum dang / bdag gi don mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa gzhan gyi ched du byas pa'i dbang du bya ba'i lam lnga ste /
translated: The other three are from the point of view of the emanation of others, and the five paths from the point of view of the emanation of oneself for the sake of others.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the eight liberations.

original: de bas na rnam par thar pa brgyad ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par thar pa brgyad ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the eight liberations are the aspects.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because they are taken as the object of the eight liberations.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supramundane path is the nine serial absorptions, because one obtains the supramundane path through the absorption of cessation.

original: gang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The nine serial absorptions are the aspects, as has been taught.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the nine serial absorptions.

original: spong ba'i lam bden pa bzhi'i rten can de ma thag pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: spong ba'i lam bden pa bzhi'i rten can de ma thag pa'i lam yin te /
translated: The path of abandonment is the proximate path, which has the four truths as its support.

original: gang bden pa @92b bzhi ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang bden pa @92b bzhi ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The four truths are the aspects, as has been taught.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of origination and cessation.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
translated: The path of buddhahood is the ten perfections.

original: gang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan to //
translated: The ten perfections are the aspects.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the ten perfections are not apprehended.

original: de ltar na gnyen po'i lam dang / sprul pa'i lam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / spong ba'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam ste ;
analyzed: de ltar na gnyen po'i lam dang / sprul pa'i lam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / spong ba'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam ste ;
translated: Thus, the path of the antidote, the path of emanation, the path of ease in this life, the supramundane path, the path of abandonment, and the path of the Buddha.

original: de dag gi dbang du mdzad nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsum dang / gsum dang / lnga dang / dgu dang / bzhi dang / bcu ste /
analyzed: de dag gi dbang du mdzad nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsum dang / gsum dang / lnga dang / dgu dang / bzhi dang / bcu ste /
translated: With regard to those, in order, there are three, three, five, nine, four, and ten.

original: lam shes pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the aspects based on the knowledge of paths are thirty-four.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ni shin tu phul du byung ba'i phyir gcig nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ni shin tu phul du byung ba'i phyir gcig nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: In that, the path of omniscience is indeed one, because it is extremely sublime.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa'i dbye ba thun mong ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa'i dbye ba thun mong ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The uncommon divisions should be mentioned by way of the divisions of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: 'dir stobs bcu ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir stobs bcu ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Here, the ten powers are the aspects.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of taking hold of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi rnam pa chos nyid thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam pa chos nyid thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Because of attaining the reality of the aspects of phenomena.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the aspects of the path is taken as the non-apprehension.

original: lam thams cad mngon par shes pa'i dbang du byas nas so sor rig pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lam thams cad mngon par shes pa'i dbang du byas nas so sor rig pa ni rnam pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The individual awareness of all paths is taken as the aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of taking hold of the non-attachment and non-obstruction of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: thams cad kyi grangs dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yul gyi skad rnams dang / chos rab tu dbye ba'i yul la go rims bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa ye shes kyi rtogs pa nyams su myong ba chags pa med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: thams cad kyi grangs dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yul gyi skad rnams dang / chos rab tu dbye ba'i yul la go rims bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa ye shes kyi rtogs pa nyams su myong ba chags pa med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The realization of the four correct knowledges is the experience of the knowledge of the number of all things, the characteristics of all phenomena, the languages of all lands, and the classification of all phenomena, because it is unattached and

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is unobstructed due to the elimination of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni rnam pa yin te /
translated: The distinct qualities of the Buddha are the aspects.

original: zhes bstan pa ma yin no //üîΩchos thams cad las 'das pa nye @93a * //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ma yin no // chos thams cad las 'das pa nye @93a * //
translated: This is not taught.

original: bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because they are taken as surpassing all phenomena.üîΩIn this regard, the distinct qualities of the Buddha are the aspects of the distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: ma 'dres pa de dang der mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang dang gang yin pa de de dang de las yang dag par 'das pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa de dang der mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang dang gang yin pa de de dang de las yang dag par 'das pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The distinct qualities of the Buddha are the distinct qualities of the Buddha that are not shared with others.

original: mdo las / dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa lan 'ga' grong du bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na glang po che gtum po 'am /
analyzed: mdo las / dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa lan 'ga' grong du bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na glang po che gtum po 'am /
translated: When a monk arhat who has exhausted the contaminants goes to the village for alms, he may encounter a wild elephant,

original: rta mi bgrungs pa'am /
analyzed: rta mi bgrungs pa'am /
translated: an unruly horse,

original: ba lang brdung pa'am /üîΩkhyi za le ba dang bcas par 'gro ba dang / tshang tshing ngam /
analyzed: ba lang brdung pa'am / khyi za le ba dang bcas par 'gro ba dang / tshang tshing ngam /
translated: a bull,

original: tsher ma'i nags su 'gro ba dang / sprul nag po la rkang pas brdzi ba dang / de lta bu'i tshul gyis khyim du zhugs pa dang / gang na bud med kyi yul mi rigs par smra bas mgron du bos pa'am /
analyzed: tsher ma'i nags su 'gro ba dang / sprul nag po la rkang pas brdzi ba dang / de lta bu'i tshul gyis khyim du zhugs pa dang / gang na bud med kyi yul mi rigs par smra bas mgron du bos pa'am /
translated: a dog or a snake, or he may enter a house where a black snake is lying on the path, or he may be invited to the house of a woman who speaks inappropriately,

original: dgon pa'am / yang na lam gol bar 'gro zhing /
analyzed: dgon pa'am / yang na lam gol bar 'gro zhing /
translated: or he may go to a remote place or a wrong path.

original: lam bor ba dang / rkun po dang / dgra dang bcas par 'gro ba dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / gzhan gyi chung ma dag gis de de ltar bsten pa na dgra bcom pa ni 'khrul par 'gyur gyi de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o zhes gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: lam bor ba dang / rkun po dang / dgra dang bcas par 'gro ba dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / gzhan gyi chung ma dag gis de de ltar bsten pa na dgra bcom pa ni 'khrul par 'gyur gyi de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o zhes gsungs pa dang /
translated: When arhats are attended by such people, they may make mistakes, but the TathƒÅgata is never like that in any way.

original: gzhan yang 'ga' zhig tu dgra bcom pa dgon pa nags khrod stug por 'gro ba na lam nor ba dang / khang pa stong par sgra sgrogs pa dang / ku co 'don par byed pa dang / snying rje rje ltar 'o dod 'bod pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'ga' zhig tu dgra bcom pa dgon pa nags khrod stug por 'gro ba na lam nor ba dang / khang pa stong par sgra sgrogs pa dang / ku co 'don par byed pa dang / snying rje rje ltar 'o dod 'bod pa dang /
translated: Moreover, when arhats go to the forest or thick jungle, they may get lost on the path, shout in an empty house, wail pitifully,

original: bag chags kyi nyes pa kun du bskyod pas nyon mongs pa dang / rta gad chen pos dgod cing so ston pa dang / steg tshul du 'dzum yang nye bar ston to //
analyzed: bag chags kyi nyes pa kun du bskyod pas nyon mongs pa dang / rta gad chen pos dgod cing so ston pa dang / steg tshul du 'dzum yang nye bar ston to //
translated: or laugh loudly, showing their teeth, and even smile arrogantly, because their latent tendencies are disturbed.

original: de lta bu'i cha dang ldan pa'i ca co de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i cha dang ldan pa'i ca co de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have such talk, which is a part of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have a lapse of memory.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis byas pa'i ngag gi rjes su 'gro ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis byas pa'i ngag gi rjes su 'gro ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not have speech that is a consequence of a mind affected by the afflictions.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la gcig tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bskyed cing phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes can yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la gcig tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bskyed cing phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes can yin la /
translated: Moreover, the Arhat generates the notion that the aggregates are completely disagreeable and has the notion that nirvƒÅ·πáa without residual aggregates is peace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po dang / mya ngan las 'das pa sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po dang / mya ngan las 'das pa sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have the notion that the aggregates and nirvƒÅ·πáa are various.

original: btang snyoms mchog gis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms mchog gis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He abides in the highest equanimity.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni snyoms par zhugs nas mnyam par gzhag pa yin gyi ldang ba na mnyam @93b par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni snyoms par zhugs nas mnyam par gzhag pa yin gyi ldang ba na mnyam @93b par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the Arhat, having entered meditative equipoise, is in meditative equipoise, but when he arises from meditative equipoise, he is not in meditative equipoise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du thugs mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du thugs mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have a mind that is not in meditative equipoise at any time.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor brtags nas sems can gyi don byed pa la btang snyoms su byed kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor brtags nas sems can gyi don byed pa la btang snyoms su byed kyi /
translated: Moreover, the Arhat is indifferent to the benefit of sentient beings, having examined it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di ni 'di lta bu'i tshul can zhes so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di ni 'di lta bu'i tshul can zhes so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have an indifference that does not examine, thinking, ‚ÄúThis one is of this kind.‚Äù
