original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, the Arhat, beginning with the purification of the obscurations to the knowable,

original: ma thob pas yongs su nyams pas 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las yongs su nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: ma thob pas yongs su nyams pas 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las yongs su nyams pa yin te /
translated: has a degeneration of the attainment, and a degeneration of aspiration, effort, mindfulness, samƒÅdhi, wisdom, and liberation.

original: nyams pa drug po de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
analyzed: nyams pa drug po de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have those six degenerations.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni res 'ga' lus kyi dge ba'i las la 'jug //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni res 'ga' lus kyi dge ba'i las la 'jug //
translated: Moreover, the Arhat sometimes engages in virtuous physical actions,

original: res 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: and sometimes in neutral actions.

original: ngag dang yid kyi las la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi las la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the actions of speech and mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni las gsum char yang ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni las gsum char yang ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa mi mnga'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have indeterminate actions, because his three kinds of actions are preceded by and follow after knowledge.

original: de la ye shes kyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ye shes kyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: They are preceded by knowledge because they are motivated by knowledge.

original: ye shes dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: ye shes dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: They follow after knowledge because they are exercised in association with knowledge.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni dus gsum gyi dngos po 'bad pa med par shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni dus gsum gyi dngos po 'bad pa med par shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the Arhat does not know the things of the three times without effort.

original: gang gis 'di dag la chags pa dang / thogs pa'i ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi gang gis 'di dag la chags pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mthong ba 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di dag la chags pa dang / thogs pa'i ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi gang gis 'di dag la chags pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mthong ba 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the Arhat is obstructed and attached, because it is not engaged in the vision of the knowledge that is neither obstructed nor attached.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'bad pa med par yang dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'bad pa med par yang dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa yin no //
translated: The Tathagata has penetrated all things of the three times without effort.

original: de bas na bco brgyad po de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na bco brgyad po de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, these eighteen are called the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: med pa'i rnam pa ni gang de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i rnam pa ni gang de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of non-existence is the aspect of suchness, as stated.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa de bzhin nyid du nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa de bzhin nyid du nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is taken up as suchness by all Buddhas.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba'i rnam pa ni rang byung gi rnam pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩchos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung @94a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba'i rnam pa ni rang byung gi rnam pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no // chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba dmigs su med pa nye bar bzung @94a * //
translated: The aspect of not going by other conditions is the aspect of self-arising, as stated.

original: ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is taken up as the non-apprehension of mastery over all dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: The aspect of Buddhahood is this perfection of wisdom of the Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows.

original: sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the Buddha.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon bar byang chub pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon bar byang chub pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Subhuti, because of the direct realization of the aspects of all dharmas.

original: de dag de ltar byas na ji ltar stobs la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de rnams ni de bzhin nyid dang / gang gis chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i rang byung dang / gang gi ched du chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba rnams go rims bzhin du bcu dang /
analyzed: de dag de ltar byas na ji ltar stobs la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de rnams ni de bzhin nyid dang / gang gis chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i rang byung dang / gang gi ched du chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba rnams go rims bzhin du bcu dang /
translated: When they are so, then the divisions and natures of the aspects such as the powers, which are ten,

original: bzhi dang / bzhi dang / bco brgyad dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
analyzed: bzhi dang / bzhi dang / bco brgyad dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
translated: four, four, eighteen, one, one, and one, respectively, are suchness,üîΩself-arising, and the purpose for which all dharmas are fully awakened to.
